original: re zhig med pa gsal bar sus kyang thos par mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig med pa gsal bar sus kyang thos par mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: For a while, no one will hear of my inexistence.

original: bdag gi skyon yang sba bya zhing //
analyzed: bdag gi skyon yang sba bya zhing //
translated: I will conceal my faults

original: ji ltar gsal bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar ro //
translated: so that they will not be revealed.

original: bdag ni mchod 'gyur 'di la min //
analyzed: bdag ni mchod 'gyur 'di la min //
translated: I will be honored, not he.

original: yun ring zhes bya ba ni dus ring po'o //
analyzed: yun ring zhes bya ba ni dus ring po'o //
translated: For a long time means for a long period of time.

original: ngag gi rtsod pa ni 'gro ba kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ngag gi rtsod pa ni 'gro ba kun gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The dispute about speech is stated in the line beginning, “I will dispute with all the world.”

original: ji ltar bdag gis rtsod pa yin pa de ltar bstan nas /🔽de bzhin du lus kyi rtsod pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis rtsod pa yin pa de ltar bstan nas / de bzhin du lus kyi rtsod pa ni /
translated: Having shown how there is a dispute about speech,🔽he shows how there is a dispute about the body:

original: 'di las bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di las bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: “I will dispute with my own body.”

original: khong du chud par sla'o //🔽rtsod pa ni brdzun pa nyid ni /🔽yid khyod rang don byed 'dod pas //
analyzed: khong du chud par sla'o // rtsod pa ni brdzun pa nyid ni / yid khyod rang don byed 'dod pas //
translated: The meaning is easy to understand.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The dispute about falsehood is stated in the lines beginning, “You, mind, desiring to accomplish your own purpose. . . .”

original: rang gi don byed 'dod pa ni shes par byed 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig ni /
analyzed: rang gi don byed 'dod pa ni shes par byed 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig ni /
translated: Desiring to accomplish your own purpose means desiring to make yourself known.🔽The suffering of only that is the suffering of all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis kho bos de ltar gnod par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyis kho bos de ltar gnod par byas pa yin no //
translated: I have harmed you in that way.

original: de ltar nges par zhes bya ba ni rang gi don bzhin du gzhan dag gi don la ste /
analyzed: de ltar nges par zhes bya ba ni rang gi don bzhin du gzhan dag gi don la ste /
translated: Thus, “in this way” refers to one’s own aim and the aim of others.

original: bdag dang gzhan brje ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan brje ba la yang ngo //
translated: “Exchanging self and other” also refers to this.

original: rtsod pa la sogs pa spong ba ni rnam pas bdag gi don nyid ma yin pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rtsod pa la sogs pa spong ba ni rnam pas bdag gi don nyid ma yin pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one abandons disputes, etc., is this not one’s own aim?

original: de'i phyir thub pa'i bka' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thub pa'i bka' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “The speech of the Sage,” etc.

original: de'i yon tan ni gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i yon tan bdag dang gzhan brje ba'i yon tan las so //🔽phyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
analyzed: de'i yon tan ni gzhan gyi don la 'jug pa'i yon tan bdag dang gzhan brje ba'i yon tan las so // phyis zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'am /
translated: Its excellence is due to the excellence of engaging the aims of others and the excellence of exchanging self and other.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la'o //
translated: “Later” refers to the stage of the bodhisattva or the stage of the Buddha.

original: mi slu ba'i bden pa 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan brje bar byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i bden pa 'di zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan brje bar byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of nondeception, i.e., the desire to exchange self and other.

original: gal te sngon byas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te sngon byas par gyur na ni /
translated: If one has practiced it in the past,

original: sangs rgyas dang 'brel ba'i phun sum bde min pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang 'brel ba'i phun sum bde min pa /
translated: one will not be deprived of the excellence of the Buddha

original: 'di 'dra gnas skabs srid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di 'dra gnas skabs srid mi 'gyur //
translated: and will not be deprived of such a state.

original: gzhan gyi don la chags pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la chags pa'o //
translated: It is the attachment to the aims of others.

original: 'on kyang sangs rgyas nyid kyi bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba dang rang dang gzhan gyi don du yang dag par gyur na /
analyzed: 'on kyang sangs rgyas nyid kyi bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i bde ba dang rang dang gzhan gyi don du yang dag par gyur na /
translated: But if it is the bliss of perfect buddhahood, the bliss of benefit for oneself and others,

original: kye yid khyod ji ltar de mi byed //
analyzed: kye yid khyod ji ltar de mi byed //
translated: then, O mind, why do you not do it?

original: de bas 'di ltar gzhan dag gi / zhes bya ba la sogs @64b pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas 'di ltar gzhan dag gi / zhes bya ba la sogs @64b pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, as it is said,

original: tshigs su bcad pa de dag ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de dag ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The meaning of these verses is easy to understand.

original: mchog dang par ma la bltas nas //🔽gzhan gyi grags pa lhag brjod pas //
analyzed: mchog dang par ma la bltas nas // gzhan gyi grags pa lhag brjod pas //
translated: Having seen the best and the worst,🔽one should speak of the excellence of others.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi grags pa lhag par brjod pa yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi grags pa lhag par brjod pa yis //
translated: By speaking of the excellence of others,

original: bdag grags dri ma can du gyis //
analyzed: bdag grags dri ma can du gyis //
translated: one should make one's own excellence stainless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni thos pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they possess the qualities of learning, etc.🔽In order to demonstrate that they are not equal,

original: de dag mnyam pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag mnyam pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: 'di ni skyon can rang bzhin gyis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon can rang bzhin gyis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This one is faulty by nature,

original: so so'i skye bo'i yon tan ni phal cher rgyun chad pa nyid kyi phyir glo bur ba yin no //🔽glo bur ba'i yon tan de dag gi cha ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i yon tan ni phal cher rgyun chad pa nyid kyi phyir glo bur ba yin no // glo bur ba'i yon tan de dag gi cha ste /
translated: The virtues of the ordinary man are adventitious, for the most part, because they are interrupted.

original: phyogs gcig gis bdag la khyod kyis mi bstod do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig gis bdag la khyod kyis mi bstod do //
translated: You do not praise yourself on the basis of those adventitious virtues,🔽because they are not always present.

original: so so skye bo ni skyon gyi rang bzhin yin pas na /
analyzed: so so skye bo ni skyon gyi rang bzhin yin pas na /
translated: The ordinary man is by nature faulty.

original: 'di ni skyon can rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni skyon can rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the faulty man.

original: yon tan gang dag gzhan la yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gang dag gzhan la yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the virtues are in others, he says:🔽How can you praise yourself

original: 'di'i yon tan ci nas kyang //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i yon tan ci nas kyang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: for virtues that are in others?

original: gnod byas ni sdug bsngal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnod byas ni sdug bsngal bar byas pa'o //
translated: Harm is suffering.

original: gnod de ste /
analyzed: gnod de ste /
translated: That harm

original: sdug bsngal bdag nyid la ni 'bab par gyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag nyid la ni 'bab par gyis //
translated: falls on you.

original: sems can gyi don ni rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don ni rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is the reason.

original: ji ltar gzhol bar bya zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhol bar bya zhe na //
translated: How should you apply yourself?🔽He says:

original: bag ma sar pa'i tshul bzhin du //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: bag ma sar pa'i tshul bzhin du // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Like a newlywed bride.

original: / ngo tsha ni 'dzom zhing bag 'khums pa'o //
analyzed: / ngo tsha ni 'dzom zhing bag 'khums pa'o //
translated: Here, shame is bashfulness and embarrassment.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ni gnya' grag 'gyur tshul du //
analyzed: 'di ni gnya' grag 'gyur tshul du //
translated: This is the way to subdue the mind,

original: shed bskyed par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: shed bskyed par ni mi bya'o //
translated: not by indulging in self-contempt.

original: 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: This is how it is done.

original: khyod kyis de ltar gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bdag dbang du gyur par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis de ltar gnyen po'i phyogs kyis bdag dbang du gyur par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: You should bring the mind under control by means of the counteractive forces.

original: ji skad smras nas she na /
analyzed: ji skad smras nas she na /
translated: What is it that is said?

original: 'on te de ltar brtags kyang ni //
analyzed: 'on te de ltar brtags kyang ni //
translated: If, even though you examine it in this way,🔽the mind does not submit to you,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then,

original: kye gal te sems khyod de ltar mi byed na //🔽khyod la nyes pa kun bsten pas //
analyzed: kye gal te sems khyod de ltar mi byed na // khyod la nyes pa kun bsten pas //
translated: O mind, since you do not act in this way,🔽you are to be destroyed,

original: khyod ni tshar gcad bya bar zad //
analyzed: khyod ni tshar gcad bya bar zad //
translated: since you are the basis of all faults.

original: ces pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: mi nus pa ni bsgrub par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: mi nus pa ni bsgrub par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to accomplish what is impossible.

original: nyon mongs pa ni dub pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni dub pa'o //
translated: Affliction is fatigue.

original: bsam pa nyams pa ni bsam pa chad pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa nyams pa ni bsam pa chad pa'o //
translated: A broken resolve is a shattered intention.

original: re thag chad pa ni 'dod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: re thag chad pa ni 'dod pa med pa ste /
translated: Hopelessness is the absence of desire.

original: nus pa dang mi nus ba'i dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: nus pa dang mi nus ba'i dngos po thams cad do //
translated: All things are possible or impossible.

original: de yi phun tshogs ma spyad pa //
analyzed: de yi phun tshogs ma spyad pa //
translated: Not enjoying its abundance,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: this is

original: phun sum tshogs pa lhag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa lhag par gyur pa'o //
translated: an abundance that is excessive.

original: lus kyi zhes bya ba ni sems dang bcas pa'i ste //
analyzed: lus kyi zhes bya ba ni sems dang bcas pa'i ste //
translated: “Of the body” means of the body together with the mind.

original: @65a * // gzhan gyi 'dod pa 'phel bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @65a * // gzhan gyi 'dod pa 'phel bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not proper to increase the desires of others.

original: dngos po nus pa bzang po la ji ltar re thag chad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po nus pa bzang po la ji ltar re thag chad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one despair of a good object that is capable?

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “If someone,” etc.

original: de ni dngos po bzang po yin //
analyzed: de ni dngos po bzang po yin //
translated: That is a good object.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: gang zhig yid 'ong zhes bya ba yid du 'ong ba yul du byas nas mi 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig yid 'ong zhes bya ba yid du 'ong ba yul du byas nas mi 'jigs pa'o //
translated: “If someone, having made something pleasant an object,” i.e., having made something desirable an object, is fearless.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni 'dzin pa don med par don med pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir bzang po nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni 'dzin pa don med par don med pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir bzang po nyid yin pas so //
translated: Because concentration is a good cause, since it is the cause of the non-meaninglessness of the apprehension of an object.

original: nus pa'i dngos po bzang po gzhan dag la 'dzin pa'am zhen par mi 'gyur na yang rang bzhin gyi lus la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa'i dngos po bzang po gzhan dag la 'dzin pa'am zhen par mi 'gyur na yang rang bzhin gyi lus la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Even if one does not apprehend or cling to another good object that is capable, why does one not apprehend one’s own body?

original: tha mar thal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha mar thal ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “In the end, it becomes ashes,” etc.

original: lus tshig pa de rlung la sogs pas tha mar thal ba'i mthar gtugs shing bcom par gyur pa de nyid yang srid par mi 'byung ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: lus tshig pa de rlung la sogs pas tha mar thal ba'i mthar gtugs shing bcom par gyur pa de nyid yang srid par mi 'byung ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The body, which is burned, is finally reduced to ashes by the wind, etc. , and is destroyed. That which does not arise again is called “nirvana. ”

original: gzhan gyis bskyod bya ba ni spyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyod bya ba ni spyis so //
translated: “ Moved by another” means moved by a stick, etc.

original: 'dir gson po la kun nas 'dzin par rigs sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gson po la kun nas 'dzin par rigs sam zhe na /
translated: Here, is it proper to cling to the living body?

original: mi g-yo phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mi g-yo phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “The unmoving, etc. ”

original: de ltar yang 'di la bdag ces bya ba zhen pa'i ngar 'dzin pa ni thams cad du don med pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'di la bdag ces bya ba zhen pa'i ngar 'dzin pa ni thams cad du don med pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to show that the conception of “I” is always the cause of meaninglessness,

original: ci'i phyir na 'khrul 'khor 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na 'khrul 'khor 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Why is this machine, etc. ”

original: kyi hud ces bya ba ni skye bo ste /
analyzed: kyi hud ces bya ba ni skye bo ste /
translated: “ Alas! ” refers to people.

original: nga rgyal sel mi byed /
analyzed: nga rgyal sel mi byed /
translated: “ Pride” is not removed.

original: 'on kyang rang gi sa bon gyi rgyun rgyun chad pas bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi sa bon gyi rgyun rgyun chad pas bsal bar bya'o //
translated: However, it is removed by the cessation of the continuum of its own seed.

original: 'dir ji ltar na 'dzin pa don med pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar na 'dzin pa don med pa'i rgyu yin zhe na /
translated: Here, how is the conception of “I” the cause of meaninglessness?

original: lus kyi kha ta byas pa yis //
analyzed: lus kyi kha ta byas pa yis //
translated: “ By the advice of the body, etc. ”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: phyogs 'dzin pa med na yang rlung la sogs pa 'khrugs pas khro bar 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽rjes su chags dang khong khro ba //
analyzed: phyogs 'dzin pa med na yang rlung la sogs pa 'khrugs pas khro bar 'gyur ro zhe na / rjes su chags dang khong khro ba //
translated: If one is not partisan, one may become angry because of the disturbance of the wind element, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, Attachment and anger, and so on.

original: 'di la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba de dag ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba de dag ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of attachment and anger here?

original: las kyi rlung la sogs pa 'khrugs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: las kyi rlung la sogs pa 'khrugs pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that the disturbance of the wind element, and so on, is the cause.

original: de ltar bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus 'di'i don du'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag gi lus 'di'i don du'o //
translated: Thus, for my sake means for the sake of this body of mine.

original: skye bo gang la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba byed na yang 'di la byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skye bo gang la rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba byed na yang 'di la byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one is attached to and angry toward a person, one thinks, He has done this to me.

original: gang zhig smod pas khro ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig smod pas khro ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, If someone is angry because of criticism, and so on.

original: khong du chud par sla'o //🔽de ltar bdag dang gzhan brje ba bya ba nan tan gyi rnam pa @65b dper byas pa /
analyzed: khong du chud par sla'o // de ltar bdag dang gzhan brje ba bya ba nan tan gyi rnam pa @65b dper byas pa /
translated: It is easy to understand.🔽Thus, the exchange of self and other is the practice.

original: de bas bdag gis dper byas pa'ang //
analyzed: de bas bdag gis dper byas pa'ang //
translated: Therefore, I will practice the exchange of self and other.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: Thus, he concludes.

original: gang phyir de ltar yin par rgyu //
analyzed: gang phyir de ltar yin par rgyu //
translated: For this reason,🔽I will follow the wise,

original: de bas byis pa'i spyod pas chog / bdag gis mkhas pa'i rjes bsnyegs te //🔽rjes su 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas byis pa'i spyod pas chog / bdag gis mkhas pa'i rjes bsnyegs te // rjes su 'jug par bya ste /
translated: and engage in their practices.

original: de'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I will follow the wise, because I will engage in their practices.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What will I do?🔽I will remember the discourse on heedfulness

original: sngar bstan pa'i /🔽bag yod gtam ni dran byas nas //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i / bag yod gtam ni dran byas nas //
translated: that was taught earlier,

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa bzlog par bya //
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa bzlog par bya //
translated: and I will overcome sleep and sloth.

original: gnyid ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyid ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba yin la /
translated: Sleep is unfitness of body and mind.

original: rmugs pa ni sems blong ba yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni sems blong ba yin te /
translated: Sloth is mental dullness.

original: de dag bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de dag bzlog pa ste /
translated: I will overcome them,

original: mkhas pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: and I will follow the wise.

original: gdams ngag med cing gnyid dang rmugs pa yod na bsgom nus par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdams ngag med cing gnyid dang rmugs pa yod na bsgom nus par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I do not have the instructions, and if I have sleep and sloth, I will not be able to meditate.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag lus pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag lus pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed One said, “Awakening depends on spiritual teachers.”

original: de ltar bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa dper byas pa /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba rnam pa gsum gyi rnam pa dper byas pa /
translated: Thus, the three aspects of the preparation for meditative concentration are illustrated.

original: de pas sgrib pa bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de pas sgrib pa bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to remove the obscurations,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: and so on, concludes.

original: sgrib pa de nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa de nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to remove those obscurations, the afflictive obscurations and the knowledge obscurations,

original: log pa'i lam las sems blan te //
analyzed: log pa'i lam las sems blan te //
translated: the mind is drawn away from the wrong path.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i zhags pas drang zhing dran pa'i thag pas kun nas dam par btags la /🔽yang dag dmigs la rtag par yang //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i zhags pas drang zhing dran pa'i thag pas kun nas dam par btags la / yang dag dmigs la rtag par yang //
translated: It is drawn by the noose of proper mental attention and is bound all around with the rope of mindfulness.🔽And it is always constantly

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bdag nyid mnyam par gzhag par bya /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bdag nyid mnyam par gzhag par bya /
translated: in equipoise on the correct object.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la de kho na nyid kyi blo 'byung zhing des sgrib pa rnams spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la de kho na nyid kyi blo 'byung zhing des sgrib pa rnams spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind of suchness arises in equipoise and by that the obscurations are removed.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: This completes the eighth chapter of the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, the chapter on meditative concentration.

original: // / mnyam par 'jog pa las de kho na nyid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur bas de'i rjes thogs la shes rab bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽bsdogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon dang / bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa mchod pa'i don du /
analyzed: // / mnyam par 'jog pa las de kho na nyid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur bas de'i rjes thogs la shes rab bstan par bya ba'i phyir / bsdogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon dang / bde bar gshegs pa la sogs pa mchod pa'i don du /
translated: Since the cognition of reality arises from equipoise, in order to teach wisdom immediately after that,

original: sbyin pa la sogs rgyur bsdogs pa'i //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs rgyur bsdogs pa'i //
translated: he says, “The accumulations of generosity and so on, which are the causes for generating the mind of enlightenment and for the worship of the Sugatas and so on,

original: tshogs 'di dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'dir bshad do //
analyzed: tshogs 'di dag thams cad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don 'dir bshad do //
translated: are explained here as the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi @66a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi @66a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na shes rab ni bla na med pa'i byang chub yin la /
analyzed: kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro // yang na shes rab ni bla na med pa'i byang chub yin la /
translated: Because it is the basis of all excellence.

original: de'i don du bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i don du bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or, wisdom is unsurpassed enlightenment, and it is said that one should generate the mind of enlightenment for that purpose.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni byang chub 'dod pa'i don du gnyer ba la ni go rims 'di nyid kyis yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes nges pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni byang chub 'dod pa'i don du gnyer ba la ni go rims 'di nyid kyis yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes nges pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The word says is stated to generate certainty that this is the order for those who strive for the purpose of desiring enlightenment, but it is not for others.

original: yang dang yang du bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: It is stated again and again.

original: su zhig gis gsungs she na /
analyzed: su zhig gis gsungs she na /
translated: Who says this?

original: thub pas so //
analyzed: thub pas so //
translated: The Sage.

original: de yang 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon rtogs nas de dag yang dag par blang ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyis skye ba brgyud pa thams cad du bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems kyi phan yon rtogs nas de dag yang dag par blang ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyis skye ba brgyud pa thams cad du bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, having realized the benefits of the thought of awakening, one will be endowed with happiness in all one's successive lives through the merit of taking up those benefits and so forth.

original: bde bar 'gyur ba'i sems ni mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ba'i sems ni mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur la /
translated: The mind that is happy is equipoised in meditative stabilization, and🔽from that meditative stabilization that is equipoised, the mind that knows reality arises.

original: bsam gtan la mnyam par bzhag pa de las ni de kho na nyid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang phrad par gyur pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan la mnyam par bzhag pa de las ni de kho na nyid kyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang phrad par gyur pa la /
translated: Moreover, having met with the Buddha and so forth,

original: gdams ngag 'thob par 'gyur ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin can /
analyzed: gdams ngag 'thob par 'gyur ba ni thos pa'i rang bzhin can /
translated: one obtains instruction, which is of the nature of hearing.

original: de'i rjes la ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni bsam pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Next, the nature of reflection.

original: de nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sbyangs pa ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: de nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sbyangs pa ni bsgom pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: Then, the training on the stage of action in faith is of the nature of meditation.

original: de'i rjes la ni sa dang po thob ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni sa dang po thob ste /
translated: After that, one attains the first stage.

original: chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spong bar byed mod kyi ;
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba rtogs pa na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa spong bar byed mod kyi ;
translated: When one realizes the omnipresence of the Dharma realm, one does indeed eliminate all the passions that are to be eliminated by the path of insight.

original: de 'bras bu mngon sum du ni mi byed de /
analyzed: de 'bras bu mngon sum du ni mi byed de /
translated: But one does not actualize that fruit.

original: 'dir byams pa'i bya ba dang / sa dang 'dra ba'i smon lam chen po gnyis kyi yon tan mngon par bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: 'dir byams pa'i bya ba dang / sa dang 'dra ba'i smon lam chen po gnyis kyi yon tan mngon par bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: Here one accomplishes and abides in the good qualities of the two great vows, which are like the earth and the activity of love.

original: de yan chad kyis gzhan gyis ni sa la bsgribs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ma lus par spangs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na /🔽nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par zad pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin yang sngon gyi smon lam dang thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i 'phen shugs kyis sems can gyi don ma lus pa la dbang thob pa nyid kyis yongs
analyzed: de yan chad kyis gzhan gyis ni sa la bsgribs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ma lus par spangs pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan ma lus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na / nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par zad pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin yang sngon gyi smon lam dang thugs rje chen po la sogs pa'i 'phen shugs kyis sems can gyi don ma lus pa la dbang thob pa nyid kyis yongs
translated: Up to this point, the Buddha has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, which is characterized by the complete abandonment of all objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that are obscured with regard to the levels and by the complete perfection of all good qualities such as the strengths and fearlessnesses.

original: su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Although he has attained nirvana through the complete exhaustion of the faults of affliction together with their imprints, he does not pass into complete nirvana because he has obtained power over all the purposes of sentient beings through the momentum of his previous aspirations and great compassion.

original: gang gi phyir de med pa gzhan rnams kyis sdug bsngal zad pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med pa gzhan rnams kyis sdug bsngal zad pa'i mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, others will not attain nirvana, the exhaustion of suffering.

original: de bas na @66b de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can lam gyi bden pa dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa thos pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnam pa gsum gyis shes rab bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na @66b de kho na nyid kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid can lam gyi bden pa dang / de'i rgyur gyur pa thos pa dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa rnam pa gsum gyis shes rab bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should generate wisdom by means of the three kinds of wisdom: the wisdom of hearing, the wisdom of thinking, and the wisdom of meditation.

original: de yang bzod bya thos pa btsal par bya //
analyzed: de yang bzod bya thos pa btsal par bya //
translated: One should practice patience and seek learning.

original: de nas nags su gnas par bya //
analyzed: de nas nags su gnas par bya //
translated: Then one should dwell in the forest.

original: mnyam par gzhag la brtson bya zhing //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag la brtson bya zhing //
translated: One should strive in meditative concentration.

original: mi sdug la sogs bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mi sdug la sogs bsgom par bya //
translated: One should cultivate the meditation on foulness, etc.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni las dang po pa rnams kyis tshe gcig la bya ba'i rim pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni las dang po pa rnams kyis tshe gcig la bya ba'i rim pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained from the perspective of the stages of practice in one lifetime by beginners.

original: de bas na de yang shes rab bskyed pas dam pa rnams dang phrad cing gdams ngag thos pa la sogs pa ni de'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de yang shes rab bskyed pas dam pa rnams dang phrad cing gdams ngag thos pa la sogs pa ni de'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is also the cause of meeting with the holy ones and hearing the instructions, etc. by generating wisdom.

original: rgyu ci'i phyir bskyed par bya zhe na ;
analyzed: rgyu ci'i phyir bskyed par bya zhe na ;
translated: Why should one generate the cause?

original: sdug bsngal te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can ni de'i rgyu ma zad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal te nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can ni de'i rgyu ma zad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Suffering, which has the nature of the five aggregates of clinging, will not cease without exhausting its cause.

original: kun 'byung 'gog par 'gyur na ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung 'gog par 'gyur na ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: If the origin of suffering were to cease, then nirvana would be the cessation of suffering.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang / gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas /
translated: Nirvana is the attainment of the remainder of the aggregates and the remainderless, the nirvana of abiding and non-abiding.

original: de 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bden pa bzhir gsungs pas gtso bo yang shes rab yin no //
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams kyis 'di ltar bden pa bzhir gsungs pas gtso bo yang shes rab yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the Buddha taught the four truths in this way, wisdom is primary.

original: yang mdor bsdus nas ni shes rab bsdogs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes bya ba bden pa gnyis su 'dod pa de 'dir de rnams ni de'i khongs su chud pa yin no //
analyzed: yang mdor bsdus nas ni shes rab bsdogs pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes bya ba bden pa gnyis su 'dod pa de 'dir de rnams ni de'i khongs su chud pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, all of wisdom together with its basis is asserted to be the two truths, the so-called conventional and ultimate truths.

original: yang na shes rab ni bden pa rnams rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na shes rab ni bden pa rnams rnam par 'byed pa yin te /
translated: Wisdom is the discernment of the truths.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan pa //
translated: The teachings of the buddhas

original: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis la yang dag brten //
translated: are well founded on the two truths.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: de na 'dir bden pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de na 'dir bden pa gnyis kyi rang bzhin bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to explain the nature of the two truths,

original: don dam dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don dam dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ultimate and so on are stated.

original: 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad pa'i ming yin yang shin tu lkog tu gyur pa dngos po rnams dbyer mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin la bya bar bshad la /
analyzed: 'dir de zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad pa'i ming yin yang shin tu lkog tu gyur pa dngos po rnams dbyer mi phyed pa'i rang bzhin la bya bar bshad la /
translated: Here, although the term “that” is a name for everything, it is explained that it refers to the nature of all things, which is extremely hidden and undifferentiated.

original: de nyid ni don dam pa ste /🔽de kho na nyid yin gyi ltos pa tsam gyi de kho na nyid ni btags pa tsam du zad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam pa ste / de kho na nyid yin gyi ltos pa tsam gyi de kho na nyid ni btags pa tsam du zad pa ma yin te /
translated: That is the ultimate,

original: rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: thatness. Thatness that is merely imputed is not merely imputed, because it is the object of thought.

original: de gzhan yang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i blo ni kun rdzob ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gzhan yang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i blo ni kun rdzob ces bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of direct perception and so on, which has aspects and is without aspects, is called the conventional,

original: 'dis don dam pa thob pa la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis don dam pa thob pa la sgrib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it obscures the attainment of the ultimate.

original: gang 'di yon tan dang nyes pa 'phel ba dang 'bri bar byed pa'i mthar thug par byed pa'i rnal 'byor @67a * //
analyzed: gang 'di yon tan dang nyes pa 'phel ba dang 'bri bar byed pa'i mthar thug par byed pa'i rnal 'byor @67a * //
translated: This is the yoga that causes the increase and decrease of good qualities and faults to reach their culmination.

original: pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum de yang skad cig ma re re zhing gzhan dang gzhan yin gyi /
analyzed: pa rang rig pa'i mngon sum de yang skad cig ma re re zhing gzhan dang gzhan yin gyi /
translated: That direct perception of reflexive awareness is different from one moment to the next.

original: de nyid ma yin pa de yang don dam pa yin te /🔽de bzhin nyid 'di skad cig min //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin pa de yang don dam pa yin te / de bzhin nyid 'di skad cig min //
translated: It is not the same. That is the ultimate.

original: zhes bya ba 'og gnas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'og gnas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said below:🔽Suchness is not momentary.

original: de bas de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid bla na med pa rtogs par byed pa'i kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: de bas de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i de kho na nyid bla na med pa rtogs par byed pa'i kun rdzob yin te /
translated: Therefore, that is also a conventional truth that causes the realization of the unsurpassed suchness that transcends the world.

original: mthong ba med pa nyid de kho na mthong ba'i bla na med pa'i lam gyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa nyid de kho na mthong ba'i bla na med pa'i lam gyi bden pa yin no //
translated: The nonseeing of that is the unsurpassed truth of the path that sees suchness.

original: bden bzhi rtogs par byed pa'i kun rdzob kyang lam gyi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: bden bzhi rtogs par byed pa'i kun rdzob kyang lam gyi bden pa yin te /
translated: The conventional truth that causes the realization of the four truths is also the truth of the path.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam sogs la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam sogs la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dependent on the worldly path and so on.🔽And it is said below:

original: de yang / 'jig rten la ltos de nyid mthong //
analyzed: de yang / 'jig rten la ltos de nyid mthong //
translated: The seeing of suchness is dependent on the world.

original: zhes 'og nas ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it will be explained below.

original: de yang 'jig rten pas 'jig rten no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pas 'jig rten no //
translated: And that is the world of the world.

original: 'dir ni blo'i yul gtso bor byas par sems can la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni blo'i yul gtso bor byas par sems can la bya'o //
translated: Here, sentient beings are considered to be the primary objects of the mind.

original: rnam gnyis mthong ba ni 'jig rten tha mal pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gnyis mthong ba ni 'jig rten tha mal pa dang / rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of vision are that of ordinary people and that of yogins.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'jug pa dran pa'i thag pas btags pa dang ldan pa'i ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'jug pa dran pa'i thag pas btags pa dang ldan pa'i ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: Yogins are those who are bound by the rope of mindfulness to the union of serenity and insight.

original: ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: They are in samādhi.

original: de gang la yod pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: Those who are in samādhi are yogins.

original: tha mal pa ni rnal 'byor pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa ni rnal 'byor pa las phyi rol du gyur pa'o //
translated: Ordinary people are those who are outside of yoga.

original: de la de ltar rnam par gnas pa'i 'jig rten la rnal 'byor pas phal pa sun 'byin pa ni gang mi gtsang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la de ltar rnam par gnas pa'i 'jig rten la rnal 'byor pas phal pa sun 'byin pa ni gang mi gtsang ba nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the yogin, who is situated in this way, criticizes ordinary people, saying that they are impure.

original: dper na bum pa mi gtsang ba bug rdol can dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa mi gtsang ba bug rdol can dang 'dra'o //
translated: They are like a pot of impurities with a hole in it.

original: mi gtsang ba ni 'dir bud med do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba ni 'dir bud med do //
translated: Impurities here refer to women.

original: bya ba'i don ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the word “should” is the meaning of “must”.

original: dpe yis zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang bcas pa'i don mtshon pa'i tshul gyis ni dpyad mi dgos pa ste /
analyzed: dpe yis zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang bcas pa'i don mtshon pa'i tshul gyis ni dpyad mi dgos pa ste /
translated: “By analogy” means that it is unnecessary to analyze the meaning of the term in terms of its components.

original: gnyi ga 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir dpyad mi dgos so //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir dpyad mi dgos so //
translated: It is unnecessary to analyze it because both parties accept it.

original: de la 'jig rten tha mal pa rnams ni bud med la khrus la sogs pa byas pas gtsang ba yin no zhes smra ba na rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten mi gtsang bar mos pa'i tshul gyis sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten tha mal pa rnams ni bud med la khrus la sogs pa byas pas gtsang ba yin no zhes smra ba na rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten mi gtsang bar mos pa'i tshul gyis sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: In this regard, when ordinary worldly people say that a woman is pure because she has been washed, and so on, the yogi, the worldly one, refutes them by contemplating her as impure.

original: de yang phra rab tu mthong bas sun 'byin te /
analyzed: de yang phra rab tu mthong bas sun 'byin te /
translated: He refutes them by seeing her as subtle particles.

original: cha shas dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni mi gtsang ba ma yin te blo dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: cha shas dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni mi gtsang ba ma yin te blo dang 'dra'o //
translated: What is devoid of parts is not impure, like the mind.

original: rdul phra rab ni cha shas med pa yin la de'i tshogs pa ni bud med yin pas cha shas can ni dngos po gcig tu mi 'grub ste nags dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni cha shas med pa yin la de'i tshogs pa ni bud med yin pas cha shas can ni dngos po gcig tu mi 'grub ste nags dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since the subtle particle is partless, and the collection of those is a woman, a thing with parts is not established as a single entity, like a forest.

original: de yang sems tsam pas sun @67b 'byin te /
analyzed: de yang sems tsam pas sun @67b 'byin te /
translated: The Cittamātra refute that.

original: phyogs kyi cha yod pa'i phyir phra rab ni cha shas med pa ma yin te bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha yod pa'i phyir phra rab ni cha shas med pa ma yin te bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since it has directional parts, the subtle particle is not partless, like a pot, etc.

original: de yang dbu ma pas sun 'byin te yod pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid ma yin te sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de yang dbu ma pas sun 'byin te yod pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na nyid ma yin te sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The Madhyamika refutes this: Whatever exists is not reality, like an illusion.

original: dbu ma pa'i ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma pa'i ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam yin te /
translated: The Madhyamika’s is merely the negation of the probandum,

original: gang 'dir yod par khas len pa de yang ma btags na nyams dga' ba tsam du tha snyad la brten nas smra ste /
analyzed: gang 'dir yod par khas len pa de yang ma btags na nyams dga' ba tsam du tha snyad la brten nas smra ste /
translated: for whatever is accepted as existing here is merely pleasant to the touch when not examined, and is spoken of in dependence on convention.

original: bya ba byed pa'i phyir sgyu ma yang yod par smra ba la /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i phyir sgyu ma yang yod par smra ba la /
translated: Since it functions, an illusion also exists.

original: khyod nyid kyis sems gzhan sus kyang ma mthong yang yod par khas len pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khyod nyid kyis sems gzhan sus kyang ma mthong yang yod par khas len pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like your own mind, which no one else sees, but which you accept as existing.

original: gzhan yang khyod kyis sems med du zin kyang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa po dang / yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba gzhal bar bya ba dang / 'jal ba po dang / 'bras bur gnas pa med du zin kyang mthong ba lta bur byed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyis sems med du zin kyang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa po dang / yang dag par rig pa zhes bya ba gzhal bar bya ba dang / 'jal ba po dang / 'bras bur gnas pa med du zin kyang mthong ba lta bur byed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Moreover, even though you have no mind, you are like one who sees without the object of observation, the observer, and the correct cognition called the object of comprehension, the comprehender, and the result.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yang rim pa'am cig car bya ba byed par snang bas yang dag par yod pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bur mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po yang rim pa'am cig car bya ba byed par snang bas yang dag par yod pa'i phyir sgyu ma lta bur mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Since things such as pots appear to perform functions either sequentially or simultaneously, they are real and it is not tenable that they are like illusions.

original: dngos po rnams 'byung ba skad cig gam skad cig ma yin par skyed par byed na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams 'byung ba skad cig gam skad cig ma yin par skyed par byed na /
translated: If things are produced in a sequence of instants or non-instants,

original: rim ma ma rim pa ma yin par byed pa med pa'i skad cig ma ma yin pa ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rim ma ma rim pa ma yin par byed pa med pa'i skad cig ma ma yin pa ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra'o //
translated: they are not produced in a sequence or non-sequence, and non-instants are like sky flowers.

original: gang skad cig ma yin pa de ni skad cig ma nyid kyis lan cig kyang mi sdod na /
analyzed: gang skad cig ma yin pa de ni skad cig ma nyid kyis lan cig kyang mi sdod na /
translated: That which is an instant does not remain even for an instant due to being an instant.

original: gang las ci zhig 'byung /
analyzed: gang las ci zhig 'byung /
translated: From what would anything arise?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Cause and effect do not occur simultaneously.

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not that the right and left horns of an ox are the cause of each other.

original: med pa yang de kho na nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang de kho na nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the nonexistent the reality of things,

original: med pa ni de la ltos pa yin na dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni de la ltos pa yin na dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nonexistent is dependent on that, and it is not established as a thing.

original: de ltar na blo'i khyad par zhes pa shes rab kyi bye brag gis gong ma gong mas rnal 'byor pa sun 'byin no //
analyzed: de ltar na blo'i khyad par zhes pa shes rab kyi bye brag gis gong ma gong mas rnal 'byor pa sun 'byin no //
translated: Thus, the phrase “distinction of awareness” means that the higher and higher distinctions of wisdom refute the yogi.

original: de yang gnyi ga 'dod cing kun la grags pa'i dpes bsgrub par bya bsgrub pa'i don du dpyad mi dgos shing sun 'byin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gnyi ga 'dod cing kun la grags pa'i dpes bsgrub par bya bsgrub pa'i don du dpyad mi dgos shing sun 'byin par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is established by means of an example that is accepted by both parties and is well known to everyone. It is not necessary to analyze it, and it is a refutation.

original: de lta yin du zin kyang dbu ma pa yang 'jig rten pa ltar sun 'byin du rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin du zin kyang dbu ma pa yang 'jig rten pa ltar sun 'byin du rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, the Madhyamika can also refute the opponent in accordance with the world.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In that case, the phrase “in accordance with the world” is stated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'jig rten na mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po 'jig rten na mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin la /
translated: The things of the world, such as form, are seen by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas kyang dpag tu rung ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pas kyang dpag tu rung ba yin no //
translated: It is also possible to infer it by means of inference, etc.

original: de bas na thams @68a * //
analyzed: de bas na thams @68a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: cad du rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur par srid do snyam na /
analyzed: cad du rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur par srid do snyam na /
translated: it is possible that there will be a basis for dispute in every case.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe 'di la ni 'jig rten pa dang rnal 'byor pa dag phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i dpe 'di la ni 'jig rten pa dang rnal 'byor pa dag phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rtsod pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in this example of illusion, etc., there is no dispute between the worldly and the yogins, which is contradictory.

original: de bas na dpe 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam la snang ba'i rgyu slu ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dpe 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa tshogs pa tsam la snang ba'i rgyu slu ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this example, form, etc., are illusion because the cause of appearance is deceptive in the mere collection.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub tu zin na ji ltar na yang dag pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub tu zin na ji ltar na yang dag pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: If form, etc., are established by the valid cognitions of direct perception, etc., of their own characteristics, how can they be unreal?

original: de'i phyir gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: Therefore, the words “form, etc.” include feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: de la gzugs ni dbang po lnga po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs ni dbang po lnga po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang lus zhes bya ste /
translated: Form is the five sense faculties, called eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: de dag ni rang rang gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin du zin kyang mngon sum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pas mngon sum zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de dag ni rang rang gi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs las rjes su dpag par bya ba yin du zin kyang mngon sum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir nye bar btags pas mngon sum zhes bshad do //
translated: Although they are to be inferred from the collection of their respective consciousnesses, they are called direct perception because they are the cause of direct perception.

original: de bzhin du yul ni lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yul ni lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, there are five objects:

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ste /
translated: form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: mngon sum du bcad par bya ba yin pas na mngon sum mo //
analyzed: mngon sum du bcad par bya ba yin pas na mngon sum mo //
translated: They are direct objects, so they are direct.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas thams cad bdag nyid kyi rang rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa de nyid ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni sems dang sems las byung bas thams cad bdag nyid kyi rang rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa de nyid ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: Feeling and so on are all direct perception that is reflexive awareness of itself by mind and mental factors. That is the primary one.

original: yang gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum yin pas sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa nges pa bcas pas sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang khyad par med pas mngon sum ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: yang gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum yin pas sngon po la sogs pa'i dmigs pa nges pa bcas pas sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang khyad par med pas mngon sum ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: Moreover, since form, etc. are direct perception, the object, such as blue, is ascertained, and since there is no difference between the consciousness of blue, etc. and direct perception, direct perception is primary.

original: de bas na rab tu grags zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bas na rab tu grags zhes smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be well known.

original: blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with “intellect.”

original: de yang kun rdzob tu brdzun pa'i snang ba tsam yin te /
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob tu brdzun pa'i snang ba tsam yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is a mere false appearance in the conventional sense.

original: de'i phyir tshad mas min zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad mas min zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be not valid cognition.

original: slu ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slu ba med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means it is not non-deceptive.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rab tu grags su zin kyang brdzun yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rab tu grags su zin kyang brdzun yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that form, etc., although well known, are false?

original: de'i phyir de ni mi gtsang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mi gtsang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is impure, etc.

original: mi gtsang la sogs zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa yin la /
analyzed: mi gtsang la sogs zhes bya ba ni mi gtsang ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa yin la /
translated: Impure, etc. means impure, impermanent, suffering, and selfless.

original: gtsang sogs grags pa bzhin zhes bya ba gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag yod par grags pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du grags pa de ni brdzun yin te slu ba yin no //
analyzed: gtsang sogs grags pa bzhin zhes bya ba gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag yod par grags pa bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa mngon sum du grags pa de ni brdzun yin te slu ba yin no //
translated: Just like purity and so on, which are renowned in the world. Form and so on are renowned in the world as being pure, blissful, permanent, and having a self. But they are false and deceptive.

original: @68b de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa rnams la 'jig rten mgon po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis skad cig ma la sogs par ci'i phyir ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: @68b de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po med pa rnams la 'jig rten mgon po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis skad cig ma la sogs par ci'i phyir ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did the Lord Buddha, the Protector of the World, teach that things such as form, which do not exist, are momentary and so on?

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: thar pa 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams de kho na nyid la 'dir 'dzud cing gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pa rnams de kho na nyid la 'dir 'dzud cing gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to introduce the world, which desires liberation, to reality.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i don ni yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du yang dngos po rnams skad cig mar mgon pos bstan par mdzad pa yin gyi yang dag par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i don ni yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du yang dngos po rnams skad cig mar mgon pos bstan par mdzad pa yin gyi yang dag par ni ma yin no //
translated: The word “also” indicates that the Lord taught that things are momentary in order to ripen beings, but not because they are real.

original: de lta yin na ni kun rdzob 'dis don dam pa dang / don gyi shugs kyis 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin na ni kun rdzob 'dis don dam pa dang / don gyi shugs kyis 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then this conventional truth would be contradictory to the ultimate truth, and the meaning of the ultimate would be lost.

original: gang du tha dad pa'i blo gzhan sel bar byed pa'i yul de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: gang du tha dad pa'i blo gzhan sel bar byed pa'i yul de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
translated: The object of a different cognition that excludes other things is conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa de las gzhan du gyur pa yin pas skad cig ma yang de bzhin nyid dam /🔽yang dag pa nyid du rung ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa de las gzhan du gyur pa yin pas skad cig ma yang de bzhin nyid dam / yang dag pa nyid du rung ste /
translated: Since it is different from the ultimate truth, it is suitable to be a moment or reality.

original: cha shas med pa'i phyir bdag med pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i phyir bdag med pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Because it is partless, it is like selflessness.

original: ci'i phyir kun rdzob tu mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun rdzob tu mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not conventional?

original: rnal 'byor kun rdzob nyes med de //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor kun rdzob nyes med de // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The yogi’s convention is faultless.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyi ga de kho na nyid kyi blos brtags pa na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skad cig ma dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i blo yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa gnyi ga de kho na nyid kyi blos brtags pa na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir skad cig ma dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i blo yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When both arising and cessation are examined by the intellect of suchness, they are not inherently existent. Therefore, the intellect of momentariness and selflessness does not exist.

original: gzhan du na skad cig ma la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa'i blos mthong ba ni mig yor tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzhan du na skad cig ma la sogs pa rnal 'byor pa'i blos mthong ba ni mig yor tsam du zad do //
translated: Otherwise, the seeing of moments, etc. by the mind of the yogi would be no more than a mirage.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob ni don dam par yang 'gyur bas skad cig ma la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i kun rdzob ni don dam par yang 'gyur bas skad cig ma la sogs pa dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the conventional of the yogi becomes the ultimate, and so there is no fault of contradiction with moments, etc.

original: 'o na de nyid mthong ba zhes ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid mthong ba zhes ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well, why is it called “seeing reality”?

original: de yang 'jig rten la ltos zhes bya ba tha mal pa'i 'jig rten pa la ltos nas rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid mthong ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten la ltos zhes bya ba tha mal pa'i 'jig rten pa la ltos nas rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid mthong ba zhes bshad do //
translated: “That also depends on the world” means that from the perspective of ordinary people, the yogi is said to “see reality.”

original: gzhan du na gal te tha mal pa nyid rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten la ltos nas de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur na de'i tshe tha mal pa'i 'jig rten pas 'gal bar byas pas rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten las 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te tha mal pa nyid rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten la ltos nas de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur na de'i tshe tha mal pa'i 'jig rten pas 'gal bar byas pas rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten las 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if ordinary people were to see reality from the perspective of the yogi’s world, then since ordinary people would contradict it, the yogi’s world would be contradicted.

original: mi gtsang ba'i bud med rtogs pas mi gtsang ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i tshe 'gal bar byas par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i bud med rtogs pas mi gtsang ba la sogs par rtogs pa'i tshe 'gal bar byas par 'gyur na /
translated: When one realizes that the impure woman is impure, etc., then one would be contradicting oneself.

original: de lta bur ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na de ni 'jig rten pa la ltos nas de nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni 'jig rten pa la ltos nas de nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is seeing reality in dependence on the mundane.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten gyis tha @69a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten gyis tha @69a * //
translated: Therefore, the mundane of the yogi

original: mal pa'i 'jig rten sun 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: mal pa'i 'jig rten sun 'byin par byed do //
translated: refutes the mundane of the ordinary person.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba la ltos pa yin pas gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis rnal 'byor pa yang sun 'byin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba la ltos pa yin pas gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis rnal 'byor pa yang sun 'byin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Since it depends on seeing reality, the higher and higher distinctions refute the yogi, and so on.

original: ci ste 'dir rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten pa gnyis kyis thams cad sgyu ma lta bur brtags na de lta na ni rgyal ba yang sgyu ma dang mtshungs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci ste 'dir rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten pa gnyis kyis thams cad sgyu ma lta bur brtags na de lta na ni rgyal ba yang sgyu ma dang mtshungs par 'gyur la /
translated: But if here both the yogi and the mundane person imagine everything to be like an illusion, then in that case the Victor would be like an illusion.

original: des na sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing brdzun yin pa'i rgyal ba la mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa la bsod nams ji ltar skyed par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na sgyu ma dang 'dra zhing brdzun yin pa'i rgyal ba la mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa la bsod nams ji ltar skyed par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can one generate merit by making offerings to the Victor, etc., which are like an illusion and false?

original: dbu ma pas sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbu ma pas sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Madhyamika says, “Like an illusion, etc.”

original: ji ltar rgyal ba yod du zin kyang mchod pa la sogs pa las bsod nams ji ltar 'byung /🔽de ni ji ltar yod du zin kyang 'di ni rkyen tsam yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal ba yod du zin kyang mchod pa la sogs pa las bsod nams ji ltar 'byung / de ni ji ltar yod du zin kyang 'di ni rkyen tsam yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: How can merit arise from making offerings, etc., even if the Victor exists?🔽Just as merit arises from making offerings, etc., even if he does not exist, so also, even if he is merely an illusion, merit arises.

original: sgyu ma tsam yin yang bsod nams skye bar mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma tsam yin yang bsod nams skye bar mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dri ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dri ba'o //
translated: The question of the opponent is “If, etc.”

original: ci srid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma pa'i lan yin no //
analyzed: ci srid ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dbu ma pa'i lan yin no //
translated: The answer of the Madhyamika is “For as long as, etc.”

original: de ltar yin du chug na yang sems can rnams yun ring du gnas pa yin pas yang dag par yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug na yang sems can rnams yun ring du gnas pa yin pas yang dag par yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, sentient beings remain for a long time, and so they must exist in reality.🔽The answer of the Madhyamika is “Even though, etc.”

original: de'i phyir rgyun ring ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽rgyun ring zhes bya ba thog ma med pa'i dus dang 'brel pa'i skad cig ma gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun de ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun ring ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rgyun ring zhes bya ba thog ma med pa'i dus dang 'brel pa'i skad cig ma gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun de ni yang dag par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, Candrakīrti says, “It is not tenable to say that a long continuum . . .”

original: rgyun tsam nyid smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun tsam nyid smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A long continuum is a continuum that is connected to beginningless time and is a single moment in a series. That is not real because it is merely a continuum that is mentioned.

original: gnas pa'i rgyun skad cig ma ni sgyu ma yang yin no zhes bya bar yang dgongs so //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyun skad cig ma ni sgyu ma yang yin no zhes bya bar yang dgongs so //
translated: The point is that the continuum of an enduring moment is also an illusion.

original: de bas na sgyu ma ni rgyun yun rings su gnas su zin kyang brdzun pa yin par 'dra'o //🔽gal te de ltar 'dra na ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bsad sogs zhes smos pas /
analyzed: de bas na sgyu ma ni rgyun yun rings su gnas su zin kyang brdzun pa yin par 'dra'o // gal te de ltar 'dra na ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bsad sogs zhes smos pas /
translated: Therefore, even though an illusion endures for a long time, it is similar in being false.

original: de'i rdzas dbrog pa la sogs pa byas na sdig par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rdzas dbrog pa la sogs pa byas na sdig par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is similar in that way, then why is it not sinful to steal the illusory person’s possessions and so on, since it is said, “To kill an illusory person and so on”?

original: de'i phyir sems med phyir na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems med phyir na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore Candrakīrti says, “Because it has no mind.”

original: sgyu ma'i sems ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa gnyi ga'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i sems ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa gnyi ga'i rgyu yin na /
translated: If the mind of an illusory person is the cause of both merit and demerit,

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sgyu ma'i sems yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sgyu ma'i sems yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no illusory mind in an illusory person.

original: des na gal te khyed kyi sgyu ma'i skyes bu de dang 'dra na ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa 'byung ba de nyid srid na de yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te khyed kyi sgyu ma'i skyes bu de dang 'dra na ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa 'byung ba de nyid srid na de yin no //
translated: Therefore, if your illusory person is like that, then merit and demerit would arise from that very thing.

original: ci'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sems med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sgyu ma'i skyes bu la sems med ce na /
translated: Why is there no mind in an illusory person?

original: sngags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngags la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “because of the power of mantra, etc.”

original: @69b sogs pa'i sgras ni rnal 'byor gyi mthu la sogs pa la yang sems bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @69b sogs pa'i sgras ni rnal 'byor gyi mthu la sogs pa la yang sems bskyed pa'i mthu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the power of yoga, etc.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sprul ba'i sgyu ma ni sems dang bcas pa yin du zin kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sprul ba'i sgyu ma ni sems dang bcas pa yin du zin kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no //
translated: The illusory emanation of a Sugata, even though it has a mind, is inconceivable.

original: de ltar na ni sems can dang sgyu ma 'dra ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni sems can dang sgyu ma 'dra ba ma yin te /
translated: In that case, it is not like sentient beings and illusions,

original: sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it has a mind.

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “variety,” etc.

original: gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i rkyen gyi dngos po gcig las 'bras bu dngos po thams cad bskyed par nus pa yod pa ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgyu ma'i rkyen gyi dngos po gcig las 'bras bu dngos po thams cad bskyed par nus pa yod pa ni gang yang med do //
translated: Because there is no power at all in any one thing that is a condition of an illusion to produce all things that are effects.

original: de bas sgyu ma la de dag kyang rkyen sna tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas sgyu ma la de dag kyang rkyen sna tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs su gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are various in form because they arise from various conditions.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las don dam par chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las don dam par chos thams cad mya ngan las 'das pa yin par gsungs la /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom teaches that ultimately all things are nirvana.

original: de rnams kun rdzob tu ni 'khor bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: de rnams kun rdzob tu ni 'khor bar 'dod pas /
translated: And they are asserted to be in cyclic existence conventionally.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyang 'khor bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyang 'khor bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, it follows that even the Buddha would be in cyclic existence.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas brgal ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas brgal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the objection is stated in the verse, “If the Buddha is not in nirvana, etc.”

original: 'dir de'i lan ni rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de'i lan ni rkyen rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: The answer to that is stated in the verse, “The conditions, etc.”

original: so so'i skye bo don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin yang bag chags kyi rgyun ma chad pas kun rdzob tu 'khor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin yang bag chags kyi rgyun ma chad pas kun rdzob tu 'khor ba yin gyi /
translated: Ordinary beings are by nature in nirvāṇa ultimately, but because the stream of traces is not severed, they are in saṃsāra conventionally.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bag chags zhes bya ba'i rkyen rgyun bcad nas kun rdzob tu yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bag chags zhes bya ba'i rkyen rgyun bcad nas kun rdzob tu yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But the Bhagavān, having severed the stream of the condition called “traces,” does not arise even conventionally.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means that there is no need to mention that he does not arise ultimately.

original: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bag chags ma lus pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bag chags ma lus pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because the Bhagavān Buddha has abandoned all traces,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der 'byung bar ston cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der 'byung bar ston cing /
translated: he displays arising in this and that world system,

original: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pa'i khyad par de dang der ston par mdzad cing sems can sna tshogs pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa ni 'khor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pa'i khyad par de dang der ston par mdzad cing sems can sna tshogs pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa ni 'khor ba ma yin te /
translated: and he displays that and that special miracle and so on, and he completely fulfills the wishes of all the various sentient beings. He is not in saṃsāra.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi 'phen pa'i shugs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: It arises by the force of the impetus of former prayers,

original: rkyen ma spangs par 'byung ba ma yin pas 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: rkyen ma spangs par 'byung ba ma yin pas 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: and not by the arising of conditions, so there is no contradiction.

original: 'dir sems tsam pa na re gang 'di bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis sgyu ma de dmigs pa med na ni sgyu ma nyid du 'khrul pa yang mi @70a * //
analyzed: 'dir sems tsam pa na re gang 'di bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis sgyu ma de dmigs pa med na ni sgyu ma nyid du 'khrul pa yang mi @70a * //
translated: Here, the Cittamātra say, “If the illusion that has the character of a pot, cloth, and so on is not observed, then the error of illusion is not tenable.

original: 'thad la / 'khrul par gnas pa'i sems kyis de rtogs pa yin no zhes smra bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'thad la / 'khrul par gnas pa'i sems kyis de rtogs pa yin no zhes smra bar nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not possible to say that it is realized by a mind that abides in error.

original: khyed dbu ma pa'i 'khrul pa ni sems nyid med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na gang 'di skad du /🔽gang tshe 'khrul pa'ang med na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pa'i 'khrul pa ni sems nyid med par 'grub pa'i phyir ro // de bas na gang 'di skad du / gang tshe 'khrul pa'ang med na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because, according to you Mādhyamikas, error is established as the absence of mind itself.🔽Therefore, it is said, ‘If there is no error, then . . .’

original: de'i lan ni gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The response to that is ‘If there is no . . .’ and so on.

original: gang khyed kyi bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can du bshad pa'i sgyu ma yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang khyed kyi bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can du bshad pa'i sgyu ma yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The illusion that you say is the defining characteristic of such things as your pot and cloth does not exist.

original: gal te de yod par khas len na thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de yod par khas len na thams cad yod par smra ba'i gzhung dang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that it exists, it would follow that you are similar to the Proponents of True Existence.

original: de bas na sgyu ma de yod pa ji ltar dmigs /
analyzed: de bas na sgyu ma de yod pa ji ltar dmigs /
translated: Therefore, how can you observe that illusion to exist?

original: de'i phyir sems tsam pa'i ltar sgyu ma med pa dag ni dmigs pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems tsam pa'i ltar sgyu ma med pa dag ni dmigs pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Thus, how can the non-existent illusion be observed according to the Mind-Only?

original: kho bo cag dbu ma pa rnams kyi ni med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis 'khrul pa yang dmigs par byar rung ba yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag dbu ma pa rnams kyi ni med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis 'khrul pa yang dmigs par byar rung ba yin no //
translated: For us Madhyamikas, it is suitable to observe even the error that has the character of non-existence.
