original: gal te sems tsam pa dag sems nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa de yin mod ces zer na /
analyzed: gal te sems tsam pa dag sems nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa de yin mod ces zer na /
translated: If the Mind-Only say, “The mind itself is the aspect of the illusion,”

original: de lta yin du chug na gal te sgyu ma 'am gzhan pa'i don khyad par can yin yang yang dag par yod na de ltar rung na /
analyzed: de lta yin du chug na gal te sgyu ma 'am gzhan pa'i don khyad par can yin yang yang dag par yod na de ltar rung na /
translated: we reply, “Let us suppose that is so. If the illusion or some other special object exists in reality, that is suitable.

original: skye ba dang bral ba'i sems nyid sgyu ma yin na de'i tshe gang gis gang la dmigs te mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba dang bral ba'i sems nyid sgyu ma yin na de'i tshe gang gis gang la dmigs te mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of mind, free from arising, is an illusion, then what is seen by what?

original: sus kyang ci yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sus kyang ci yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: Nothing is seen by anything.

original: de yang 'jig rten gyi ni mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten gyi ni mgon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the protector of the world, etc.

original: ci zhig gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci zhig gsungs she na /
translated: What was said?

original: sems byed pa pos de las gzhan pa'i sems gnyis pa mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems byed pa pos de las gzhan pa'i sems gnyis pa mi mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: The mind that is the agent does not see a second mind that is different from it.

original: de ni 'dir lung yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'dir lung yin la /
translated: This is the scripture here.

original: rigs pa ni ral gri'i so ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ni ral gri'i so ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: The reasoning is stated with “The edge of a sword, etc.”

original: gang zhig bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni des gcod par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni des gcod par mi byed do //
translated: That which is itself does not cut itself.

original: dper na ral gri'i kho rang gis rang la mi gcod pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: dper na ral gri'i kho rang gis rang la mi gcod pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: For example, just as the edge of a sword does not cut itself,

original: yid kyang de bzhin te rang gis rang la dmigs par mi nus te /
analyzed: yid kyang de bzhin te rang gis rang la dmigs par mi nus te /
translated: the mind is also like that. It cannot observe itself,

original: rang la rang byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang la rang byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: de bas na nye bar mi dmigs pa'i sems de ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: de bas na nye bar mi dmigs pa'i sems de ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how can that mind, which is not observed, exist?

original: ral gri gzhan gyis mi chod pa dang 'dra bar shes pa gzhan gyis gzhan shes pa med do //
analyzed: ral gri gzhan gyis mi chod pa dang 'dra bar shes pa gzhan gyis gzhan shes pa med do //
translated: Just as a sword cannot cut itself, one consciousness cannot know another.

original: rang rig pa med na rig par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa med na rig par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if there is no self-awareness, awareness is not possible.

original: 'dir 'khrul pa'i dbang gis dogs pa gzhan skye ba gsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir 'khrul pa'i dbang gis dogs pa gzhan skye ba gsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to clarify other doubts that arise due to confusion,

original: bdag @70b gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag @70b gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “If it is said that the mind is aware of itself, etc.”

original: de lta yin na yang yid ni rang nyid rang la rig par rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang yid ni rang nyid rang la rig par rung ngo //
translated: Even so, the mind is suitable to be aware of itself.

original: dper na mar me rang la rang gsal bar snang ba dang 'dra ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mar me rang la rang gsal bar snang ba dang 'dra ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a lamp is suitable to illuminate itself,

original: sems kyang rang la rang snang du rung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyang rang la rang snang du rung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: in the same way, the mind is suitable to appear to itself.

original: 'dir dpe ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dpe ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to show that the example is not established,

original: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “A lamp does not illuminate itself, etc.”

original: mun pas bsgribs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni gsal bar byed du rung gi /
analyzed: mun pas bsgribs pa'i bum pa la sogs pa ni gsal bar byed du rung gi /
translated: A lamp is suitable to illuminate a vase, etc., that is obscured by darkness.

original: mar me ni bdag nyid bum pa ltar mun pas bsgribs pa med pas gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mar me ni bdag nyid bum pa ltar mun pas bsgribs pa med pas gsal bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But a lamp does not illuminate itself, like a vase, because it is not obscured by darkness.

original: gang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rigs pa ma yin pas gsog yin no //
analyzed: gang gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig ni rigs pa ma yin pas gsog yin no //
translated: The statement “Whatever is the intrinsic reality of something is the intrinsic reality of its cause” is illogical, and therefore it is a heap of nothing.

original: de yang 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rang bzhin gzhan dang phrad nas de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni rigs te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rang bzhin gzhan dang phrad nas de'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni rigs te /
translated: And it is not logical that something that is not of that intrinsic reality would become of that intrinsic reality by coming into contact with another intrinsic reality.

original: dper na shel de dang mi mthun pa'i sas sngon po de dang phrad na de sngon por 'gyur bar rung gi / sngon po nyid gzhan la ltos nas rang la sngon por mi byed do //
analyzed: dper na shel de dang mi mthun pa'i sas sngon po de dang phrad na de sngon por 'gyur bar rung gi / sngon po nyid gzhan la ltos nas rang la sngon por mi byed do //
translated: For example, it is possible that a crystal, which is not blue, would become blue by coming into contact with something blue, but it is not possible that blue itself would make itself blue in dependence on something else.

original: de ltar bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dag ni mar me la sogs pa la ltos nas snang ba mar me la sogs pa gzhan 'ga' ni snang ba gzhan la mi ltos par snang ba bdag nyid snang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dag ni mar me la sogs pa la ltos nas snang ba mar me la sogs pa gzhan 'ga' ni snang ba gzhan la mi ltos par snang ba bdag nyid snang bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
translated: In the same way, it is logical to say that such things as a pot appear in dependence on such things as a lamp, but it is not logical to say that such things as a lamp, which are other, appear in dependence on something else, but that such things as the lamp itself, which is not other, illuminates itself without depending on something else.

original: sngon po nyid sngon po ma yin na ni de shel dang 'dra bar bdag nyid sngon por byed kyi /
analyzed: sngon po nyid sngon po ma yin na ni de shel dang 'dra bar bdag nyid sngon por byed kyi /
translated: If blue itself were not blue, then like a crystal, it would make itself blue.

original: sngon po nyid du gnas pa ni sngon por byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sngon po nyid du gnas pa ni sngon por byed par mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not tenable that that which exists as blue makes itself blue.

original: gal te mar me rang nyid kyang gsal bar mi byed la /
analyzed: gal te mar me rang nyid kyang gsal bar mi byed la /
translated: If a lamp does not illuminate itself and

original: gzhan gyis kyang gsal bar mi byed na ni rnam pa thams cad du snang ba'i rgyun chad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang gsal bar mi byed na ni rnam pa thams cad du snang ba'i rgyun chad par 'gyur na /
translated: others do not illuminate it, then the continuum of appearance would be completely severed.

original: de ltar mi rung bas snang ba gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang la rang gsal bar byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi rung bas snang ba gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir rang la rang gsal bar byed do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: But since that is not tenable, it is explained that because it does not depend on another appearance, it illuminates itself.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir rang nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir rang nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, because the mind is free from apprehended and apprehender, it illuminates itself.🔽To respond:

original: de'i phyir mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mar me zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore Candrakīrti says, “A lamp does not illuminate itself,” and so on.

original: mar me ni gsal bar byed pa yin par shes pas de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i tshul gyis lan 'ga' zhig brjod du rung gi shes pa la ni de las gzhan pa'i shes pa po med pas de la rang gsal bar byed do zhes shes pa
analyzed: mar me ni gsal bar byed pa yin par shes pas de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir sgro btags pa'i tshul gyis lan 'ga' zhig brjod du rung gi shes pa la ni de las gzhan pa'i shes pa po med pas de la rang gsal bar byed do zhes shes pa
translated: Since a lamp is known to illuminate, it is understood in that way. Therefore, it is suitable to say it is imputed. But consciousness is not like that, since there is no cognizer other than that.

original: rgyu gang gis shes nas rjod par byed /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis shes nas rjod par byed /
translated: By what cause would one know and say that?

original: yang blo ni gzhan gyi sems shes pas @71a * //
analyzed: yang blo ni gzhan gyi sems shes pas @71a * //
translated: Also, the mind is not seen as it is by the knowledge of others’ minds.

original: kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong bas de'i phyir sus kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong bas gsal ba'am me gsal ba zhes brjod du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong bas de'i phyir sus kyang ji lta ba bzhin du mi mthong bas gsal ba'am me gsal ba zhes brjod du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since no one sees it as it is, it is not suitable to say that it is clear or that it illuminates.

original: blo ni brjod du med pa yin du zin kyang sgro btags pa tsam gyis yod par bshad pa de bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo ni brjod du med pa yin du zin kyang sgro btags pa tsam gyis yod par bshad pa de bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if the mind is inexpressible, it is explained to exist by mere imputation. That is not true.

original: de'i phyir gsal lam mi gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal lam mi gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Clear or unclear,” and so on.

original: sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma gzigs pa ste /
analyzed: sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma gzigs pa ste /
translated: “By no one” and so on means that even the Buddha does not see it.

original: 'od srungs sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs sems ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma gzigs mi gzigs gzigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, the mind is not seen, is not being seen, and will not be seen by any of the buddhas.🔽Therefore, just like the son of a barren woman, it is meaningless to say that it is clear or unclear, and so on.🔽When reflexive awareness is thus refuted, an opponent who is eager to debate objects:🔽If you say that memory is the proof of reflexive awareness, then memory is not established, because it is not established by itself or by something other.

original: de bas na mo gsham gyi bu'i tshul spyod dang 'dra bar gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa ji skad du brjod du zin kyang don med brdzun yin no //🔽de ltar rang rig pa rnam par bsal ba na rgol ba rtsod pa la brtson pas brgal ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te ;
analyzed: de bas na mo gsham gyi bu'i tshul spyod dang 'dra bar gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa ji skad du brjod du zin kyang don med brdzun yin no // de ltar rang rig pa rnam par bsal ba na rgol ba rtsod pa la brtson pas brgal ba ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te ;
translated: If you say that memory is established by another memory, then you have committed the logical fallacy of an infinite regress.🔽If you say that memory is established by reflexive awareness, then you have committed the logical fallacy of circular reasoning.🔽If you say that memory is established by direct perception, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by inference, then you have committed the logical fallacy of an unestablished basis.🔽If you say that memory is established by scripture, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by analogy, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.🔽If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.

original: gzhan dag gi rnam par shes pas rjes su myong bar rab tu gsal bar gyur pa ni dran pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi rnam par shes pas rjes su myong bar rab tu gsal bar gyur pa ni dran pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If you say that memory is established by the nonobservation of something that can be observed, then you have committed the logical fallacy of contradiction.

original: gal te de ltar yin na sems gzhan gyi rjes su myong ba'i don skyes bus ji ltar dran par 'gyur du rung zhes dris pa dang / gzhan dag gis 'brel pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na sems gzhan gyi rjes su myong ba'i don skyes bus ji ltar dran par 'gyur du rung zhes dris pa dang / gzhan dag gis 'brel pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you say that memory is established by the non

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la sogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la sogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “from one to another” is that the characteristics of cause and effect are transmitted from one to another.🔽How can one remember the poison of a rat?

original: 'di la byi ba'i dug ji ltar dran par 'gyur zhes dri bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la byi ba'i dug ji ltar dran par 'gyur zhes dri bar sbyar te /
translated: The question is to be supplied.

original: de yang dbyar gyi tshe byi ba dug dang bcas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de yang dbyar gyi tshe byi ba dug dang bcas par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, in the summer, rats become poisonous.

original: de dag yod par rtogs pa na sbrul gyi mche bas zin pa'i rjes thogs la sbrul ni ma mthong bar gyur pa dang lus la gnod pa'i 'gyur ba mthong bas byi ba'i dug med bzhin du de'i dug gis zin pa'i dran pa 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag yod par rtogs pa na sbrul gyi mche bas zin pa'i rjes thogs la sbrul ni ma mthong bar gyur pa dang lus la gnod pa'i 'gyur ba mthong bas byi ba'i dug med bzhin du de'i dug gis zin pa'i dran pa 'byung mod kyi /
translated: When one realizes that they exist, one remembers the poison of a rat, even though it does not exist, because one sees the changes in the body that occur after being bitten by a snake, even though one has not seen the snake.

original: sbrul gyi dug ni de las gzhan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sbrul gyi dug ni de las gzhan pa nyid yin no //
translated: The poison of a snake is different from that of a rat.

original: de bzhin du rma'am lus kyi nang gzhan las /
analyzed: de bzhin du rma'am lus kyi nang gzhan las /
translated: In the same way, the memory of a rat’s poison is not different from the body or the wound.🔽In the same way, the memory of consciousness is not different from consciousness, just as the memory of a rat’s poison is not different from the poison itself.

original: byi ba'i dug gi shes pa med pa bzhin du dran pa dang 'dra bar rang rig pa med pa nyid du brjod pa rnam par shes pa'i dran pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byi ba'i dug gi shes pa med pa bzhin du dran pa dang 'dra bar rang rig pa med pa nyid du brjod pa rnam par shes pa'i dran pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Just as the memory of a rat’s poison arises without the consciousness of a rat’s poison, in the same way, the memory of consciousness arises without autocognition.

original: yang 'di skad du bdag nyid mi 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: yang 'di skad du bdag nyid mi 'byung mod kyi /
translated: Again, it might be said that although the self does not arise,

original: 'on kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba na gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan dang ldan par snang ba'i @71b rang bzhin can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'byung ba na gzugs la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan dang ldan par snang ba'i @71b rang bzhin can yin no zhe na /
translated: nevertheless, when visual consciousness and so forth arise, they appear to possess the nature of possessing other conditions such as form.

original: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that this is illogical,

original: rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, “The conditions are not other . . .”

original: dper na grub pa'i mig sman med par yang bum pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba dang 'dra bar rkyen nyid dang ldan pa tsam gyis shes pa yin du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dper na grub pa'i mig sman med par yang bum pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba dang 'dra bar rkyen nyid dang ldan pa tsam gyis shes pa yin du mi rung ngo //
translated: Just as, for example, without the eye ointment of accomplishment, one does not see such things as pots, it is not suitable that consciousness is due to the mere possession of conditions.

original: de ltar na rang rig pa med par bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rang rig pa med par bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, it follows that without reflexive awareness, seeing such things as pots would not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In this way . . .”

original: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir mngon sum gyi tshad mas nges par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir mngon sum gyi tshad mas nges par byas pa'o //
translated: Here, “seeing” is ascertained by the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: thos pa ni sgra las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni sgra las byung ba'o //
translated: “Hearing” is that which arises from sound.

original: shes pa ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: shes pa ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: Consciousness is inferred.

original: ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir dbu ma pas kyang bkag pa med kyang gzhan du tshad mas yang dag pa nyid yin pa gzhan du mi rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir dbu ma pas kyang bkag pa med kyang gzhan du tshad mas yang dag pa nyid yin pa gzhan du mi rung ste /
translated: Whatever is seen and so on is not refuted here by the Madhyamika, but it is not suitable to be valid elsewhere by a valid cognition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dir mthong ba la sogs pa bden pa nyid du rtogs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i gti mug yin pas de bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mthong ba la sogs pa bden pa nyid du rtogs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i gti mug yin pas de bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Here, the realization of seeing and so on as true is delusion that becomes the cause of suffering, so that is to be averted.

original: gal te sems las sgyu ma gzhan yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te sems las sgyu ma gzhan yang ma yin /
translated: If the illusion is not different from the mind,

original: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin na /
translated: nor is it non-different,

original: dper ji ltar rung zhes rtog pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: dper ji ltar rung zhes rtog pas de'i phyir /
translated: how is it suitable as an example?

original: sems las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thinking that, it is said:

original: gal te sgyu ma dngos po yin na ni sems las ji ltar gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te sgyu ma dngos po yin na ni sems las ji ltar gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: If the illusion were a thing, how could it not be different from the mind?

original: bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar gzhan yin no //
translated: Like a pot and so on, it would be different.

original: gal te mtshan min zhes pa sems las sgyu ma gzhan ma yin na ni yang dag par dngos por ma grub ste yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te mtshan min zhes pa sems las sgyu ma gzhan ma yin na ni yang dag par dngos por ma grub ste yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the illusion is not different from the mind, then it is not truly established as a thing, it does not exist.🔽If the mind does not exist, how can an illusion be seen?

original: sems med du zin na sgyu ma ji ltar mthong zhes rtog pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems med du zin na sgyu ma ji ltar mthong zhes rtog pa de'i phyir /
translated: In order to think about that,

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says “just as” and so on.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma mi bden zhing med du zin kyang snang ba dang 'dra bar sems gzhan rang bzhin med kyang kun rdzob tu blta bar bya ba'i yul dang / lta ba por snang ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma mi bden zhing med du zin kyang snang ba dang 'dra bar sems gzhan rang bzhin med kyang kun rdzob tu blta bar bya ba'i yul dang / lta ba por snang ba la nyes pa ci zhig yod /
translated: Just as an illusion is not real and does not exist, but appears, in the same way, although the other mind is essenceless, what is the problem with the appearance of the object of perception and the perceiver in the relative?

original: 'dir sems tsam pa na re gal te dngos po la brten na ni de nyid kyis 'khor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir sems tsam pa na re gal te dngos po la brten na ni de nyid kyis 'khor bar 'gyur la /
translated: Here the Cittamātra say, “If it depends on things, then by that very fact it would be saṃsāra.🔽If it does not depend on that, then saṃsāra would be like space.”

original: de la ma brten na ni 'khor ba nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes rtog pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ma brten na ni 'khor ba nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes rtog pas de'i phyir /
translated: In order to think about that,

original: dngos po la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “depending on things” and so on.

original: don dam par dngos po med pa'i 'khor ba skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan par ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //🔽'khor ba @72a * //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po med pa'i 'khor ba skye ba'i bya ba dang ldan par ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro // 'khor ba @72a * //
translated: How could cyclic existence, which is ultimately devoid of entities, come to possess the activity of arising? It could not!

original: dngos po med kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba'i gzhan dbang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa zhes bya ba'i gzhan dbang yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that although cyclic existence is devoid of entities, there is the dependent nature called “false imagination,”

original: de'i phyir grogs po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grogs po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then in response to that, he says “Friend,” and so on.

original: gal te 'khor ba med kyi sems kyi rnam pa ma yin par kun tu rtog na 'di ni grogs med pa cha shas dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba med kyi sems kyi rnam pa ma yin par kun tu rtog na 'di ni grogs med pa cha shas dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: If cyclic existence does not exist but is imagined by the mind, then it is not without a companion, not partless.

original: de ltar yin na ci nyes shes na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ci nyes shes na /
translated: If that is so, what is the problem?

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “When,” and so on.

original: gal te sems gcig pu gzung ba dang bral bar gnas pa de'i tshe 'dzin pa po yang med la /
analyzed: gal te sems gcig pu gzung ba dang bral bar gnas pa de'i tshe 'dzin pa po yang med la /
translated: If the mind alone, free from apprehending objects, abides, then at that time there is no apprehender.

original: de gnyi ga dang bral na ni sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang bral na ni sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro//
translated: If both are absent, then all sentient beings would be tathāgatas.

original: de ltar na khyod kyi sems tsam du bstan pa des yon tan ci zhig thob ste /
analyzed: de ltar na khyod kyi sems tsam du bstan pa des yon tan ci zhig thob ste /
translated: Thus, what good quality is obtained by your teaching of mind only?

original: btags pa tsam nyid nyon mongs pa yin pas nyon mongs pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: btags pa tsam nyid nyon mongs pa yin pas nyon mongs pa las ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes dgongs so //
translated: Since mere designation is an affliction, one does not turn away from affliction.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis dbu ma pa la dris pa ni /🔽sgyu ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis dbu ma pa la dris pa ni / sgyu ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, others ask the Followers of the Middle Way:🔽“How can the afflictions be reversed

original: khyod kyis bshad pa'i sgyu ma lta bur shes pas kyang /
analyzed: khyod kyis bshad pa'i sgyu ma lta bur shes pas kyang /
translated: by the knowledge that things are illusionlike?”

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ldog par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa ldog par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can the afflictions, such as attachment, be reversed by the knowledge that things are illusionlike?

original: gang gi tshe sgyu ma'i bud med sprul pa la sgyu ma de byed pa de nyid kyang 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur bas de ltar shes su zin kyang nyon mongs pa mi ldog go //🔽de ltar brgal ba'i lan gdab pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgyu ma'i bud med sprul pa la sgyu ma de byed pa de nyid kyang 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur bas de ltar shes su zin kyang nyon mongs pa mi ldog go // de ltar brgal ba'i lan gdab pa'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: When the creator of an illusory woman conjures her, attachment arises in him toward that very illusory woman. Thus, even though he knows that she is an illusion, he is not free from afflictions.

original: de byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to such objections, the following verse is stated in order to teach the stages of relinquishing the afflictions:🔽The creator of the illusion

original: sgyu ma de'i byed pa po ni de byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma de'i byed pa po ni de byed pa ste /
translated: The creator of that illusion is the agent of that.

original: de zhes bya ba bud med la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i sa bon ma spangs pa las sgyu ma'i bud med de mthong ba'i dus su nyon mongs pa skye ba ni stong pa nyid kyi bag chags bsgom pa nyam chung ba nyid yin no
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bud med la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i sa bon ma spangs pa las sgyu ma'i bud med de mthong ba'i dus su nyon mongs pa skye ba ni stong pa nyid kyi bag chags bsgom pa nyam chung ba nyid yin no
translated: The word “that” refers to the seed of the arising of the afflictions such as the woman, etc., which has not been abandoned. The arising of the afflictions at the time of seeing that illusory woman is the weakness of the cultivation of the latent propensities for emptiness.

original: // 'o na ji ltar nyon mongs pa spong zhe na /
analyzed: // 'o na ji ltar nyon mongs pa spong zhe na /
translated: How then are the afflictions abandoned?

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Emptiness, etc.”

original: 'dir stong pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid ni de kho na nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Here, emptiness is the wisdom of reality.

original: de'i sa bon ni bag chags so //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni bag chags so //
translated: Its seed is the latent propensities.

original: de bsgom pas ni bsgom pa shin tu goms pa skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de bsgom pas ni bsgom pa shin tu goms pa skyes pa ste /
translated: Cultivating that is the arising of the cultivation of that.

original: de ni dngos po'i bag chags gzugs la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i sa bon spong zhing sel bar byed do //
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i bag chags gzugs la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i sa bon spong zhing sel bar byed do //
translated: That is the abandonment and removal of the latent propensities for entities, the seeds of the conceptions of form, etc.

original: cung zad med ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa dag go //
analyzed: cung zad med ces bya ba ni dngos po med pa dag go //
translated: Nothing whatsoever refers to non-entities.

original: med do zhes stong pa nyid la bslab pa'i bag chags ji ltar spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: med do zhes stong pa nyid la bslab pa'i bag chags ji ltar spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If emptiness does not exist, how can one eliminate the instinct for training in emptiness?

original: de'i phyir @72b gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir @72b gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: don dam par na stong pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /🔽dngos po med pa ni dngos po rnams ldog pa la ltos pa ma yin pas /🔽dngos po la brten zhes bya ba'i dngos po med na ni rten med pa yin na blo zhes bya ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par na stong pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te / dngos po med pa ni dngos po rnams ldog pa la ltos pa ma yin pas / dngos po la brten zhes bya ba'i dngos po med na ni rten med pa yin na blo zhes bya ba shes pa ste /
translated: When there is no object of cognition,🔽how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?

original: mdun na dmigs pa med pa'i don gyis na ji ltar gnas par 'gyur te mi gnas so //🔽de ltar na dngos po med par rtogs pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon yang tshul 'di ltar spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar lhag pa dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bshad nas /🔽lhag ma med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdun na dmigs pa med pa'i don gyis na ji ltar gnas par 'gyur te mi gnas so // de ltar na dngos po med par rtogs pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon yang tshul 'di ltar spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar lhag pa dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bshad nas / lhag ma med pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?

original: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?🔽When there is no object of cognition, how can there be a cognition?

original: dmigs pa med pa ni yul med pa'am nye bar len pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni yul med pa'am nye bar len pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of an object is the absence of an object or the absence of appropriation.

original: blo ni sems so //
analyzed: blo ni sems so //
translated: The mind is the thought.

original: rab tu zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The word “completely” refers to nirvana.

original: de ltar na rgyal ba'i sku ji ltar snang bas blta zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal ba'i sku ji ltar snang bas blta zhe na /
translated: Thus, how is the body of the Victor seen by the appearance?

original: de'i phyir yid bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “like a wish-granting jewel,” and so on.

original: gdul bya ni 'gro ba rnams kyi don gyi rkyen dang smon lam gyi rgyu de gnyis ji srid yod pa de srid du /
analyzed: gdul bya ni 'gro ba rnams kyi don gyi rkyen dang smon lam gyi rgyu de gnyis ji srid yod pa de srid du /
translated: As long as there are the conditions for the benefit of beings and the causes of prayers,

original: skal pa ji bzhin du 'dod pa yongs su skong bar mdzad par snang ste /
analyzed: skal pa ji bzhin du 'dod pa yongs su skong bar mdzad par snang ste /
translated: the appearance of fulfilling the wishes of those to be trained according to their fortune is made.

original: de yang yid bzhin gyi nor bu la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtog pa mi mnga' yang re ba yongs su skong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de yang yid bzhin gyi nor bu la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtog pa mi mnga' yang re ba yongs su skong bar mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, like a wish-granting jewel and so on, even without conceptualization, the fulfillment of hopes is made.

original: ji ltar na sems med du zin kyang bya ba de byed ces rtog pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems med du zin kyang bya ba de byed ces rtog pa de'i phyir /
translated: How is it that even without a mind, that action is performed?

original: mkha' lding zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mkha' lding zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “like a garuḍa,” and so on.

original: dper na nam mkha' lding gi dug sngags grub pa'i skyes bus mchod sdong gi ka ba bsgrubs te btsugs pa des skyes bu sbrul la sogs pa'i dug gis zin pa sel bar byed pa'i mthu yod la /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' lding gi dug sngags grub pa'i skyes bus mchod sdong gi ka ba bsgrubs te btsugs pa des skyes bu sbrul la sogs pa'i dug gis zin pa sel bar byed pa'i mthu yod la /
translated: For example, a person who has mastered the mantra of the garuḍa consecrates a pillar of the sacrificial post. It has the power to cure people who are bitten by snakes and so forth.

original: de'i grub pa po de med nas yun ring por lon na yang mchod sdong du btsugs pa'i shing gis dug sel bar nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i grub pa po de med nas yun ring por lon na yang mchod sdong du btsugs pa'i shing gis dug sel bar nus pa yin no //
translated: Even if that person who mastered it has long since passed away, the wood of the sacrificial post that was consecrated can still cure poison.

original: de bzhin du byang chub kyi spyod pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pas snying por bya ba thams cad tshul bzhin spyod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub kyi spyod pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i spyod pas snying por bya ba thams cad tshul bzhin spyod de /
translated: In the same way, by practicing all the essential points of the training in accordance with the bodhisattva deeds,

original: byang chub kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa des /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa des /
translated: you will complete the bodhisattva deeds.

original: rgyal ba'i mchod sdong zhes bya ba rgyal ba'i sku sprul par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dang bcas pa 'das par gyur nas kyang gdul bya rnams dang smon lam gyi rnam pa'i shugs gnyis kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par 'gyur gyi /🔽nyan thos ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @73a * //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mchod sdong zhes bya ba rgyal ba'i sku sprul par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dang bcas pa 'das par gyur nas kyang gdul bya rnams dang smon lam gyi rnam pa'i shugs gnyis kyis sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par 'gyur gyi / nyan thos ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' @73a * //
translated: The phrase “the Victor’s memorial” means that the Victor’s body becomes an emanation, and even after the bodhisattva’s passing, it will benefit all sentient beings through the power of the two kinds of aspirations and the power of the two kinds of objects to be trained.

original: bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will not pass into complete nirvana like the sravakas.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das su zin kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa ni kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das su zin kyang yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra bar 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa ni kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin no //
translated: Even if it were to pass into nirvana, it would benefit beings like a wish-fulfilling gem. This is the meaning of the word “also.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: sems med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, “without mind.”

original: sangs rgyas la mchod pa byas pa'i bsod nams ni 'bras bu las 'dra ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mchod pa byas pa'i bsod nams ni 'bras bu las 'dra ba nyid yin te /
translated: The merit of making offerings to the Buddha has a result that is similar to the cause.

original: ji ltar 'dra zhes rtog na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dra zhes rtog na de'i phyir /
translated: If one wonders how it is similar,

original: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “Whatever,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa na mchod pa byas pa ci lta bar 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa na mchod pa byas pa ci lta bar 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that just as one makes offerings to the Buddha when he is present, so it is here.

original: sngar ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i sems de las bsod nams skye bar bshad la /
analyzed: sngar ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i sems de las bsod nams skye bar bshad la /
translated: Previously, it was explained that merit arises from that mind which is like an illusion.

original: da ltar ni de med du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyad par ro //
analyzed: da ltar ni de med du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni 'dir khyad par ro //
translated: Now, even though that does not exist, this is the difference here.

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu 'dir mtshungs pa de yang lung gi tshad ma las grub pa yin pas kun rdzob bam don dam pa gang yin yang sangs rgyas bzhugs pa la mchod pa byas pa dang 'dra bar 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no ;
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu 'dir mtshungs pa de yang lung gi tshad ma las grub pa yin pas kun rdzob bam don dam pa gang yin yang sangs rgyas bzhugs pa la mchod pa byas pa dang 'dra bar 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no ;
translated: This merit is similar to the result, and that is established by the valid cognition of scripture. Therefore, whether it is conventional or ultimate, it is fruitful, like making offerings to the Buddha when he is present.

original: / de ltar de kho na nyid rtogs pa de'i rim pa bshad pa na theg pa dman pa dag theg pa chen po mi bzod pas phyir rgol bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: / de ltar de kho na nyid rtogs pa de'i rim pa bshad pa na theg pa dman pa dag theg pa chen po mi bzod pas phyir rgol bar byed pa ni /
translated: When the stages of realizing suchness are explained in that way, those of the Hīnayāna, who are intolerant of the Mahāyāna, object.

original: bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: They say, “The Mahāyāna is not the Buddha’s word” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong na gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i ye shes yang srid par 'gro bar byed pa'i las rnams mi byed pas mya ngan las 'das shing grol bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa mthong na gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i ye shes yang srid par 'gro bar byed pa'i las rnams mi byed pas mya ngan las 'das shing grol bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one sees the truth of suffering and so on, then one realizes the selflessness of the person, and the pristine wisdom that does not create karma that leads to rebirth attains nirvana and liberation.

original: stong pa nyid mthong bas yod pa bkag cing med par lta bar mi shes pa des 'bras bu ci zhig 'grub pa yod de /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mthong bas yod pa bkag cing med par lta bar mi shes pa des 'bras bu ci zhig 'grub pa yod de /
translated: But if one sees emptiness, how could one establish any result, since one would be refuting existence and not know how to view nonexistence?

original: ci yang med do zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: ci yang med do zhes rtog pa la /
translated: One might think that nothing exists at all.

original: de'i khyad par chen po yod pe la khyed kyis ma shes pa yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: de'i khyad par chen po yod pe la khyed kyis ma shes pa yin no zhes ston te /
translated: But you have not understood the great difference between the two.

original: de'i phyir gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, Candrakīrti says, “Because of that, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir lung yang dag pa las 'di lta bu'i stong pa nyid ma mthong bas byang chub tu ni mi 'gyur bar gsungs la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lung yang dag pa las 'di lta bu'i stong pa nyid ma mthong bas byang chub tu ni mi 'gyur bar gsungs la /
translated: Because of that, the perfect scriptures state that without seeing such emptiness, one will not attain enlightenment.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid mthong ba ni don chen po yin par smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid mthong ba ni don chen po yin par smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, seeing emptiness is said to be of great benefit.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan zhig la smra ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan zhig la smra ba ste /
translated: But if you say etc. and so on, it is spoken by another.

original: theg chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: theg chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni theg pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The Mahāyāna is so called because it is a vehicle and it is great.

original: sa bcu 'bras bu dang bcas pa de thob par byed pa'i phyir theg pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu 'bras bu dang bcas pa de thob par byed pa'i phyir theg pa'o //
translated: It is a vehicle because it causes one to attain the ten stages along with their fruits.

original: 'bras bu dang / dus dang / dmigs @73b pa dang ; bsam pa dang / 'byor ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / tshogs kyi che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / dus dang / dmigs @73b pa dang ; bsam pa dang / 'byor ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / tshogs kyi che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir chen po ste /
translated: It is great because it is great in terms of result, time, object, intention, attainment, effort, and accumulation.

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang de ston pa'i bstan bcos sa bcu pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab dang de ston pa'i bstan bcos sa bcu pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the wisdom whose nature is hearing and so on and the treatises that teach it, such as the Ten Stages.

original: de ni mi 'grub par gzhan smra na'o //
analyzed: de ni mi 'grub par gzhan smra na'o //
translated: If you say etc. and so on, it is spoken by another.

original: khyed kyi lung ni ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po bas dris pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi lung ni ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba ni theg pa chen po bas dris pa'o //
translated: How is your scripture established? is asked by the Mahāyānists.

original: gang phyir 'dir ni gnyi ga'ang 'grub //
analyzed: gang phyir 'dir ni gnyi ga'ang 'grub //
translated: Because both are established here.

original: ces bya ba ni nyan thos pa'i ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nyan thos pa'i ste /
translated: is the Śrāvakas'.

original: gnyi ga sangs rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga sangs rgyas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because both are Buddhas.

original: dang po khyod kyi 'di mi 'grub //
analyzed: dang po khyod kyi 'di mi 'grub //
translated: First, this is not established for you.

original: ces bya ba theg pa chen po'i tshig ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba theg pa chen po'i tshig ste /
translated: This is a statement of the Great Vehicle.

original: dang por zhes bya ba theg pa chen po med par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: dang por zhes bya ba theg pa chen po med par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: First, without the Great Vehicle, one would not attain Buddhahood.

original: de med par khyed kyi lung grub pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de med par khyed kyi lung grub pa ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Without that, your scriptures are not established.

original: 'dir gzhan yang rgyu gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan yang rgyu gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: Here, moreover, by “what cause” and so on, it is shown that

original: gang la de rgyu gang gis khyed kyi lung gis der sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin par yid ches par 'jog na ;
analyzed: gang la de rgyu gang gis khyed kyi lung gis der sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin par yid ches par 'jog na ;
translated: if you posit that by what cause that is taught in your scriptures, the Buddha taught it there,

original: yid ches pa theg pa chen po la yang gyis shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa theg pa chen po la yang gyis shig ces pa'o //
translated: then you should also have confidence in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'on te gnyi ga 'dod pa nyid yin pas khyed kyi lung la ni yid ches kyi /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga 'dod pa nyid yin pas khyed kyi lung la ni yid ches kyi /
translated: But if you do have confidence in both, then you should have confidence in your scriptures.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not from the Buddha’s teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa las gzhan pa gnyi ga 'dod pa de la bden par khas len na rig byed la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kyang gnyi ga 'dod pa yod pas bden par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa las gzhan pa gnyi ga 'dod pa de la bden par khas len na rig byed la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kyang gnyi ga 'dod pa yod pas bden par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the Vedas are true because they are accepted by both parties, and not because they were spoken by the Buddha, then some of the Vedas would be true because they are accepted by both parties.

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa nyid bden mod kyi theg pa chen po rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa nyid bden mod kyi theg pa chen po rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the words of the Buddha are true, but that we do not accept the Mahāyāna because it is disputed,

original: khyed kyi lung yang mu stegs pa rnams dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dor dgos so //
analyzed: khyed kyi lung yang mu stegs pa rnams dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dor dgos so //
translated: then you should abandon your scriptures because they are disputed by tīrthikas.

original: gzhan gyi lung gzhan dag kyang dor dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lung gzhan dag kyang dor dgos so //
translated: You should also abandon other scriptures because they are disputed by others.

original: rang gi sde pa dang / gzhan 'ga' zhig dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dang / gzhan 'ga' zhig dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And you should also abandon your own scriptures because they are disputed by some of your own schools.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni dge slong nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni dge slong nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, the root of the Buddha’s teaching is the state of being a bhikṣu.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa'i rtsa ba gzhi gang la yod pa dge slong nyid do ;
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa'i rtsa ba gzhi gang la yod pa dge slong nyid do ;
translated: The state of being a bhikṣu is the basis of the root bhikṣu vows.

original: / de nyid kyang dka' bas gnas pa ni mu stegs pa dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de nyid kyang dka' bas gnas pa ni mu stegs pa dang rtsod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is difficult to maintain, because it is disputed by the tīrthikas.

original: re zhig dge slong nyid lta smos kyang ci dgos kyi /
analyzed: re zhig dge slong nyid lta smos kyang ci dgos kyi /
translated: What need is there to mention the state of being a monk?

original: sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The mind is accompanied by an object,

original: nye bar dmigs pa yod pa rnams kyis ji srid phung po'i 'dzin pa yod pa de srid kyi bar nga'o zhes kyang nga @74a * //🔽rgyal byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa yod pa rnams kyis ji srid phung po'i 'dzin pa yod pa de srid kyi bar nga'o zhes kyang nga @74a * // rgyal byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and those who have an object of observation will be conceited with the thought “I am” for as long as there is the apprehension of the aggregates.

original: yang las dang skye ba yod la /
analyzed: yang las dang skye ba yod la /
translated: And they will have karma and birth.

original: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa yang dka' bas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa yang dka' bas gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even nirvana is difficult to maintain.

original: bden pa mthong bas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir dka' bas gnas pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa mthong bas nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir dka' bas gnas pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyir /
translated: They say, “It is not difficult to maintain because the afflictions are abandoned through seeing the truths.”🔽To respond to that, it is said:🔽The afflictions will not arise again

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: even after the afflictions are abandoned🔽if one meditates on emptiness.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rjes thogs la yang stong pa nyid ma bsgoms par de mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rjes thogs la yang stong pa nyid ma bsgoms par de mi 'byung ste /
translated: The afflictions will not arise again even after the afflictions are abandoned if one meditates on emptiness.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang ldan pa la gnod pa dang bcas par snang ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang ldan pa la gnod pa dang bcas par snang ngo //
translated: The mind that possesses an object appears to be accompanied by injury.

original: dper na 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis gzir zhing rmongs pa'i las kyi nus pa yod par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu lus kyi sdug bsngal gyis gzir zhing rmongs pa'i las kyi nus pa yod par snang ba yin no //
translated: For example, the noble Maudgalyāyana, afflicted by physical pain, appeared to have the power of deluded action.

original: de ltar yin na yang re zhig sred pa ni srid pa'i rtsa bar gyur na de de rnams la med do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang re zhig sred pa ni srid pa'i rtsa bar gyur na de de rnams la med do zhe na /
translated: Even though this is so, craving is the root of existence, but it does not exist for them.

original: de nges par gzung zhing dpyad pas nges par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de nges par gzung zhing dpyad pas nges par bya dgos la /
translated: This must be ascertained and analyzed.

original: ci zhig nges par bya dgos she na /
analyzed: ci zhig nges par bya dgos she na /
translated: What must be ascertained?

original: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse text says, “To what extent, etc.”

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dge ba ni 'dir yang srid pa 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dge ba ni 'dir yang srid pa 'byung ba'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: Here, others say that craving that is afflicted and neutral, and the nonvirtue of the desire realm, are also considered to be the origin of existence.

original: de yang dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni nyon mongs pa can yin na /
analyzed: de yang dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni nyon mongs pa can yin na /
translated: Moreover, that which is associated with attachment to pleasure is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs med kyang zhes ci'i phyir smra zhes 'di ltar dgongs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs med kyang zhes ci'i phyir smra zhes 'di ltar dgongs te /
translated: Why does he say “even though there is no affliction”?

original: gti mug kyang nyon mongs pa chen po yin pas nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: gti mug kyang nyon mongs pa chen po yin pas nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: He means this: Delusion is an affliction because it is a great affliction.

original: de'i bag chags kyang ni kun tu rmongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa 'di la yod par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i bag chags kyang ni kun tu rmongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'i sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa 'di la yod par 'dod do //
translated: And the latent impressions of that are asserted to exist in this non-deluded ignorance that is associated with a mental object.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sred pa la bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sred pa la bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yod do //
translated: In the same way, there are non-afflicted latent impressions in non-afflicted craving.

original: de yang tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshor ba yin no //
translated: And that is feeling.

original: de yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: And that should be analyzed.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas nyon mongs pa can bskyed do zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang phrad nas nyon mongs pa can bskyed do zhes bya ba yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ston to //
translated: The word “also” indicates that even though it is non-afflicted, it generates affliction when it encounters a cooperative cause.

original: de bas na sred 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sred 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he says, “This craving, etc.”

original: rgyu rnams 'bras bu nges par skyed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu rnams 'bras bu nges par skyed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Causes do not necessarily generate their effects.

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “The mind that is devoid of emptiness,” and so on.

original: gang yang rung ba der 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba der 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ It would be placed somewhere” means

original: sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na /
analyzed: sems dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na /
translated: that if the mind were to have an object,

original: srid pa'am zag pa med pa'i @74b dbyings gang yin pa der nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'am zag pa med pa'i @74b dbyings gang yin pa der nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be placed in either the realm of existence or the uncontaminated realm.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “The mind that is devoid of the realization of emptiness,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang bral ba'i sems de'i dngos po'i bag chags kyis bcings pa yin pa'i phyir grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs pa dang bral ba'i sems de'i dngos po'i bag chags kyis bcings pa yin pa'i phyir grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because the mind that is devoid of the realization of emptiness is bound by the latent propensities of entities, it is not liberated.

original: slar yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would arise again.

original: de yang ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: de'i phyir 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “The mind that is devoid of the perception of nonperception,” and so on.

original: 'du shes ni sngon po la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i sems kyi 'du shes so //🔽de gang la med pa de 'du shes med pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes ni sngon po la sogs pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i sems kyi 'du shes so // de gang la med pa de 'du shes med pa ste /
translated: Perception is the perception of the mind that apprehends the signs of blue, and so on.🔽That which is devoid of that is nonperception.

original: 'du shes med pa de yang yin la //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa de yang yin la //
translated: That is nonperception.

original: lus dang sems kyi rnam par g-yeng ba bkag pa bskyed pas snyoms par 'jug pa yang yin pa'i phyir 'du shes med par snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi rnam par g-yeng ba bkag pa bskyed pas snyoms par 'jug pa yang yin pa'i phyir 'du shes med par snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the attainment of non-perception because it is the attainment of meditative concentration that is generated by the cessation of the distraction of body and mind.

original: de yang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu chen po nam zhig thob pa na srid pa la thar par 'du shes pas 'ga' zhig gis 'du shes bkag ste snyoms par 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i 'bras bu chen po nam zhig thob pa na srid pa la thar par 'du shes pas 'ga' zhig gis 'du shes bkag ste snyoms par 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, when one attains the great result of the fourth meditation, some, perceiving existence as liberation, enter meditative concentration by stopping perception.

original: de'i sems ni phyin ci log gi bag chags kyis bcings pa'i phyir 'du shes bkag tu zin kyang dus ji srid du snga ma'i 'phan shugs zad pa dang / lus kyi dbang po de las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sems ni phyin ci log gi bag chags kyis bcings pa'i phyir 'du shes bkag tu zin kyang dus ji srid du snga ma'i 'phan shugs zad pa dang / lus kyi dbang po de las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Although perception is stopped, the mind is bound by the latent impressions of error. For as long as the momentum of the previous [meditation] is not exhausted, the mind arises from that sense-faculty of the body.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skye ba'i rnam par smin pa de ni mi khom pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skye ba'i rnam par smin pa de ni mi khom pa yin no //
translated: The result of the great gods is the rebirth among the beings without perception. That is an unfavorable condition.

original: des na stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des na stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should cultivate emptiness.

original: gal te khyod kyi lung sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi lung sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that your scriptures do not have the characteristics of the Buddha’s teachings,

original: de'i phyir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna says, “Why don’t you accept . . .”

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
translated: Why don’t you accept that they are the Buddha’s teachings?

original: 'dod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba yin no //
translated: You should accept that they are.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du mi mnyam yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du mi mnyam yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Mostly” means that even though they are not the same in every respect,

original: yang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig mi mthun pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes rtog na /
analyzed: yang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig mi mthun pas sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes rtog na /
translated: you might think that some parts of the Perfection of Wisdom, such as the chapter on emptiness, are not the Buddha’s teachings because they are not the same as your scriptures.

original: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: So Nāgārjuna says, “If you think that . . .”

original: theg pa chen po dang khyed kyi mdo tshig 'ga' zhig mi mthun pa mi rung ngo snyam na /
analyzed: theg pa chen po dang khyed kyi mdo tshig 'ga' zhig mi mthun pa mi rung ngo snyam na /
translated: You might think that it is not right for the Mahāyāna and your sūtras to have some differences.

original: khyed kyi mdo yang yang dag par ldan pa'i lung la sogs pa las stong pa nyid chen po dang mtshungs par ston pa don yod la /
analyzed: khyed kyi mdo yang yang dag par ldan pa'i lung la sogs pa las stong pa nyid chen po dang mtshungs par ston pa don yod la /
translated: But your sūtras also teach the great emptiness in a way that is similar to the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de ltar mnyam pa'i tshig gis kyang theg pa chen po thams cad rgyal bas gsungs pa ci ste ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mnyam pa'i tshig gis kyang theg pa chen po thams cad rgyal bas gsungs pa ci ste ma yin te /
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: sangs rgyas kyis @75a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis @75a * //
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: gsungs pa nyid yin no //🔽'od srungs chen po zhes bya bas ni gsung rab zab mo ma rtogs pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: gsungs pa nyid yin no // 'od srungs chen po zhes bya bas ni gsung rab zab mo ma rtogs pa nyid kyi nyes pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: gzhan yang stong pa nyid ma rtogs su zin kyang grol bar gdags su rung ba ni srid kyis /🔽de med par 'tshang rgya bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang stong pa nyid ma rtogs su zin kyang grol bar gdags su rung ba ni srid kyis / de med par 'tshang rgya bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: de ci'i phyir chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: chags dang 'jig pa gnyis de ltar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa 'di ni stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: chags dang 'jig pa gnyis de ltar mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa 'di ni stong pa nyid du rtogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.🔽It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the Buddha himself.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes shing khong du chud par bya ba de thams cad la 'gebs shing sgrib pa'i mi shes pa nyid ni mun pa dang 'dra bas mun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes shing khong du chud par bya ba de thams cad la 'gebs shing sgrib pa'i mi shes pa nyid ni mun pa dang 'dra bas mun pa ste /
translated: The very ignorance which covers and obscures all that is to be known and understood, such as the afflictive obstructions of desire and so on, is like darkness, and so is darkness.

original: de gnyis spang ba'i gnyen po ni stong pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis spang ba'i gnyen po ni stong pa yin no //
translated: Emptiness is the antidote to the abandonment of those two.

original: de ltar yin na yang bdag med do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di la 'jigs pas kho bo mi bsgom mo zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang bdag med do zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di la 'jigs pas kho bo mi bsgom mo zhe na /
translated: Even though it is so, one might say, “I do not cultivate this aspect, ‘There is no self,’ because of fear of it.”

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “Suffering, etc.”

original: de ltar zer ba de ci las 'jigs pa'i gzhi med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar zer ba de ci las 'jigs pa'i gzhi med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no basis for fear in such a statement, he says, “The self, etc.”

original: ci ltar na ci yang med ces rtog na /
analyzed: ci ltar na ci yang med ces rtog na /
translated: If one thinks, “How can there be nothing at all?”

original: de'i phyir so dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir so dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “The teeth, etc.”

original: bu ga dgu zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / kha ste bdun dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba'i lam ste dgu'o //
analyzed: bu ga dgu zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / kha ste bdun dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba'i lam ste dgu'o //
translated: The nine orifices are the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the mouth, the anus, and the urethra.

original: rnam shes drug ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes drug ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The six consciousnesses are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental consciousnesses.🔽Thus, the assertions of the Vātsīputrīyas and so on that the person exists as something separate from the self and life force, and the assertions of the Sāṃkhyas that the self is designated to consciousness, are refuted.

original: de ltar re zhig bad sa'i bu la sogs pa bdag dang srog las gang zag ces bya ba yod par 'dod pa sun phyung ba dang / grangs can dag kyang shes pa la bdag ces 'dogs pas de yang shes pa dang bcas pa'i skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa las de'i 'dod pa las /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bad sa'i bu la sogs pa bdag dang srog las gang zag ces bya ba yod par 'dod pa sun phyung ba dang / grangs can dag kyang shes pa la bdag ces 'dogs pas de yang shes pa dang bcas pa'i skyes bu'i rang gi ngo bo yin pa las de'i 'dod pa las /
translated: The nature of the person who possesses consciousness is as follows.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su rang bzhin rtag pa dang 'dres par gyur pa las chen po /
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang / mun pa cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su rang bzhin rtag pa dang 'dres par gyur pa las chen po /
translated: When the three qualities of sattva, rajas, and tamas are in a state of equilibrium, the primal substance is in a state of natural permanence.

original: de las nga rgyal /
analyzed: de las nga rgyal /
translated: From that, the great one arises.🔽From that, the I principle arises.

original: de las sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga 'byung la /
analyzed: de las sgra la sogs pa de tsam lnga 'byung la /
translated: From that, the five subtle objects such as sound arise.

original: sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa de yang skyes bu la sgra la sogs pa gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du snang ngo zhes zer bas /🔽de'i phyir gal te sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @75b te ;
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa de yang skyes bu la sgra la sogs pa gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du snang ngo zhes zer bas / de'i phyir gal te sgra'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @75b te ;
translated: And the cognition of sound and so on appears to the person in the manner of a reflection of sound and so on.

original: gal te sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sems de ni skyes bu rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te sgra la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sems de ni skyes bu rtag pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, if the cognition of sound and so on is the permanent person,

original: sgra yang rtag par dus thams cad du 'dzin cing thos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: sgra yang rtag par dus thams cad du 'dzin cing thos par 'gyur na /
translated: then sound and so on would always be apprehended and heard.

original: rtag tu mi thos pas shes pa de mi rtag pa yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: rtag tu mi thos pas shes pa de mi rtag pa yin no zhes ston to //
translated: But since it is not always heard, that cognition is impermanent.

original: 'dir gzhan dag na re sgra la sogs pa rtag tu mi gnas pas dus thams cad du mi thos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag na re sgra la sogs pa rtag tu mi gnas pas dus thams cad du mi thos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Here, others say: Sound and so on do not always exist, so it is not always heard.

original: de'i phyir gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, if it is asked, by what is sound and so on heard?

original: gal te de lta yin na rgyu gang gis shes pa zhes brjod cing ming du btags pa de shes par bya ba'i yul med par ci zhig des shes par ma gyur pas shes pa ji ltar yin te mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na rgyu gang gis shes pa zhes brjod cing ming du btags pa de shes par bya ba'i yul med par ci zhig des shes par ma gyur pas shes pa ji ltar yin te mi rung ngo //
translated: If that is so, by what cause is it called consciousness and designated as such? Since there is no object of consciousness, what is it that is not conscious? How can it be consciousness? It is not tenable.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te de ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te de ni go sla'o //
translated: For that reason, it is said, “If that is so, etc.” That is easy to understand.

original: sgra'i shes pa de nyid sgra nye bar mi gnas pa na gzugs dang nye bas gzugs shes pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa de nyid sgra nye bar mi gnas pa na gzugs dang nye bas gzugs shes pa yin te /
translated: When sound is not present, the consciousness of sound is present as the consciousness of form because of the presence of form.

original: de'i phyir yod do zhes zer na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod do zhes zer na /
translated: Therefore, it exists.

original: gal te de ltar yin na gang gi tshe gzugs shes pa de'i tshe rgyu gang gis ci ste thos par yang ma gyur /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na gang gi tshe gzugs shes pa de'i tshe rgyu gang gis ci ste thos par yang ma gyur /
translated: If that is so, when there is consciousness of form, by what cause is it that sound is not heard?

original: sgra drung na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: sgra drung na med pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: Because sound is not present.

original: des na sgra'i shes pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra'i shes pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of sound exists.

original: med pa ma yin te de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa ma yin te de'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not nonexistent because it has the nature of that.

original: rgyu des na shes bya drung na med cing rgyang ring na shes pa yang med pa kho nar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na shes bya drung na med cing rgyang ring na shes pa yang med pa kho nar nges pa yin no //
translated: For that reason, it is certain that the object of cognition does not exist in front of it, nor does cognition exist at a distance.

original: gzhan yang gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te sgra'i shes pa dang / gzugs kyi shes pa gnyis skyes bu'i rnam pas gcig yin la /🔽gang gi gzugs shes pa de'i tshe sgra thos par yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i shes pa dang / gzugs kyi shes pa gnyis skyes bu'i rnam pas gcig yin la / gang gi gzugs shes pa de'i tshe sgra thos par yang ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: If the cognition of sound and the cognition of form are the same in terms of the person,🔽then why wouldn’t one hear sound when one sees form?

original: 'on te gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na sgra med pas ma thos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs 'dzin pa'i dus na sgra med pas ma thos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that at the time of apprehending form, sound does not exist and therefore is not heard,

original: de lta na ni shes bya med pa'i shes pa'ang med pa kho nar 'gyur bas shes pa rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni shes bya med pa'i shes pa'ang med pa kho nar 'gyur bas shes pa rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then since there would be no cognition of a nonexistent object of cognition, cognition would not be permanent.

original: gzhan yang sgra 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa gang yin pa de gzugs 'dzin par nus par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa gang yin pa de gzugs 'dzin par nus par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, how could the cognition that has the nature of apprehending sound be able to apprehend form?

original: de gnyis gcig na ni dbang po lngar brtag pa yang don med do //
