analyzed: de gnyis gcig na ni dbang po lngar brtag pa yang don med do //
translated: If those two are the same, then it is pointless to posit five faculties.

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin las skyes bu 'byung bar brtag pa yang rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin las skyes bu 'byung bar brtag pa yang rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, it is not logical to imagine that a person arises from a nature.

original: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su rang bzhin zhes brtags pa la sogs pa skye bar bshad pa yang rtog pa nyid /
analyzed: snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa cha mnyam pa'i gnas skabs su rang bzhin zhes brtags pa la sogs pa skye bar bshad pa yang rtog pa nyid /
translated: The state of the equality of goodness, passion, and darkness is imagined to be a nature, etc. The explanation of the arising of that is just imagination.

original: gcig pu yin na yang mi rung ngo //🔽de bas na sgra @76a * //
analyzed: gcig pu yin na yang mi rung ngo // de bas na sgra @76a * //
translated: It is also not suitable to be one.

original: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yod par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid ma mthong bar grub pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yod par 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid ma mthong bar grub pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not logical to assert that the nature of the apprehension of sound is seen as the nature of the apprehension of form.

original: de'i phyir sgra 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The apprehension of sound, etc.”

original: sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzugs 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni gzugs 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could the nature of the consciousness that apprehends sound become the apprehension of form?

original: ci nas kyang mi 'gyur ro //🔽de yang gcig pa du ma nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci nas kyang mi 'gyur ro // de yang gcig pa du ma nyid du 'gyur ba ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible.🔽Moreover, it is contradictory for it to be both one and many.

original: gcig pu nyid yin na yang du mar gdags su rung ste /
analyzed: gcig pu nyid yin na yang du mar gdags su rung ste /
translated: If it were one, it would be suitable to designate it as many.

original: skyes bu gcig la yang bu la ltos nas pha zhes bya la pha la ltos nas bu zhes bya bas du ma'i bdag nyid can yin pa dang 'dra bar shes pa yang de dang 'dra bar yod mod ce na /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig la yang bu la ltos nas pha zhes bya la pha la ltos nas bu zhes bya bas du ma'i bdag nyid can yin pa dang 'dra bar shes pa yang de dang 'dra bar yod mod ce na /
translated: Just as a single person is called a father in relation to his son and is called a son in relation to his father, and thus has a multiple nature, so too, consciousness exists in that way.

original: de ni pha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni pha dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To this he says, “But a father and so on . . . ”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snying stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: snying stobs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Because of the nature of pleasure and so on . . . ”

original: snying stobs ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: snying stobs ni bde ba'o //
translated: Pleasure is sattva.

original: rdul ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: rdul ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Pain is rajas.

original: mun pa ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: mun pa ni gti mug ste /
translated: Delusion is tamas.

original: snying stobs la sogs pa de dag kyang gcig pu brtan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba tsam du brtags kyi /
analyzed: snying stobs la sogs pa de dag kyang gcig pu brtan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par 'gyur ba tsam du brtags kyi /
translated: And because sattva and so on are single and stable, they are imagined to be mere transformations.

original: 'gro ba ni de las skyes pa ma yin pas yang dag par na snying stobs la sogs pa ni pha yang ma yin bu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni de las skyes pa ma yin pas yang dag par na snying stobs la sogs pa ni pha yang ma yin bu yang ma yin no //
translated: But since the world is not born from them, in reality sattva and so on are neither fathers nor sons.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar yin pa des na yang dag pa nyid du ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar yin pa des na yang dag pa nyid du ma yin no //
translated: And because they are present now, they are not real.

original: de bzhin du sgra nye bar mi gnas pa'i tshe na yang sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa gzugs kyi shes pa'i rang bzhin ldan par yang ma mthong zhing mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra nye bar mi gnas pa'i tshe na yang sgra 'dzin pa'i shes pa gzugs kyi shes pa'i rang bzhin ldan par yang ma mthong zhing mi snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, when sound is not present, the consciousness that apprehends sound is not seen to have the nature of the consciousness of form.

original: de bas na sgra'i shes pa de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sgra'i shes pa de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness of sound does not exist.

original: 'on te de nyid ces bya ba'i sgra'i shes pa de nyid gar mkhan dang 'dra bar tshul gzhan gyis gzugs kyi shes par snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid ces bya ba'i sgra'i shes pa de nyid gar mkhan dang 'dra bar tshul gzhan gyis gzugs kyi shes par snang ba yin te /
translated: Or, the consciousness of sound, called “that very thing,” appears as the consciousness of form by another mode, like an actor.

original: dper na gar mkhan gzugs gzhan gyis 'jigs sder ston la gzhan gyis ni srid sgrub tu ston te /
analyzed: dper na gar mkhan gzugs gzhan gyis 'jigs sder ston la gzhan gyis ni srid sgrub tu ston te /
translated: For example, an actor shows one form to one person and another form to another.

original: de yang de dang 'dra'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra'o zhe na /
translated: It is like that.

original: de lta na ni shes pa de yang gar mkhan dang 'dra bar rtag cing ther zug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni shes pa de yang gar mkhan dang 'dra bar rtag cing ther zug pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, that consciousness, like an actor, is not permanent and stable.

original: gal te de nyid rang bzhin gzhan yin no zhes rtog na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid rang bzhin gzhan yin no zhes rtog na /
translated: If you think that very thing is another nature,

original: de'i gcig pa nyid 'di ni sngon chad med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i gcig pa nyid 'di ni sngon chad med pa yin te /
translated: then its oneness is unprecedented.

original: gzhan pa dang gzhan gcig pa nyid 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa dang gzhan gcig pa nyid 'di ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because being different and being the same are mutually exclusive.

original: de lta gcig pa bkag pa na rang bzhin gzhan yin pa ni brdzun pa yin te /🔽de ltar med do zhes zer ba ni de ltar na bdag de'i rang gi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: de lta gcig pa bkag pa na rang bzhin gzhan yin pa ni brdzun pa yin te / de ltar med do zhes zer ba ni de ltar na bdag de'i rang gi rang bzhin nam /
translated: When one is refuted, the other is false.

original: ngo bo ji lta bu yin pa smos shig ces dris pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo ji lta bu yin pa smos shig ces dris pa'o //
translated: Thus, if you say that it does not exist in that way, then tell us what is the essence or nature of that self?

original: @76b gal te de'i rang gi ngo bo shes pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @76b gal te de'i rang gi ngo bo shes pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that its nature is consciousness,

original: de lta na ni skyes bu thams cad gcig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni skyes bu thams cad gcig tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it follows that all persons are the same,

original: grol ba dang ma grol ba'i skyes bu rnams gcig kho nar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod do //🔽gzhan yang sems dang bcas pa'i skyes bu dang / sems med pa'i rang bzhin de gnyis gcig pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol ba dang ma grol ba'i skyes bu rnams gcig kho nar 'gyur ba'i skyon yod do // gzhan yang sems dang bcas pa'i skyes bu dang / sems med pa'i rang bzhin de gnyis gcig pa kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because liberated and nonliberated persons would be the same.🔽Moreover, it follows that the conscious person and the unconscious nature would be the same.

original: yang grangs can gyis de shes pa dang rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid du mnyam zhing mtshungs te /
analyzed: yang grangs can gyis de shes pa dang rang bzhin ni yod pa nyid du mnyam zhing mtshungs te /
translated: Again, the Sāṃkhya may say: Consciousness and nature exist equally and similarly.

original: de'i phyir gcig pa nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig pa nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they are asserted to be identical.

original: dbu ma pas gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽gang gi tshe skyes bu dang rang bzhin gnyis sems dang sems med pa'i bye brag gi khyad par gang yin pa de med cing rim dang rim ma yin par byed pa dang bral bas ri bong gi ra ltar med pas phyin ci log yin na /
analyzed: dbu ma pas gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gang gi tshe skyes bu dang rang bzhin gnyis sems dang sems med pa'i bye brag gi khyad par gang yin pa de med cing rim dang rim ma yin par byed pa dang bral bas ri bong gi ra ltar med pas phyin ci log yin na /
translated: The Madhyamikas say, “When, etc.”

original: de'i tshe 'dra ba'i rkyen gang zhig yin te ci yang med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dra ba'i rkyen gang zhig yin te ci yang med do //
translated: When the person and intrinsic reality are not different in terms of being mental or non-mental, and are like the horns of a rabbit in being nonexistent because they are devoid of sequential and non-sequential activity, then what condition of similarity is there? Nothing at all!

original: de bas na gcig pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na gcig pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, they are not identical.

original: 'di dag gis ni rgyu la sogs pa spyi dang ris mthun pa dag kyang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rgyu la sogs pa spyi dang ris mthun pa dag kyang gsal ba yin no //
translated: These arguments also clarify that universals such as cause and so on are instances.

original: de ltar re zhig bdag sems dang ldan pa yin par tshad mas bkag pa dang / sems med pa nyid yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bdag sems dang ldan pa yin par tshad mas bkag pa dang / sems med pa nyid yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Thus, the thesis that the self is conscious has been refuted by valid cognition, and if you say that it is unconscious,

original: de'i phyir sems med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems med pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: then the Madhyamikas say, “Even if it is unconscious, etc.”

original: yang gzhan dag na re bdag der sngar sems med pa yin yang bdag nyid kyi yon tan shes pa zhes bya ba yod pa de dang phrad pa las kyang shes pa can du 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re bdag der sngar sems med pa yin yang bdag nyid kyi yon tan shes pa zhes bya ba yod pa de dang phrad pa las kyang shes pa can du 'gyur ro zhes zer na /
translated: Again, others say: “Even though the self did not previously have mind, it becomes one who has mind through contact with what is called the self’s knowledge.”

original: de lta na ni snga ma'i mi shes pa de 'jig cing med pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni snga ma'i mi shes pa de 'jig cing med pas mi rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then since the previous absence of knowledge would be destroyed and cease to exist, it follows that the self would be impermanent.

original: 'on te rtag pa yin par 'gyur bas med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa yin par 'gyur bas med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is permanent, then it does not exist.

original: de'i tshe bdag 'di la shes pa yod pa'i sems dang phrad du zin kyang ci zhig bya ste /🔽ci yang ma byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag 'di la shes pa yod pa'i sems dang phrad du zin kyang ci zhig bya ste / ci yang ma byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: At that time, what would be the point of the self coming into contact with a mind that has knowledge?🔽It would not do anything at all.

original: de ltar bya ba med pa zhig yod du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar bya ba med pa zhig yod du yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that something that does not perform a function exists.

original: shes pa med cing bya ba med pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bas de la bdag tu sgro btags pas bdag tu byas pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa med cing bya ba med pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bas de la bdag tu sgro btags pas bdag tu byas pa yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is like space, it is not tenable that it is designated as a self because it is a self.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzegs zan pa yang 'di skad du de ltar bdag med na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis yid du 'ong ba dang / 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba dang 'brel ba yod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzegs zan pa yang 'di skad du de ltar bdag med na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis yid du 'ong ba dang / 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba dang 'brel ba yod par mi rigs te /
translated: The followers of Kanada say this: If there is no self, it is illogical that pleasant and unpleasant results would be related to virtuous and nonvirtuous karma,

original: las byas @77a * //
analyzed: las byas @77a * //
translated: because after karma is performed,

original: nas sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma 'jig pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: nas sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma 'jig pa'i rjes la /
translated: the previous moment of mind that performed the karma ceases,

original: sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan nyid 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma gzhan nyid 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: and another moment of mind arises.

original: las de ni gzhan pa de'i ni ma yin pas de'i 'bras bu myong na shin tu thal ches par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de ni gzhan pa de'i ni ma yin pas de'i 'bras bu myong na shin tu thal ches par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that karma is not that other mind, it is utterly implausible that it would experience the result.

original: las de gang gi yin pa 'jig par 'gyur bas 'bras bu gang gi yin zhes smra na /
analyzed: las de gang gi yin pa 'jig par 'gyur bas 'bras bu gang gi yin zhes smra na /
translated: Since that karma would be destroyed, what would its result be?

original: de'i phyir yu bu cag gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yu bu cag gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, we say that both of us🔽have a basis that is different.

original: 'di dang phyi ma'i gzhi tha dad pa gang la yod pa de ni gzhi tha dad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dang phyi ma'i gzhi tha dad pa gang la yod pa de ni gzhi tha dad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which has a different basis is called “different.”

original: las 'dir byas pa'i 'bras bu phal cher ni phyi mar 'byung la /
analyzed: las 'dir byas pa'i 'bras bu phal cher ni phyi mar 'byung la /
translated: The effects of actions done here are mostly experienced in the next life.

original: bya ba dang 'bras bu de dag la bdag gang yin pa de ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir bya ba med cing bya ba dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang 'bras bu de dag la bdag gang yin pa de ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir bya ba med cing bya ba dang bral ba yin no //
translated: And since the self is permanent, it is devoid of action and free from action.

original: de bas na 'dir bdag byed pa po dang tshor ba po yin pa la sogs pa'i smra ba de ni log pa yin pas don med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bdag byed pa po dang tshor ba po yin pa la sogs pa'i smra ba de ni log pa yin pas don med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the assertion that the self is the agent and the experiencer here is false and meaningless,

original: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can gcig gi rgyud kho na la kha zas mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang ldan na nad la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa tshe 'di nyid la snang /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can gcig gi rgyud kho na la kha zas mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang ldan na nad la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa tshe 'di nyid la snang /
translated: Others say: In the continuum of a single sentient being, when there is a cause such as incompatible food, the effect such as illness is seen in this life.

original: tshe phyi ma la yang bdag de dang 'dra mod ce na /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la yang bdag de dang 'dra mod ce na /
translated: The self in the next life is similar to that.

original: de'i phyir rgyur bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyur bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the self is endowed with cause and so on.

original: tshe 'di nyid la yang sems can rnams bya ba dang ldan pa'i sems can yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la yang sems can rnams bya ba dang ldan pa'i sems can yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin gyi /
translated: In this life too, sentient beings are momentary because they are sentient beings who possess activity.

original: skad cig ma yin pa dag ni rim dang rim ma yin pas mi byed pas med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa dag ni rim dang rim ma yin pas mi byed pas med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But since those who are momentary do not perform actions in a sequential or nonsequential order, it is impossible to say that they possess effects.

original: rgyu dang bcas shing ldan pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu dang ldan par snang ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni mi srid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas shing ldan pa gang yin pa de 'bras bu dang ldan par snang ngo zhes bya ba 'di ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to say that that which possesses a cause and possesses an effect is seen to possess an effect.

original: 'o na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byed pa po dang longs spyod pa por gsungs pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis byed pa po dang longs spyod pa por gsungs pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But it is said that the Bhagavān Buddha taught that there is an agent and an experiencer.

original: de'i phyir rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore he said, “The continuum,” and so on.

original: da ni sems skad cig ma'i rgyun du gnas pa snga phyi'i 'brel ba la dgongs nas las chud mi za bar ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni sems skad cig ma'i rgyun du gnas pa snga phyi'i 'brel ba la dgongs nas las chud mi za bar ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Now, intending the continuum of momentary mind that endures through its connection with what is prior and subsequent, he teaches that karma is not wasted.

original: de ltar yin na yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i sems gang yin pa de bdag ces bya ba'i nga rgyal gyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang 'das pa la sogs pa'i sems gang yin pa de bdag ces bya ba'i nga rgyal gyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir bdag nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is so, then since the mind of the past, etc. is the basis of the pride that thinks “I am,” it is the self.

original: de'i phyir 'das dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, Candrakīrti says, “The past and future mind are not the self,” etc.

original: de la re zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems med pa yin pa'i phyir gzhir mi rung bas bdag ma yin la 'on te da ltar byung ba'i sems bdag yin par @77b 'dod na da ltar gyi yang byung ma thag 'jig pa yin pas gzhir mi rung
analyzed: de la re zhig 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems med pa yin pa'i phyir gzhir mi rung bas bdag ma yin la 'on te da ltar byung ba'i sems bdag yin par @77b 'dod na da ltar gyi yang byung ma thag 'jig pa yin pas gzhir mi rung
translated: The past and future mind are not the self because they are not suitable as a basis since they do not exist. But if you assert that the present mind is the self, then since the present mind ceases as soon as it arises, it is not suitable as a basis.

original: ste / sems de med la /
analyzed: ste / sems de med la /
translated: Since that mind does not exist,

original: de med pas bdag kyang med do //
analyzed: de med pas bdag kyang med do //
translated: the self also does not exist.

original: gal te lus dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bsdus pa la spyir bdag ces bya bar 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bsdus pa la spyir bdag ces bya bar 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you assert that the self is a general term that includes the body, mind, and the collection of mental factors,

original: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: then Candrakīrti says, “How can the self be the appropriator?”

original: dper na 'di na chu shing gi phung po la cha shas su phye zhing phyogs char rnam par bsal na cha shas can gyi dngos po ci yang med pa dang 'dra bar phung po rnams la bdag ces bya yang rnam par dpyad cing btsal na yang dag pa
analyzed: dper na 'di na chu shing gi phung po la cha shas su phye zhing phyogs char rnam par bsal na cha shas can gyi dngos po ci yang med pa dang 'dra bar phung po rnams la bdag ces bya yang rnam par dpyad cing btsal na yang dag pa
translated: For example, just as a mass of plantain trees, when divided into parts and analyzed into directions, has no real entity of a part-possessor, so also, when the aggregates are called “self,” when analyzed and sought, they are not real

original: ma yin pas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and do not exist.

original: de yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas /
translated: Moreover, the noble Nāgārjuna says:

original: rin po che'i phreng ba las /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba las /
translated: In the Precious Garland,

original: bdag yod ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas nga rgyal bsal ba mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag yod ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas nga rgyal bsal ba mdzad pa yin no //
translated: he removes pride with statements such as “The self does not exist.”

original: de bas na rnam par dpyad cing kun tu btsal na yang dag pa ma yin pa kho nar mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par dpyad cing kun tu btsal na yang dag pa ma yin pa kho nar mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, when analyzed and thoroughly sought, it is seen to be only unreal.

original: 'o na khyed 'dod pa'i 'gro ba'i don byed par mi 'grub po zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na khyed 'dod pa'i 'gro ba'i don byed par mi 'grub po zhe na ;
translated: Well then, you do not establish the purpose of migrating beings.

original: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, “If, for the sake of a purpose,” and so on.

original: dgos pa'i don du sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i don du sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: The purpose is for the sake of the goal of pacifying suffering.

original: khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas sam /🔽bdag gis byas pas bdag nyid du ni rab brtags gang //
analyzed: khas blangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas sam / bdag gis byas pas bdag nyid du ni rab brtags gang //
translated: “Acceptance” means desire.

original: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis sems can du rab tu brtags pa sgro btags pa gang yin pa de la snying rje byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis sems can du rab tu brtags pa sgro btags pa gang yin pa de la snying rje byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “That which is imagined as a self by one’s own action” means that compassion is for that which is imagined as a sentient being, that is, superimposed, by delusion.

original: gzhan dag na re sems can med na dgos pa nyid su'i don du bya ste mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sems can med na dgos pa nyid su'i don du bya ste mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: Others say: If there are no sentient beings, for whose sake is the aim? It is not possible.

original: de'i phyir sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says “sentient being,” etc.

original: sems can med na dgos pa de su'i dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can med na dgos pa de su'i dgos pa yin te /
translated: If there are no sentient beings, whose aim is that aim?

original: su'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: su'i yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not anyone’s.

original: bden yang zhes bya ba ni bden mod kyi zhes khas blangs pa'o //🔽don du zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden yang zhes bya ba ni bden mod kyi zhes khas blangs pa'o // don du zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don bya ba'o //
translated: “Even though” means “even though it is so,” that is, even though it is accepted.🔽“In reality” means in the performance of the aims of self and others.

original: bdag btags zhes bya ba 'di 'dod pa'am 'gro ba'i don gyis la bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag btags zhes bya ba 'di 'dod pa'am 'gro ba'i don gyis la bya ba'o //
translated: “I am imagined” means that it is desired or intended for the sake of beings.

original: bya ba de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal nyid yin na yang sdug bsngal rnams nye bar zhi ba'i don nyid du bya ba'i rmongs pa 'di ni dgag cing bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba de ni sgro 'dogs pa'i dbang gis sdug bsngal nyid yin na yang sdug bsngal rnams nye bar zhi ba'i don nyid du bya ba'i rmongs pa 'di ni dgag cing bzlog par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That activity is suffering due to the influence of reification, but this delusion about the very purpose of the pacification of suffering should not be stopped or reversed.

original: de yang rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa rmongs pa las ni nga rgyal 'byung la /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa dang bdag la sogs pa rmongs pa las ni nga rgyal 'byung la /
translated: Moreover, pride arises from delusion about permanence, self, and so on.

original: de ni sdug bsngal 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pas /
translated: Since that is the cause of the increase of suffering,

original: de nyid ni bzlog par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de nyid ni bzlog par bya dgos so //
translated: it is precisely that which must be stopped.

original: de skad du @78a * //
analyzed: de skad du @78a * //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: smras pa dang / gzhan dag na re sems can tsam du sgro 'dogs pa'i khyed kyi rmongs pa des kyang nga rgyal bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa dang / gzhan dag na re sems can tsam du sgro 'dogs pa'i khyed kyi rmongs pa des kyang nga rgyal bzlog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Others say: “Even your delusion that reifies mere sentient beings does not stop pride.

original: bya ba'i rmongs pa yang rmongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu bzlog par mi nus la /
analyzed: bya ba'i rmongs pa yang rmongs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi rgyu bzlog par mi nus la /
translated: Since the delusion of activity is itself delusion, it cannot stop the cause of suffering.

original: de mi nus pas na thar pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de mi nus pas na thar pa med do zhe na /
translated: Since that is not possible, there is no liberation.”

original: byang chub 'dod pa rnams kyis ni sgyu ma lta bu la snying rje bya zhing bdag med pa shes pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub 'dod pa rnams kyis ni sgyu ma lta bu la snying rje bya zhing bdag med pa shes pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who desire enlightenment should cultivate compassion toward the illusion-like world and should cultivate only the knowledge of selflessness.

original: bdag med bsgom pa mchog yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bdag med bsgom pa mchog yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the cultivation of selflessness is supreme.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma'i tshul de las kyang bzlog par mi 'gyur zhes khyed smra na ;
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu snga ma'i tshul de las kyang bzlog par mi 'gyur zhes khyed smra na ;
translated: Or, if you maintain that the cause of suffering cannot be reversed,

original: de ltar na bdag med pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med pa bsgoms te /
translated: then, having cultivated selflessness,

original: sel bas de mchog yin mod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sel bas de mchog yin mod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it is indeed supreme because it eliminates that.

original: sems yod pa dang med pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis bdag med par sun byung ba na yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lus zhes bya ba sems dang 'brel pa yod bas bdag yod do zhe na /
analyzed: sems yod pa dang med pa dgag pa'i tshul gyis bdag med par sun byung ba na yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i lus zhes bya ba sems dang 'brel pa yod bas bdag yod do zhe na /
translated: If you are disgusted with selflessness by the method of negating the existence and nonexistence of mind, then you might think that the self exists because the body, which has the character of a whole, exists and is related to the mind.

original: de'i phyir lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni lus rjes su dran pa yang ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni lus rjes su dran pa yang ston to //
translated: Therefore, the statement “The body” and so on teaches the mindfulness of the body.

original: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni yan lag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la zhes bya ba ni yan lag la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Everything” refers to the parts and so on.

original: cha ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha ni lag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The parts are the arms and so on.

original: cha re ni sor mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cha re ni sor mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The subdivisions of the parts are the fingers and so on.

original: yan lag dang nyid lag de ltar gnas par gyur pa yin na de lta bu ma yin pa'i yan lag can gdags pa'i lus de yan lag las logs shig na bdag nyid gang na gnas /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag de ltar gnas par gyur pa yin na de lta bu ma yin pa'i yan lag can gdags pa'i lus de yan lag las logs shig na bdag nyid gang na gnas /
translated: If the parts and subdivisions are arranged in a certain way, then the body is designated as such, but where is the body apart from the parts?

original: de bzhin du lus ni gcig pu'am phra rab tsam gyi cha shas su yang brtag par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus ni gcig pu'am phra rab tsam gyi cha shas su yang brtag par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: In the same way, the body is not to be imagined as a single unit or as a collection of subtle particles.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin phyi nang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin phyi nang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In the same way, externally and internally.

original: de bas na de'i dbyibs su bkod pa'i khyad par gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi tshogs pa'i khyad par gyis sdong dum gyi shing la 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mi'i blo skye ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i dbyibs su bkod pa'i khyad par gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi tshogs pa'i khyad par gyis sdong dum gyi shing la 'dra ba'i tshul gyis mi'i blo skye ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the idea of a person arises in regard to a body that is arranged in a certain way, like the idea of a tree in regard to a certain arrangement of branches.

original: sdong dum la dus cung zad cig thag ring po nas skyes bu'i blo 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: sdong dum la dus cung zad cig thag ring po nas skyes bu'i blo 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The idea of a person arises in regard to a stump for a short time in the distance.

original: lag pa la sogs pa la gam du nye ba 'am ;
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa la gam du nye ba 'am ;
translated: The idea of a person arises in regard to arms and so on that are nearby.

original: dus yun ring por yang lus kyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur bas mi 'dra'o zhe na /
analyzed: dus yun ring por yang lus kyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur bas mi 'dra'o zhe na /
translated: But it is not similar, because the idea of a body arises for a long time.

original: de'i phyir ji srid rkyen ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid rkyen ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “As long as the conditions . . . ”

original: sdong dum gyi shing rgyang ring ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi tshogs pas mig dang pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen gyi tshogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sdong dum gyi shing rgyang ring ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi tshogs pas mig dang pa gang yin pa de ni rkyen gyi tshogs pa yin la /
translated: The collection of conditions of a stump, such as distance, etc., is the collection of conditions of the eye consciousness.

original: 'dir lag pa la @78b sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dir lag pa la @78b sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the hand, etc.

original: glegs bam la las ji srid lus la sogs zhes smos te /
analyzed: glegs bam la las ji srid lus la sogs zhes smos te /
translated: Some texts say, “As long as the body . . . ”

original: de ni gzhan du bshad par bya ste /🔽ci srid du gti mug gi rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod pa de srid du lus la skyes bu med du zin kyang skyes bu ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: de ni gzhan du bshad par bya ste / ci srid du gti mug gi rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod pa de srid du lus la skyes bu med du zin kyang skyes bu ltar snang ngo //
translated: This will be explained later.🔽As long as the collection of conditions of delusion exists, the body appears as a person, even though there is no person in the body.

original: de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa la yang rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod pa de srid kyi bar du 'dir lag pa la sogs pa lus su rmongs pa'i dbang gis snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa la sogs pa la yang rkyen gyi tshogs pa yod pa de srid kyi bar du 'dir lag pa la sogs pa lus su rmongs pa'i dbang gis snang ngo //
translated: In the same way, as long as the collection of conditions of the hand, etc., exists, the hand, etc., appear as a body, through the power of delusion.

original: phyogs snga ma ni sdong dub dang lus de gnyis med pa yin par bye brag med par ston to //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma ni sdong dub dang lus de gnyis med pa yin par bye brag med par ston to //
translated: The opponent is showing that the tree and the body are not different in being nonexistent.

original: de ltar lus med par bkag na de dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi rkang pa la sogs pa la bsgre ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar lus med par bkag na de dang mtshungs pa nyid kyi rkang pa la sogs pa la bsgre ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, having refuted the existence of the body, in order to show that the same is to be applied to the feet and so on, he says:

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽sor mo de yang tshigs kyi tshogs yin pas de med pa'i sor mo gzhan ga la yod /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sor mo de yang tshigs kyi tshogs yin pas de med pa'i sor mo gzhan ga la yod /
translated: So too, the fingers and so on.🔽Since the fingers are a collection of joints, how can there be a finger that is not those?

original: tshigs kyang cha shas kyis phye na de las gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: tshigs kyang cha shas kyis phye na de las gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: Since the joints are divisible into parts, what else is there apart from those?

original: cha shas kyang rdul phra rab dbye bas phye na /
analyzed: cha shas kyang rdul phra rab dbye bas phye na /
translated: Since the parts are divisible into subtle particles,

original: de las gzhan pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ci zhig yod /
translated: what else is there apart from those?

original: rdul phra rab de yang phyogs kyi cha shas drug tu phye na gang zhig yod /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de yang phyogs kyi cha shas drug tu phye na gang zhig yod /
translated: Since the subtle particles are divisible into six parts, what is there?

original: phyogs kyi cha shas de yang cha shas med pa yin pas nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi cha shas de yang cha shas med pa yin pas nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Since those parts are partless, they are similar to space.

original: rgyu gang gis de ltar gzhigs pa des na rdul phran yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis de ltar gzhigs pa des na rdul phran yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they are divisible in this way, the subtle particles do not exist.

original: tshul de ltar gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la su zhig chags shing zhen par byed de /
analyzed: tshul de ltar gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la su zhig chags shing zhen par byed de /
translated: In this way, who would be attached to what is called form, or cling to the form aggregate?

original: chags pa'i gnas med do //
analyzed: chags pa'i gnas med do //
translated: There is no basis for attachment.

original: de ltar re zhig lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad nas /🔽tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad nas / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, having explained the application of mindfulness to the body,

original: gal te tshor ba sdug bsngal yang dag par ram /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba sdug bsngal yang dag par ram /
translated: in order to explain the application of mindfulness to feeling, he says, “If feeling were real, etc.”

original: don dam par nges par yod na yid rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ci'i phyir 'gog cing sel bar mi byed /
analyzed: don dam par nges par yod na yid rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa de dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ci'i phyir 'gog cing sel bar mi byed /
translated: If feeling were real, or ultimate, then why would one stop or eliminate that which is not conducive to mental joy, etc.?

original: de mi byed pa las na sdug bsngal yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de mi byed pa las na sdug bsngal yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since one does not do that, feeling is not real.

original: de bzhin du gal te bde ba yang dag par yod na mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa na gos dang mal stan la sogs pa bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te bde ba yang dag par yod na mya ngan la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa na gos dang mal stan la sogs pa bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Similarly, if pleasure were real, then when one is afflicted by the suffering of grief, etc., clothing, bedding, etc. would be the cause of pleasure.

original: bde ba de ci'i phyir 'dod pa las na bde ba yang dag par med do //
analyzed: bde ba de ci'i phyir 'dod pa las na bde ba yang dag par med do //
translated: If you say that pleasure is not real because it is desired,🔽then suffering would not be real because it is not desired.

original: gal te bde ba 'am sdug bsngal lam rga ba dang mya ngan la sogs pa mnga' ba'i stobs kyis @79a * //
analyzed: gal te bde ba 'am sdug bsngal lam rga ba dang mya ngan la sogs pa mnga' ba'i stobs kyis @79a * //
translated: If you say that he does not experience pleasure or suffering because he has conquered them by the power of his sovereignty,

original: zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir de ma myang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir de ma myang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then how can he be said to have feeling?

original: bde ba'am sdug bsngal gang yang rung ba zhig nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can med na de'i tshor ba nyid ji lta bu yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'am sdug bsngal gang yang rung ba zhig nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid can med na de'i tshor ba nyid ji lta bu yin te /
translated: If he does not have the nature of experiencing either pleasure or suffering, how can he have feeling?

original: tshor bar bzhag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshor bar bzhag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to posit him as having feeling.

original: tshor ba nyams su myong ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshor ba nyams su myong ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The experience of feeling is threefold:

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa yin mod kyi /
translated: You may say that these are desired,

original: 'on kyang skyes bu dga' ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba phra ba'i bdag nyid can du yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu dga' ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba phra ba'i bdag nyid can du yod do zhe na /
translated: but for a person who is happy, suffering exists in a subtle form.

original: de lta yin na sdug bsngal 'di'i rigs pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na sdug bsngal 'di'i rigs pa nyid ni yang dag pa nyid du yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then this kind of suffering would not exist in reality.

original: sdug bsngal phra ba de yang de las gzhan pa'i rab tu dga' ba rnams kyis bde ba nyams su myong ba cung zad kyang 'gog par mi nus bas med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phra ba de yang de las gzhan pa'i rab tu dga' ba rnams kyis bde ba nyams su myong ba cung zad kyang 'gog par mi nus bas med pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: And that subtle suffering cannot be prevented by the slightest experience of pleasure that is different from it.

original: yang gzhan pa zhes bya ba bde ba'i tshor ba ni dga' ba tsam du gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: yang gzhan pa zhes bya ba bde ba'i tshor ba ni dga' ba tsam du gyur pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the feeling of pleasure is just a kind of joy,

original: de'i phyir dga' ba tsam de la sdug bsngal gyi phra ba nyid kyis bde ba'i tshor ba la mi gnod pas sdug bsngal yang phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tshor ba myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba tsam de la sdug bsngal gyi phra ba nyid kyis bde ba'i tshor ba la mi gnod pas sdug bsngal yang phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tshor ba myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then that joy is not a feeling of pleasure because it is not harmed by the subtle suffering. And that suffering is not a feeling because it is subtle.

original: gal te sdug bsngal dang mi mthun pa dga' ba'i rkyen byung ba na sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal dang mi mthun pa dga' ba'i rkyen byung ba na sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing skye bar mi 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: If the condition of joy arises that is incompatible with suffering, then suffering does not arise and is not produced.

original: de bzhin du mya ngan la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad par gyur pa na bde ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mya ngan la sogs pa'i rkyen dang phrad par gyur pa na bde ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: Likewise, when one encounters the conditions of sorrow and so on, pleasure does not arise.

original: gnyis po 'di dag phan tshun ltos pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di dag phan tshun ltos pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Since these two are mutually dependent, pleasure and pain do not arise.

original: de ltar na rkyen phan tshun 'dres pas tshor ba yang med pa yin pas brtags pa la mngon par zhen pa tsam yin no zhes de dang der bshad pa de ni rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na rkyen phan tshun 'dres pas tshor ba yang med pa yin pas brtags pa la mngon par zhen pa tsam yin no zhes de dang der bshad pa de ni rigs pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, since the conditions are mutually mixed, feeling also does not exist. Therefore, it is merely attachment to conceptualization. This is explained in various places. That is reasonable,

original: mya ngan dang dga' ba la sogs pa ni brtags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan dang dga' ba la sogs pa ni brtags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir yang dag par na rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid kyang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sorrow, joy, and so on are mere conceptualization. Even in terms of cause and effect, they do not really meet.

original: de ltar na ma grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa yin du zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas shin tu mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis bde ba la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid nyams su myong bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ma grub cing rnam par mi rtog pa yin du zin kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas shin tu mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis bde ba la sogs pa sgyu ma lta bu nyid nyams su myong bar snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, although they are unestablished and nonconceptual, due to the power of intense attachment from beginningless time, the illusion-like nature of pleasure and so on appears to be experienced.

original: de bas na brtags pa la mngon par zhen pa 'di ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa 'di @79b nyid 'di'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bdag nyid can bsgom par bya zhing goms par
analyzed: de bas na brtags pa la mngon par zhen pa 'di ni brdzun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par dpyad pa gang yin pa 'di @79b nyid 'di'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bdag nyid can bsgom par bya zhing goms par
translated: Therefore, since this attachment to investigation is false, this very analysis is its antidote. Thus, one should cultivate and become habituated to the mindfulness of feeling,

original: bya ste / log par mngon par zhen pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di gzhom par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ste / log par mngon par zhen pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di gzhom par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to destroy the afflictions that are due to false attachment.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par dpyad pa nyid yid la bya ba bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par dpyad pa nyid yid la bya ba bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should keep in mind the very analysis of the nature of attachment.

original: ci ltar na gnyen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na gnyen po yin zhe na /
translated: How is it an antidote?

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, he says, “conceptualization,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this way, “conceptualization”

original: de kho na nyid la rnam par dpyod pa la mngon par zhen cing dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid la rnam par dpyod pa la mngon par zhen cing dga' ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi rtog pa ste /
translated: is a thought that is characterized by attachment to and delight in the analysis of reality.

original: de kho na nyid ma yin par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen por gyur cing de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ma yin par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen por gyur cing de las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i bsam gtan te /
translated: The concentration of conceptual thought arises from that.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i zas te /
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i zas te /
translated: That is the food of the uncontaminated.

original: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can de gang la yod pa de ni rnal 'byor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can de gang la yod pa de ni rnal 'byor bar 'gyur te /
translated: One who has that is a yogi, because the gnosis of reality arises from that.

original: thos pa las bsam pa /
analyzed: thos pa las bsam pa /
translated: From hearing, there is reflection.

original: de las bsgom pa /
analyzed: de las bsgom pa /
translated: From that, there is meditation.

original: de las de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las de kho na nyid kyi ye shes skye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: From that, the gnosis of reality arises.

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma'i seng ges sgyu ma'i glang po che bsad pa ni yang dag pa nyid du ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma'i seng ges sgyu ma'i glang po che bsad pa ni yang dag pa nyid du ma yin no //
translated: Thus, a magical lion does not truly kill a magical elephant.

original: de bzhin du de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pas log pa rnam par rtog pa yang dag par med bzhin du 'joms pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de kho na nyid rnam par dpyod pas log pa rnam par rtog pa yang dag par med bzhin du 'joms pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the analysis of reality destroys false conceptual thought, which is non-existent, as if it were existent.

original: de lta yin du chug na /
analyzed: de lta yin du chug na /
translated: Even if that is so,

original: de kho na nyid kyi rnam par rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rnam par rtag pa la mngon par zhen pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so zhe na /
translated: The Blessed One has said that the feeling that is conditioned by contact is the manifest clinging to the reality of the contact.

original: de'i phyir dbang don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, “The sense faculties and objects are not in contact.”

original: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i dmigs par bya ba'i don yin pas na don te /
analyzed: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'o // de'i dmigs par bya ba'i don yin pas na don te /
translated: The sense faculties are the eye, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objects are the objects of observation of those sense faculties, such as form, etc.

original: de gnyis bar mtshams dang bcas pa'i ni rdul phra rab ma 'dres par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis bar mtshams dang bcas pa'i ni rdul phra rab ma 'dres par 'gyur te /
translated: If those two are not in contact, then the atoms are not mixed.

original: de ltar gyur na ni dbang po dang yul 'di dag 'dus phrad pa med na reg pa med pa'i phyir tshor ba yang ga la yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni dbang po dang yul 'di dag 'dus phrad pa med na reg pa med pa'i phyir tshor ba yang ga la yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: If that is the case, then since the sense faculties and objects are not in contact, how can there be contact? And if there is no contact, how can there be feeling?

original: de ltar smras pa de yang yang dag par na rdul phra rab yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar smras pa de yang yang dag par na rdul phra rab yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although in reality atoms do not exist,

original: sun phyung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas rdul phra rab khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: sun phyung ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas nas rdul phra rab khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: we accept atoms in terms of the perspective of those who refute the existence of gross objects.

original: gzhan dag na re de ni bar mtshams med pa'i tshul gyis gnas so zhen mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de ni bar mtshams med pa'i tshul gyis gnas so zhen mi rung ste /
translated: Others say: It is not tenable that it exists in the manner of no interval,

original: gcig pu yin pa la gzhan dang 'du zhing phrad pa'i tha snyad mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pu yin pa la gzhan dang 'du zhing phrad pa'i tha snyad mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the term meeting or contact is not used for a single thing.

original: de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi nang du rdul phra rab 'jug pa yang @80a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi nang du rdul phra rab 'jug pa yang @80a * //
translated: Similarly, it is not tenable that one subtle particle enters another subtle particle.

original: med de ; gal te de la 'jug pa'i go skabs kyis nam mkha' yod na lta 'jug tu rung na /
analyzed: med de ; gal te de la 'jug pa'i go skabs kyis nam mkha' yod na lta 'jug tu rung na /
translated: If space exists as an interval in which it enters, then it is possible for it to enter.

original: de med pa'i phyir des na de dag mnyam pa nyid mtshungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir des na de dag mnyam pa nyid mtshungs pa yin la /
translated: But since that does not exist, they are the same in being equal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dre bar 'du ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dre bar 'du ba yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because they do not mix,

original: de med pas cha shas med pa la 'du ba dang phrad par ji lta bu'i tshul gyis kyang rigs pa dang 'thad pas sgrub tu rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pas cha shas med pa la 'du ba dang phrad par ji lta bu'i tshul gyis kyang rigs pa dang 'thad pas sgrub tu rung ba ma yin no //
translated: since that does not exist, how could it be tenable that they are established by means of a rational proof that is consistent with the fact that they are partless and meet?

original: de'i phyir phan tshun gnyis 'dus pa dang cha shas med pa gnyis pa nyid gcig tu sgrub pa ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun gnyis 'dus pa dang cha shas med pa gnyis pa nyid gcig tu sgrub pa ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that two things that are partless and mutually meet are established as one.

original: gal te de lta bu yod pa mthong na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu yod pa mthong na /
translated: If you see such a thing,

original: yod pa'i dpe dang gtan tshigs bstan par gyis shig ces sun dbyung ba ste /
analyzed: yod pa'i dpe dang gtan tshigs bstan par gyis shig ces sun dbyung ba ste /
translated: then show an example and reason for existence.

original: bstan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: bstan du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning is that it is not suitable to be shown.

original: de bzhin du gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang 'du ba'i tha snyad du rung ba ma yin ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na yang 'du ba'i tha snyad du rung ba ma yin ste /
translated: Likewise, if it has the nature of consciousness, it is not suitable for the convention of contact.

original: gzugs can gyi lus med cing rang rig par 'dod pa de la 'du par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi lus med cing rang rig par 'dod pa de la 'du par mi 'thad do //
translated: Since there is no physical body and it is asserted to be reflexive awareness, contact is not tenable.

original: rkyen tshogs par yang brtags pa tsam du zad pas dngos po med pa'i phyir mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rkyen tshogs par yang brtags pa tsam du zad pas dngos po med pa'i phyir mi 'grub ste /
translated: Since the assembly of conditions is merely imputed, it is not established because it is nonexistent.

original: sngar phyogs cha drug gis dpyad nas nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa 'dra'o //
analyzed: sngar phyogs cha drug gis dpyad nas nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa 'dra'o //
translated: It is similar to space, which was previously analyzed in terms of the six directions.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pas so //
translated: Thus, etc. is a summary.

original: reg pas na reg pa ste /
analyzed: reg pas na reg pa ste /
translated: Contact is contact because of contact.

original: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa 'dus pa'am /
translated: It is the assembly of object, sense faculty, and consciousness,

original: de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i chos so //
translated: or it is a mental factor that arises from that.

original: de yang 'dus pa med par yod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dus pa med par yod pa med pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, if there is no aggregation, there is no existence.🔽If that is so, then from what cause would feeling arise?

original: de ltar med na go tshor ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu gang las kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar med na go tshor ba zhes bya ba'i rgyu gang las kun tu 'byung bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not arise.

original: nyon mongs pa ni bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pas nor la sogs pa de la'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni bde ba dang phrad pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang bral bar 'dod pa'i sred pas nor la sogs pa de la'o //
translated: Affliction is the craving that wishes for contact with pleasure and separation from pain.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bde ba med pa'o //
translated: Why? means that pleasure does not exist.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang med pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal yang med pa'o //
translated: Harm means that pain also does not exist.

original: de ltar na ni thar pa'i don du yang dka' ba byas pa la dgos pa med par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rtog pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na ni thar pa'i don du yang dka' ba byas pa la dgos pa med par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar rtog pa de'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then even the hardships undertaken for the sake of liberation would be pointless.

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that speculation, it is said:

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Because craving arises due to the condition of feeling,

original: de de ltar yod pa ma yin na de zad pa'i mtha' ni thar pa yin pas chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin mod kyis /
analyzed: de de ltar yod pa ma yin na de zad pa'i mtha' ni thar pa yin pas chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa yin mod kyis /
translated: and if that does not exist in that way, then since the end of its exhaustion is liberation, all phenomena are indeed naturally in a state of nirvana.

original: 'on kyang gnod pa'i rgyu yin pas //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod pa'i rgyu yin pas //
translated: But since it is the cause of harm,

original: srid pa ci ste 'joms mi byed //
analyzed: srid pa ci ste 'joms mi byed //
translated: why not destroy existence?

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: mngon par zhen pas sed pa'i sred pa bsal ba nyid thar pa yin @80b no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas sed pa'i sred pa bsal ba nyid thar pa yin @80b no zhes bstan to //
translated: Liberation is the removal of craving, which is tormented by attachment.🔽In this way, it is shown that the liberation of the Jains and others is not liberation.

original: 'di dag gis ni gzegs zan la sogs pa yang sun phyung ba na de rnams 'di skad du smra ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni gzegs zan la sogs pa yang sun phyung ba na de rnams 'di skad du smra ste /
translated: In this regard, the Jains and others say this:

original: rdzas ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: rdzas ni rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: “Substance is of two kinds:

original: mthong bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bar bya ba dang reg par bya ba'o //
translated: that which is seen and that which is touched.

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni mngon sum zhes bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa ni mngon sum zhes bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: Consciousness that arises from the contact of sense faculty and object is called perception.”

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i tshul gyis rdzas sam phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i tshul gyis rdzas sam phrad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But by the method of analysis, substance or contact does not exist.

original: yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rdzas bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar mthong ba'am reg tu zin kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gzugs la sogs pa'i rdzas bum pa la sogs pa dang 'dra bar mthong ba'am reg tu zin kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, even if one sees or touches a substance such as form, etc., as if it were a substance such as a pot, etc., it does not exist.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun rdzob tu khas len pa ste /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kun rdzob tu khas len pa ste /
translated: The word “also” means that it is accepted conventionally.

original: don dam par mthong ba'am reg pa gang yang med pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par mthong ba'am reg pa gang yang med pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, there is nothing to be seen or touched.

original: 'di ni rmi lam dang sgyu ma la dper byas pa'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin bdag nyid gang la yod pa'i sems te /
analyzed: 'di ni rmi lam dang sgyu ma la dper byas pa'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin bdag nyid gang la yod pa'i sems te /
translated: This is the nature of the mind that possesses merit and demerit, which is illustrated by the examples of dream and illusion.

original: rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba de ni rang bzhin rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba de ni rang bzhin rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is like a dream and illusion is not permanent by nature.

original: kun rdzob tu yang tshad mas gzhig cing bcom na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yang tshad mas gzhig cing bcom na /
translated: If it is destroyed and defeated by valid cognition even conventionally,

original: med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not nonexistent.

original: de ltar na yang sems dang lhan cig yod par snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang sems dang lhan cig yod par snang ngo //
translated: In that case, it appears to exist together with the mind.

original: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The mind and so on are mentioned.

original: sems dang tshor ba dus gcig byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir sems des tshor ba mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sems dang tshor ba dus gcig byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa yin pa'i phyir sems des tshor ba mi mthong ste /
translated: Since the mind and feeling that arise at the same time are co-arisen, that mind does not see the feeling.

original: nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not experienced.

original: phyi nas skyes pa'i sems kyis sngar tshor ba 'gags ma thag tu myong ba yin du zin kyang de ni dran pa yin gyis myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi nas skyes pa'i sems kyis sngar tshor ba 'gags ma thag tu myong ba yin du zin kyang de ni dran pa yin gyis myong ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if the mind that arises later does experience the feeling that has just ceased earlier, that is memory, not experience.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhan cig skyes pa yang mthong ba'am reg pa med kyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhan cig skyes pa yang mthong ba'am reg pa med kyi /
translated: Also, the simultaneous arising of form and so on is not seen or touched.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i rgyu nyid tsam du gnas kyi skad cig ma 'gags pa na byi ba'i dug bzhin du dran par byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i rgyu nyid tsam du gnas kyi skad cig ma 'gags pa na byi ba'i dug bzhin du dran par byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: It is merely the cause of being apprehended, and when the moment has ceased, it is remembered, like the poison of a rat.

original: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa ni re zhig sems las tha dad par snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa ni re zhig sems las tha dad par snang ba yin la /
translated: However, form and so on appear as different from the mind,

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pas de skad du smras pa yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pas de skad du smras pa yin no //
translated: but feeling and so on do not, so that is said.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gis bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gis bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: For that very reason, it is said, “I do not experience myself, etc.”

original: rang gis bdag nyid la myong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: rang gis bdag nyid la myong bar mi byed de /
translated: One does not experience oneself by oneself.

original: de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is contradictory.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sems gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sems gzhan gyis so //
translated: “By another” means by another mind.

original: tshor ba po ni bdag dang gang zag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba po ni bdag dang gang zag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The experiencer is the self, the person, and so on.

original: bdag med pa'i tshogs 'di la zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis rang bzhin med pa'i tshogs 'di @81a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i tshogs 'di la zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis rang bzhin med pa'i tshogs 'di @81a * //
translated: In this assembly of selflessness means in this assembly of essencelessness, in the manner explained above.

original: la'o ; /'di la su yis gnod ces bya ba ni gnod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa po rang bzhin med pas tshor ba 'dis su la gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: la'o ; /'di la su yis gnod ces bya ba ni gnod pa dang / gnod pa byed pa po rang bzhin med pas tshor ba 'dis su la gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Who is harmed here? Since the harm and the one who is harmed are essenceless, by whom is this feeling harmed?

original: gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By no one.

original: de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the application of mindfulness to feeling,

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad pa'i phyir sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad pa'i phyir sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to explain the application of mindfulness to mind, he says, The mind does not dwell in the eyes, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la lhag par dbang byed cing rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pas na dbang po ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la lhag par dbang byed cing rang gi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pas na dbang po ste /
translated: The faculties are so called because they have control over such things as form, and because they generate their own consciousnesses.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po ste /
translated: They are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculties.

original: de rnams la yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de rnams la yang mi gnas so //
translated: The mind does not dwell in them.

original: 'dir 'di ni rtag cing brtan pa dang / gnod par byar rung bas gzugs te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di ni rtag cing brtan pa dang / gnod par byar rung bas gzugs te /
translated: Here, form is permanent, stable, and susceptible to contact.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'o //
translated: blue, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase “etc.” includes sound, odor, taste, tangible, and the phenomena element.

original: der yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: der yang mi gnas so //
translated: It does not exist in between.

original: bar na'ang min zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don gnyis kyi bar na yang med pa'o //
analyzed: bar na'ang min zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang don gnyis kyi bar na yang med pa'o //
translated: “ In between” means that it does not exist in between the sense faculty and the object.

original: de yang gang gi phyir nang zhes bya ba lus kyi nang na yang med la /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir nang zhes bya ba lus kyi nang na yang med la /
translated: “ It does not exist in the body” means that it does not exist in the body, which is called “internal.”

original: lus las phyi rol na'ang med pa'o //
analyzed: lus las phyi rol na'ang med pa'o //
translated: “ It does not exist externally” means that it does not exist outside the body.

original: gzhan na'ang med ces bya ba ni lus kyi nang dang phyi rol ma yin pa gzhan dag na yang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan na'ang med ces bya ba ni lus kyi nang dang phyi rol ma yin pa gzhan dag na yang yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: “ It does not exist elsewhere” means that it does not exist elsewhere, apart from the body, internally or externally.🔽If it is suitable that it does not exist in other objects and faculties, how is it suitable to say that it does not exist in the faculty itself?

original: yul dang dbang po gzhan la mi gnas pa ni rung na yid kyi dbang po ni sems nyid yin na dbang po la mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs par smrar ci ltar rung /
analyzed: yul dang dbang po gzhan la mi gnas pa ni rung na yid kyi dbang po ni sems nyid yin na dbang po la mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs par smrar ci ltar rung /
translated: If the mental faculty is the mind itself, how is it suitable to say that it does not exist in the faculty itself?

original: yid dang sems gnyis blo'i rang bzhin can yin pas yid kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yid dang sems gnyis blo'i rang bzhin can yin pas yid kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the mental faculty and the mind are both of the nature of cognition, it follows that the mental faculty is also a foundation of mindfulness.

original: de'i phyir de'i khyad par yang ji skad du smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i khyad par yang ji skad du smras pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, its distinction is also as stated.

original: de nyid kyis na lus gang la gang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na lus gang la gang med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, it is said, “Whatever is absent in a body, etc.”

original: 'dres min zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngo //
analyzed: 'dres min zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngo //
translated: “Not mixed” means not mixed with the body.

original: tha dad pa ma yin nas bya ba ni lus las logs shig na gzhi med par gnas pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin nas bya ba ni lus las logs shig na gzhi med par gnas pa yang ma yin no //
translated: “Not separate” means it does not exist without a basis, apart from the body.

original: sems ni gzugs med pa'i phyir la lar sems 'dres te yang gnas la /
analyzed: sems ni gzugs med pa'i phyir la lar sems 'dres te yang gnas la /
translated: Since mind is formless, it is mixed and also exists somewhere.

original: lus las tha dad pa yang yin no zhe na de'i phyir zhes bya ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lus las tha dad pa yang yin no zhe na de'i phyir zhes bya ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But if it is separate from the body, then it is said, “Where is it?”

original: ga la yod ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i shes bya rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir cha shas med de /
analyzed: ga la yod ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i shes bya rnams skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir cha shas med de /
translated: Since objects of knowledge such as form are momentary, they are partless.

original: cig car 'jig cing med pa'i phyir dang / cha shas dang bcas na yang dngos po med pa'i phyir sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma med pa @81b yin no ;
analyzed: cig car 'jig cing med pa'i phyir dang / cha shas dang bcas na yang dngos po med pa'i phyir sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma med pa @81b yin no ;
translated: Since they disintegrate and do not exist simultaneously, and since they do not exist if they have parts, the previous moment of mind does not exist.

original: / shes pa dang shes bya lhan cig srang gi mda' ltar yod du zin kyang gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin pas yang dag par de gnyi ga yang med pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: / shes pa dang shes bya lhan cig srang gi mda' ltar yod du zin kyang gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin pas yang dag par de gnyi ga yang med pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Although consciousness and the object of consciousness exist together like the two arms of a scale, since one is not the cause of the other, neither of them is really nonexistent.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ltar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “In that case . . .”

original: 'dis ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explains the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye ba yod par ni shes shing bsgrub tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye ba yod par ni shes shing bsgrub tu mi rung ngo //
translated: As explained above, one should know that the arising of all phenomena is not suitable to be established.

original: yang de'i kun rdzob tu blo rang bzhin yod par bshad pa de yang nges par brtags na rang rig pa ma grub pas de yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang de'i kun rdzob tu blo rang bzhin yod par bshad pa de yang nges par brtags na rang rig pa ma grub pas de yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, the existence of the mind that is explained in terms of the relative is also not established when it is analyzed. Since reflexive awareness is not established, it also does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bden pa gnyi ga yang dag par yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa gnyi ga yang dag par yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, neither of the two truths really exists.

original: / yang na kun rdzob rgyu gzhan gyis sam phyi ma'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: / yang na kun rdzob rgyu gzhan gyis sam phyi ma'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu 'gyur na /
translated: Alternatively, if the relative were to become the relative due to other causes or due to other conditions,

original: logs su grub pa'i phyir sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: logs su grub pa'i phyir sems can rnams mya ngan las 'das par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Sentient beings would not attain nirvana because of being established as something else.

original: kun rdzob gzhan par brtags pas mya ngan las ga la 'da'/
analyzed: kun rdzob gzhan par brtags pas mya ngan las ga la 'da'/
translated: How could they attain nirvana by imagining a different concealer?

original: glegs bam la la las ni /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni /
translated: Some scriptures say:

original: de bas mya ngan 'das pa med //
analyzed: de bas mya ngan 'das pa med //
translated: Therefore, there is no nirvana.

original: ces zer ro //
analyzed: ces zer ro //
translated: Some say this.

original: de yang 'on te kun rdzob gzhan yin par 'grub na /
analyzed: de yang 'on te kun rdzob gzhan yin par 'grub na /
translated: If that is also established as another concealer,

original: gzhan du byas pa yin pas sems can mya ngan las 'das pa yin par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes pa yang don de nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du byas pa yin pas sems can mya ngan las 'das pa yin par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes pa yang don de nyid yin no //
translated: since it is made different, sentient beings would not attain nirvana. The meaning is the same.

original: de ltar gzhan gyis brgal ba'i lan bshad pa'i phyir 'di ni zhe bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyis brgal ba'i lan bshad pa'i phyir 'di ni zhe bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to explain the response to that objection, he says this, etc.

original: gzhan sems kyi rnam rtog ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'am gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan sems kyi rnam rtog ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'am gzhan pa ste /
translated: The so-called conception of another mind is another, or different.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du 'am phyi ma'i tshul du sems yod par rtog pa'i kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du 'am phyi ma'i tshul du sems yod par rtog pa'i kun rdzob bo //
translated: It is the concealer that conceives of the existence of mind in another continuum, or in the future mode.

original: sems smos pa ni brda sprod pa rnams kyi rtog pa pa las dgar ba'o //
analyzed: sems smos pa ni brda sprod pa rnams kyi rtog pa pa las dgar ba'o //
translated: The mention of mind is to exclude the conception of grammarians.

original: de yang phyogs gzhan gyi sems su brtags pa de ni 'dir gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de yang phyogs gzhan gyi sems su brtags pa de ni 'dir gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the investigation of the mind of another should not be taken here as the object.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di la ni sgrub pa snying por bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di la ni sgrub pa snying por bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in this chapter, the essence is the establishment of the mind as not existing.

original: rnam par rtog pa smos pa ni sems de yang rdzun pa tsam du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa smos pa ni sems de yang rdzun pa tsam du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of conceptualization is in order to show that the mind is also merely false.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: That is why he says, “by oneself, etc.”

original: de ltar gzhan su zhig yin zhe na ;
analyzed: de ltar gzhan su zhig yin zhe na ;
translated: Thus, who is the other?

original: de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “that, etc.”
