original: gang rang gi kun rdzob tu med pa de ni de'i 'og tu rnam par dpyod pa nyid kyis med pa kho nar nges pa yin la /
analyzed: gang rang gi kun rdzob tu med pa de ni de'i 'og tu rnam par dpyod pa nyid kyis med pa kho nar nges pa yin la /
translated: That which does not exist conventionally for oneself is ascertained as not existing at all by subsequent investigation.

original: sngar rnam par ma bshig pa'i ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i rnam par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar rnam par ma bshig pa'i ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i rnam par yod pa yin no //
translated: It exists in a form that is not analyzed and that delights the mind, but not previously.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang / de nyid tshol ba @82a * //🔽thog mar ni //
analyzed: de yang / de nyid tshol ba @82a * // thog mar ni //
translated: the seeker of reality

original: thams cad yod ces brjod par bya //
analyzed: thams cad yod ces brjod par bya //
translated: should first say that everything exists.

original: don rnams rtogs shing chags med nas //
analyzed: don rnams rtogs shing chags med nas //
translated: When he understands the meaning and is free from attachment,🔽then he should say that everything is nonexistent.

original: de yi 'og tu dben pa'o //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu dben pa'o //
translated: and after that, emptiness.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it has been said.

original: ma brtags pa'i gong du de yod na phyis brtags pas kyang rnam par bsal bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i gong du de yod na phyis brtags pas kyang rnam par bsal bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If it exists prior to examination, it cannot be refuted by subsequent examination.

original: gzhan dag nas kyang /🔽'di la bsal bya ci yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer na /🔽de'i phyir de med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag nas kyang / 'di la bsal bya ci yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o zhes zer na / de'i phyir de med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And in other scriptures it is said:🔽“There is nothing to be removed from this, and nothing to be added.”🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i tshe rang ngam gzhan pa'i kun rdzob med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang ngam gzhan pa'i kun rdzob med pa nyid yin no //
translated: “If it does not exist, then the conventional would not exist.”

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa yin du zin kyang rtog pas rgyu dang 'bras bur brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa yin du zin kyang rtog pas rgyu dang 'bras bur brtags pa yin no //
translated: Even though it is non-conceptual, it is imagined by conceptual thought as cause and effect.

original: de ltar na rtog pas brtags pas gnyis po 'di dag ni phan tshun gcig la gcig brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pas brtags pas gnyis po 'di dag ni phan tshun gcig la gcig brten pa yin te /
translated: Thus, since it is imagined by conceptual thought, these two are mutually dependent.

original: brtag par bya ba med par ni rtog pa med la /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba med par ni rtog pa med la /
translated: Without the imagined, there is no imagination.

original: de med par ni brtag par bya ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med par ni brtag par bya ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without that, the imagined does not exist.

original: de ltar ci ltar rnam par dpyad ce na /
analyzed: de ltar ci ltar rnam par dpyad ce na /
translated: How is this to be analyzed?

original: ji ltar grags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang chos can gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar grags pa gang yin pa de la brten nas /
analyzed: rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos dang chos can gzugs la sogs pa ji ltar grags pa gang yin pa de la brten nas /
translated: The phenomena and subjects, such as form, that are renowned to both parties in a debate are renowned in the world.

original: dbu ma pa de ni yod pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pas sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dbu ma pa de ni yod pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pas sgyu ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: Based on those, the Followers of the Middle Way will say, “Things exist conventionally, but because they are not real, they are like illusions.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa grags par rnam par dpyad pa thams cad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa grags par rnam par dpyad pa thams cad brjod pa yin no //
translated: They will say all this and more, using whatever is renowned in the world.

original: dpyod par byed par yang rnam par bya ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dpyod par byed par yang rnam par bya ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t it the case that the Followers of the Middle Way do engage in analysis?

original: de'i phyir gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: rnam par dpyod pa ni kho bo cag gis dgos pa'i don du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa ni kho bo cag gis dgos pa'i don du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: We Followers of the Middle Way accept analysis for a specific purpose.

original: dpyad par bya ba de kho na nyid la sogs pa la rnam par dpyod cing brtag pa na brtag pa'i gnas med la /
analyzed: dpyad par bya ba de kho na nyid la sogs pa la rnam par dpyod cing brtag pa na brtag pa'i gnas med la /
translated: When we analyze and investigate the precise nature of reality and so on, we find no basis for analysis.

original: gnas med pa nyid kyis na de mi skye zhing 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas med pa nyid kyis na de mi skye zhing 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is no basis for analysis, analysis does not arise or occur.

original: rnam par dpyod pa yang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa yang rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the analysis itself is essentially non-arisen.

original: ma skyes pa de ni mya ngan las 'das par bshad do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa de ni mya ngan las 'das par bshad do //
translated: And that non-arisen is explained as nirvana.

original: yang rtog pa po dang brtag par bya ba gnyis po 'di dag de kho na nyid dam bden par yod pa'am med par smra ba de nyid ni shin tu 'gal ba dang bcas pa yin pas sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: yang rtog pa po dang brtag par bya ba gnyis po 'di dag de kho na nyid dam bden par yod pa'am med par smra ba de nyid ni shin tu 'gal ba dang bcas pa yin pas sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the one who conceives and the object of conception, if they are said to exist or not exist in reality or in truth, then that itself is extremely contradictory and therefore painful.

original: ci ltar dka' bas gnas she na /
analyzed: ci ltar dka' bas gnas she na /
translated: How is it that one abides in difficulty?

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @82b te ;
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @82b te ;
translated: He says, “If, etc.”

original: rtog par byed pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa ni shes pa'o //
translated: Conception is consciousness.

original: brtag par bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ni don to //
translated: The object of conception is the object.

original: de ltar na shes pa dang shes bya med na shes pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa dang shes bya med na shes pa yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if consciousness and the object of consciousness do not exist, how could consciousness exist?

original: 'dis ni rtog dang brtag par bya ba dag / gnyis po phan tshun brten pa yin zhes gang bshad pa gsal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog dang brtag par bya ba dag / gnyis po phan tshun brten pa yin zhes gang bshad pa gsal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This clarifies what was said above, “Conception and the object of conception are mutually dependent.”

original: phan tshun gcig la gcig brten du zin kyang shes pa dang yul dag pha dang bu'i tshul du yod ce na /
analyzed: phan tshun gcig la gcig brten du zin kyang shes pa dang yul dag pha dang bu'i tshul du yod ce na /
translated: But even if they are mutually dependent, consciousness and objects exist like father and son.

original: de'i phyir pha ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, Nāgārjuna says, “The father . . . ” and so on.

original: 'di ltar pha dang bu gnyis phan tshun ltos pa yin pa nyid kyis yang dag par na med cing ma grub pa yin pa de bzhin du shes pa dang don gnyis kyang bskyed pa po dang / skyed par byed pa gnyis kyi tshul du phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin pas des na /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha dang bu gnyis phan tshun ltos pa yin pa nyid kyis yang dag par na med cing ma grub pa yin pa de bzhin du shes pa dang don gnyis kyang bskyed pa po dang / skyed par byed pa gnyis kyi tshul du phan tshun ltos pa nyid yin pas des na /
translated: Just as a father and son exist in mutual dependence, and thus do not exist in reality, in the same way, consciousness and objects also exist in mutual dependence, in the manner of the producer and the produced.

original: de gnyis med pa yang de bzhin du blta'o //🔽myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan dag gi tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis med pa yang de bzhin du blta'o // myu gu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan dag gi tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the nonexistence of those two should be understood in the same way.🔽“From a sprout . . . ” and so on are the words of others.

original: myu gu las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te /
analyzed: myu gu las gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan te /
translated: “From a sprout . . . ” and so on is the response.

original: myu gu las gzhan pa'i shes pas myu gu shes nas sa bon yod do zhes rtog par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: myu gu las gzhan pa'i shes pas myu gu shes nas sa bon yod do zhes rtog par byed pa yin na /
translated: If a consciousness that is different from a sprout cognizes a sprout and infers that a seed exists,

original: shes bya la shes byar shes pa nyid kyang ga la yod de /
analyzed: shes bya la shes byar shes pa nyid kyang ga la yod de /
translated: how could there be a consciousness that cognizes an object of knowledge as an object of knowledge?

original: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir shes pa de med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang rig pa med pa'i phyir shes pa de med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the non-existence of reflexive awareness, that cognition does not exist. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar shes pa las sa bon yod do zhes kyang ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa las sa bon yod do zhes kyang ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: In that case, how is it understood that the seed exists from cognition?

original: de'i phyir re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says “first of all,” etc.

original: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word “first of all” refers to inference, etc.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa ji ltar snang ba'i nus pa las dgag pa med pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa ji ltar snang ba'i nus pa las dgag pa med pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: “Everything” refers to the collection of causes and conditions. The meaning is that there is no negation from the power of the appearance of the collection of causes and conditions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir padma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For that very reason, he says “lotus,” etc.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / rgyu med par smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / rgyu med par smra ba dag na re /
translated: When this was said, the nihilists said,

original: padma'i sdong bu la sogs pa de ni su zhig gis byas pa zhes smra ba la /
analyzed: padma'i sdong bu la sogs pa de ni su zhig gis byas pa zhes smra ba la /
translated: “Who made that lotus stalk, etc.?”

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says “the division of causes,” etc.

original: snga ma'i rgyu'i dbye ba nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni las mas skyes pa'i 'jig rten sna tshogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: snga ma'i rgyu'i dbye ba nyid kyis so zhes bya ba ni las mas skyes pa'i 'jig rten sna tshogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: The diversity of the world is due to the diversity of causes, not due to God.

original: rgyu med pa nyid ni yul dang dus la sogs pa'i dbye ba med pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid ni yul dang dus la sogs pa'i dbye ba med pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical to say that the world arises without a cause, because there would be no distinction of place, time, and so on.

original: rgyu'i dbye ba las 'bras bu'i dbye ba 'byung ba yin du chug na /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye ba las 'bras bu'i dbye ba 'byung ba yin du chug na /
translated: Even if it were possible for the diversity of effects to arise from the diversity of causes,

original: rgyus 'bras bu bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur zhes rtog na /🔽thams cad rgyu'i mthu las @83a * //
analyzed: rgyus 'bras bu bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur zhes rtog na / thams cad rgyu'i mthu las @83a * //
translated: how could a cause generate an effect?

original: 'byung // zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung // zhes bya ste /
translated: Everything arises from the power of causes.

original: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las 'bras bu skye ba'i nus pa'i mthu gang la yod pa de las 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las 'bras bu skye ba'i nus pa'i mthu gang la yod pa de las 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The effect arises from that which has the power to generate the effect, which is the power of the continuum of causes.

original: 'dir dbang phyug rgyur smra ba dag na re rgyu de yod du chug na de ni dbang phyug gi blo sngon du btang ba de nyid kyis lus can dang gnas la sogs pa thams cad byas pa yin no zhes rtog pas /
analyzed: 'dir dbang phyug rgyur smra ba dag na re rgyu de yod du chug na de ni dbang phyug gi blo sngon du btang ba de nyid kyis lus can dang gnas la sogs pa thams cad byas pa yin no zhes rtog pas /
translated: Here, those who advocate God as the cause say, “Even if that cause exists, it is God’s mind that creates all embodied beings, abodes, and so on.”

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽re zhig dbang phyug gang yin smros //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // re zhig dbang phyug gang yin smros //
translated: The cause of migrating beings is not a permanent creator.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The question is, what is Īśvara?

original: de ltar dbang phyug 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug 'gro ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba yin na /
translated: If Īśvara is the cause of migrating beings,

original: dbang phyug nyid gang yin smros shig ces dri ba'o ;
analyzed: dbang phyug nyid gang yin smros shig ces dri ba'o ;
translated: then tell us what Īśvara is.

original: / gal te de dag na re 'byung ba rnams yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: / gal te de dag na re 'byung ba rnams yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If they say, “The elements are Īśvara,”

original: de ltar yin par ni zad de /
analyzed: de ltar yin par ni zad de /
translated: then that is all we need to say.

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag kyang de rnams la snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bu'i tshul gyis 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pas de yin du ni chug na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag kyang de rnams la snga ma snga ma las phyi ma phyi ma 'bras bu'i tshul gyis 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid du 'dod pas de yin du ni chug na /
translated: Because we also assert that the elements are the cause of migrating beings in the sense that later effects arise from earlier causes.

original: de rnams la khyed kyis dbang phyug ces ming btags pa tsam du zad na /
analyzed: de rnams la khyed kyis dbang phyug ces ming btags pa tsam du zad na /
translated: But if that is so, then you have merely given the elements the name Īśvara.

original: ming tsam las med du zin na ngal bas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: ming tsam las med du zin na ngal bas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If that is all there is, then what is the point of all this hard work?

original: ci'i phyir khyod de tsam dub cing nyon mongs par byed /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod de tsam dub cing nyon mongs par byed /
translated: Why do you tire yourself out and suffer so?

original: 'on kyang sa la sogs pa 'di dag ni du ma yin pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dag gis mi rtag pa yin pa dang / sems med pa yin pa'i phyir lha ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa la sogs pa 'di dag ni du ma yin pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa dag gis mi rtag pa yin pa dang / sems med pa yin pa'i phyir lha ma yin te /
translated: But earth and so on are not God because they are many, impermanent due to origination and destruction, and devoid of mind,

original: ling ga la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //🔽de bzhin du 'gom par bya ba gang yin pa dang / mi gtsang ba nyid kyang yin zhing /
analyzed: ling ga la sogs pa dang 'dra'o // de bzhin du 'gom par bya ba gang yin pa dang / mi gtsang ba nyid kyang yin zhing /
translated: like a pile of grain and so on.🔽Likewise, they are not God because they are trampled, impure,

original: mi gtsang ba dang 'dres pas sa la sogs pa de dag dbang phyug ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang 'dres pas sa la sogs pa de dag dbang phyug ma yin te /
translated: and mixed with impurities, like earth and so on.

original: khyod ni 'di ltar gcig pa nyid dang rtag pa dang / blo gros bzang po dang ldan pa dang / lha nyid yin pa des na /
analyzed: khyod ni 'di ltar gcig pa nyid dang rtag pa dang / blo gros bzang po dang ldan pa dang / lha nyid yin pa des na /
translated: You are not God because you are one, permanent, intelligent, and divine,

original: ling sa la sogs pa de yang 'gom par bya ba ma yin par gtsang ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ling sa la sogs pa de yang 'gom par bya ba ma yin par gtsang ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because you assert that a pile of grain and so on is not to be trampled, is pure, and so on.

original: gal te khyod dbang phyug nam mkha' yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te khyod dbang phyug nam mkha' yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that God is space,

original: de yang bya ba dang 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang bral bas dbang phyug ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bya ba dang 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang bral bas dbang phyug ma yin no //
translated: he is not God because he is devoid of activity and the enjoyment of desire.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba mchod pa byed pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag nyid kyang dbang phyug de ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba mchod pa byed pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bdag nyid kyang dbang phyug de ma yin te /
translated: The self that is the nature of the sun, moon, and so on is not God,

original: de ni sngar //🔽so dang skra sen bdag ma yin /
analyzed: de ni sngar // so dang skra sen bdag ma yin /
translated: because that has been refuted earlier,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bkag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: such as in the line, “Teeth, hair, and nails are not the self.”

original: gal te dbang phyug de bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug de bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that God is inconceivable,

original: de byed @83b pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas ci zhig brjod du yod de /
analyzed: de byed @83b pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pas ci zhig brjod du yod de /
translated: then since his activity is also inconceivable, what can be said?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de brjod pa'i yul ji ltar yin /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de brjod pa'i yul ji ltar yin /
translated: How can that which is inconceivable be the object of expression?

original: gal te de ltar yin na des na dngos po ci zhig 'byin cing skyed par 'dod //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na des na dngos po ci zhig 'byin cing skyed par 'dod //
translated: If that is so, then what thing does he produce and create?

original: gal te bdag ces bya ba 'byin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te bdag ces bya ba 'byin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the so-called self is produced,

original: de ni rtag cing brtan par khyed smra bas dbang phyug dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtag cing brtan par khyed smra bas dbang phyug dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: since you say that it is permanent and stable, it is not like God.

original: sa la sogs pa gang 'byin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa gang 'byin pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not produce earth and so on,

original: dbang phyug nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug nyid de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because God is the nature of those.

original: shes pa yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yang 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not an element,

original: de ni shes pa las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes pa las 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / thog ma med pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not arise from the elements, and because it is beginningless.

original: shes bya yang rang gi rgyu thog ma med pa can rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de las 'byung bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: shes bya yang rang gi rgyu thog ma med pa can rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de las 'byung bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Nor is the object of consciousness, because its cause is beginningless and is its intrinsic nature.

original: gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal sprul to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba dang sdug bsngal sprul to zhe na /
translated: If you say that pleasure and pain are emanated,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / las de yang thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las rnams las bde ba dang sdug bsngal skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / las de yang thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: that is not correct, because pleasure and pain arise from virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, and that karma is beginningless.

original: de lta yin na dbang phyug des dngos po ci zhig sprul zhing 'byin par byed pa yin pa smros shing //
analyzed: de lta yin na dbang phyug des dngos po ci zhig sprul zhing 'byin par byed pa yin pa smros shing //
translated: If that is so, then tell us what entity is emanated and created by that Almighty.

original: yang gzhan dag na re shes pa la sogs pa thog ma med pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re shes pa la sogs pa thog ma med pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Others say that consciousness and so on are not beginningless,

original: dbang phyug thog ma med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug thog ma med pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: but Almighty is beginningless.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Therefore, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: khyed gal te rgyu dbang phyug thog ma yod pa ma yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: khyed gal te rgyu dbang phyug thog ma yod pa ma yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the cause, God, is beginningless,

original: 'bras bu yang thog ma med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang thog ma med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the effect would also be beginningless.

original: de ltar yin du zin kyang rtag tu mi byed de /
analyzed: de ltar yin du zin kyang rtag tu mi byed de /
translated: Even if that were the case, he would not always create.

original: de ltos nas yang byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltos nas yang byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: He would create in reliance on something else.

original: de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'byin pa ni de dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa yin na rtag par dus thams cad du ci'i phyir mi byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'byin pa ni de dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa yin na rtag par dus thams cad du ci'i phyir mi byed /
translated: Therefore Nāgārjuna states:🔽If creation does not rely on other things, why would he not always create?🔽If he does not create in reliance on something else, why would he not always create?🔽If he does not create in reliance on something else, why would he not always create?

original: de ma byas pa'i dngos po zhig la ltos nas rtag tu mi byed do zhe na /🔽de'i phyir de ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros te /🔽gal te ma byas pa'i dngos po zhig yod na ni de la ltos su rung na /
analyzed: de ma byas pa'i dngos po zhig la ltos nas rtag tu mi byed do zhe na / de'i phyir de ma byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros te / gal te ma byas pa'i dngos po zhig yod na ni de la ltos su rung na /
translated: If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.🔽If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.

original: thams cad 'dis byas par khyed 'dod pa dang / ltos pa yod par 'dod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: thams cad 'dis byas par khyed 'dod pa dang / ltos pa yod par 'dod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: If he creates in reliance on something else, then creation would not be God.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig la ltos par 'dod na ni de'i tshe tshogs pa nyid rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig la ltos par 'dod na ni de'i tshe tshogs pa nyid rgyu yin gyi /
translated: If you maintain that he depends on something else, then the collection of causes is the cause,

original: dbang phyug ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug ma yin no //
translated: not God.

original: de yang gal te tshogs pa yod na ni dbang phyug de mi byed cing bya ba bshol bar yang mi nus la de med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gal te tshogs pa yod na ni dbang phyug de mi byed cing bya ba bshol bar yang mi nus la de med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, if the collection exists, then God does not act, and he cannot be said to delay his action.

original: @84a * // tshogs pa de med na ni dbang phyug gis byed pa med de /
analyzed: @84a * // tshogs pa de med na ni dbang phyug gis byed pa med de /
translated: If the collection does not exist, then God does not act,

original: tshogs pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: because he arises from the collection.

original: gal te tshogs pa yod par gyur nas dbang phyug mi 'dod bzhin du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshogs pa yod par gyur nas dbang phyug mi 'dod bzhin du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the collection exists, then God acts even though he does not desire to act.

original: de lta na ni dbang phyug de gzhan gyi dbang du thal bar 'gyur bas khyod kyi rang dbang du yod par 'dod pa dang mi mthun no //
analyzed: de lta na ni dbang phyug de gzhan gyi dbang du thal bar 'gyur bas khyod kyi rang dbang du yod par 'dod pa dang mi mthun no //
translated: In that case, it follows that God is dependent on something else, and this contradicts your belief that he is independent.

original: 'on te 'dod pa la rag las par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa la rag las par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that he acts in dependence on his desire,

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the verse states,

original: 'dod pa yang 'dod pa nyid la rag las par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang 'dod pa nyid la rag las par 'gyur /
translated: Desire also depends on desire.

original: dbang phyug de byed pa po yin par rnam pa thams cad du ga la yod de med do //
analyzed: dbang phyug de byed pa po yin par rnam pa thams cad du ga la yod de med do //
translated: How could that Īśvara be the creator in any way? He is not!

original: des na rang dgar dbang byed pa ga la yin /
analyzed: des na rang dgar dbang byed pa ga la yin /
translated: So how could he be the one who freely controls anything?

original: gang yang gzegs zan la sogs pa rdul phra rab rtag par smra ba dag gis 'du ba dang cha shas su dbye ba dag gi 'bras bu skyed par 'dod pa de yang /
analyzed: gang yang gzegs zan la sogs pa rdul phra rab rtag par smra ba dag gis 'du ba dang cha shas su dbye ba dag gi 'bras bu skyed par 'dod pa de yang /
translated: Also, the followers of Kaṇāda, who propound that subtle particles are permanent, assert that the results of their aggregation and division are produced.

original: phyogs cha rnams kyang cha med pa zhes bya bas rnam par dpyad de bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs cha rnams kyang cha med pa zhes bya bas rnam par dpyad de bzlog pa yin no //
translated: That is also refuted by the analysis of the directions and parts as partless.

original: de ltar dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa la sogs pa bkag nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang phyug rgyur 'dod pa la sogs pa bkag nas /
translated: Having thus refuted the assertion that Īśvara is the cause,

original: 'di man chad grangs can dag gtso bo zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i phyir gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di man chad grangs can dag gtso bo zhes bya ba ni rgyu yin par 'dod pa'i phyir gtso bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: from here on, because the Sāṃkhyas assert that the so-called pradhāna is the cause, it is said, “Pradhāna, etc.”

original: mnyam du gnas zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa 'gyur ba med /
analyzed: mnyam du gnas zhes bya ba ni chen po la sogs pa 'gyur ba med /
translated: “Abiding equally” means that mahat and so on are unchanging.

original: de dag la ni gtso bo zhes bya la /
analyzed: de dag la ni gtso bo zhes bya la /
translated: They are called pradhāna.

original: 'gyur ba las mi mnyam par gyur pa de'i tshe ni 'gro ba zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ba las mi mnyam par gyur pa de'i tshe ni 'gro ba zhes zer ro //
translated: When they change and become unequal, at that time they are called the world.

original: de la dbu ma pas gtso bo zhes bya ba gcig pu la rang bzhin gsum yod pa ni mi rigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dbu ma pas gtso bo zhes bya ba gcig pu la rang bzhin gsum yod pa ni mi rigs pa yin la /
translated: The Madhyamikas say that it is illogical for a single entity called “primordial matter” to have three natures.

original: des na gtso bo zhes bya ba de med do //
analyzed: des na gtso bo zhes bya ba de med do //
translated: Therefore, so-called primordial matter does not exist.

original: de bzhin du yon tan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yon tan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the so-called qualities do not exist.

original: yon tan gsum po de dag re re zhing yang snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gsum po de dag re re zhing yang snying stobs dang / rdul dang mun pa gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Each of the three qualities is endowed with the three—sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: gsum po de dag kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid can yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: gsum po de dag kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / gti mug gi bdag nyid can yin par 'dod la /
translated: These three are asserted to have the nature of pleasure, pain, and delusion, respectively.

original: de dag ni phan tshun 'gal te /
analyzed: de dag ni phan tshun 'gal te /
translated: They are mutually contradictory.

original: bde ba myong ba'i skabs su yang sdug bsngal mi myong ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: bde ba myong ba'i skabs su yang sdug bsngal mi myong ba'i phyir ;
translated: When pleasure is experienced, pain is not experienced.

original: yon tan ma grub cing med pa yin pas de de las byung ba'i sgra la sogs pa'i gzhan dag yod pa nyid ni shin tu yang thag ring ba yin te /
analyzed: yon tan ma grub cing med pa yin pas de de las byung ba'i sgra la sogs pa'i gzhan dag yod pa nyid ni shin tu yang thag ring ba yin te /
translated: Since the qualities are not established and do not exist, it is very farfetched that the other things that arise from them—sound and so on—exist.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are not tenable by any other valid means of knowledge.

original: de ltar na yang grangs can dag gos la sogs las byung ba'i bde ba yang de'i 'gyur ba yin par @84b 'dod pa de thams cad 'dod pa yang ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang grangs can dag gos la sogs las byung ba'i bde ba yang de'i 'gyur ba yin par @84b 'dod pa de thams cad 'dod pa yang ma yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: But the Sāṃkhyas assert that pleasure that arises from cloth and so on is a transformation of that, and that is not asserted by all.

original: de'i phyir sems med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “It is illogical that pleasure and so on are the nature of cloth and so forth.”

original: sems med pa dang sems yod pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba yin pas de ni mi srid do //
analyzed: sems med pa dang sems yod pa dag phan tshun 'gal ba yin pas de ni mi srid do //
translated: Because the absence of mind and the presence of mind are mutually exclusive, that is impossible.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa rgyu'i rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid yin pa gos la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i rang bzhin du gyur pas rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa rgyu'i rang bzhin nam ngo bo nyid yin pa gos la sogs pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de ni rgyu'i rang bzhin du gyur pas rgyu yin la /
translated: But if pleasure and so on are the nature or essence of the cause, then that entity of cloth and so on is the cause because it is the nature of the cause.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni gos la sogs pa yin pas de la bde ba la sogs pa yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni gos la sogs pa yin pas de la bde ba la sogs pa yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Since its effect is cloth and so on, pleasure and so on exist in that.

original: gzhan du na de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du na de las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, it would not arise from that.

original: dngos po rnams dpyad ma zin nam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams dpyad ma zin nam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “Have you not analyzed entities?”

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis de ma grub par dpyad zin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis de ma grub par dpyad zin te zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The close placements of mindfulness have already analyzed that it is not established.

original: grangs can khyod kyis dngos po rnams kyi rgyu bde ba la sogs pa nyid yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: grangs can khyod kyis dngos po rnams kyi rgyu bde ba la sogs pa nyid yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you Sāṃkhyas assert that pleasure and so on are the cause of things,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de las kyang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang skye bar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba de las kyang snam bu la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang skye bar ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see that things such as cloth arise from the experience of pleasure and so on.

original: gzhan du na gos la sogs pa las bde ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: gzhan du na gos la sogs pa las bde ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Otherwise, pleasure and so on would arise from cloth and so on.

original: yang dag par na gos la sogs pa de med cing ma grub pas na bde ba la sogs pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na gos la sogs pa de med cing ma grub pas na bde ba la sogs pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: But since cloth and so on do not exist and are not established in reality, pleasure and so on also do not exist.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa yin pas nges par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni rtag pa yin pas nges par yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that pleasure and so on definitely exist because they are permanent,

original: bde sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says “Pleasure and so on . . .”

original: bde ba la sogs pa rtag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rtag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Pleasure and so on are not permanent.

original: dus nam yang rnyed cing dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus nam yang rnyed cing dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are never found and observed.

original: gal te rtag par yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te rtag par yang yod mod kyi /
translated: If you say, “They definitely exist because they are permanent,”

original: gal te de gsal ba'i tshe na bde bar snang gi / nus pa'i tshul du mi gsal ba'i tshe na ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te de gsal ba'i tshe na bde bar snang gi / nus pa'i tshul du mi gsal ba'i tshe na ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that when it is clear, it appears as pleasure, but it is not clear in the manner of a potentiality when it is not clear,

original: de'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis bde ba la sogs pa nyid yod do zhes smra na /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis bde ba la sogs pa nyid yod do zhes smra na /
translated: If you say that pleasure and so on exist because they are known by reflexive awareness,

original: des bde ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
analyzed: des bde ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
translated: why don’t you apprehend pleasure and so on?

original: de ni phra ba nyid kyi phyir mi 'dzin no zhes zer na ;
analyzed: de ni phra ba nyid kyi phyir mi 'dzin no zhes zer na ;
translated: If you say that it does not apprehend them because they are subtle,

original: gal te rags pa yin na phra bar yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rags pa yin na phra bar yang ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: then if they are coarse, how could they be subtle?

original: rags pa dang phra ba gnyis ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba gnyis ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Coarse and subtle are mutually exclusive.

original: de ltar yin mod kyi bde ba des rags pa spangs nas phra bar gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar yin mod kyi bde ba des rags pa spangs nas phra bar gyur pa yin pas /
translated: You may say, “That is true, but pleasure becomes subtle after it has abandoned coarseness.

original: de phra ba dang rags pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa yin gyi gnas kyi gzhi @85a * //
analyzed: de phra ba dang rags pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa yin gyi gnas kyi gzhi @85a * //
translated: Therefore, it has different states of subtlety and coarseness.

original: bde ba la ni tha dad pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la ni tha dad pa med do zhe na /
translated: But the basis of pleasure is not different.”

original: de'i phyir rags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rags pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te gnas skabs mi rtag pa yin gyi de'i gzhi rtag pas tha dad do snyam na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs mi rtag pa yin gyi de'i gzhi rtag pas tha dad do snyam na /
translated: If you think that the state is impermanent, but its basis is permanent and different,

original: de'i phyir de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: yang dag par na bde ba las rags pa de gzhan ma yin pas /
analyzed: yang dag par na bde ba las rags pa de gzhan ma yin pas /
translated: Since pleasure is not different from that,

original: bde ba de mi rtag pa nyid yin par shin tu gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba de mi rtag pa nyid yin par shin tu gsal ba yin no //
translated: it is very clear that pleasure is impermanent.

original: yang gzhan dag na re bde ba rags pa'i zla la mi 'jigs te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re bde ba rags pa'i zla la mi 'jigs te /
translated: Moreover, others say that there is no fear of the moon of gross pleasure,

original: zhig cing mi rtag na ci yang med pa yin pas med pa las mi skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: zhig cing mi rtag na ci yang med pa yin pas med pa las mi skye'o zhe na /
translated: because if it is destroyed and impermanent, it is nothing at all, and it does not arise from nothing.🔽Therefore Nāgārjuna says, “If you say that it does not arise from nothing,”

original: de'i phyir med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: khyod 'dod pa de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khyod 'dod pa de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: That which you assert is not tenable.

original: yod par khas len pa rags par yod dgos la /
analyzed: yod par khas len pa rags par yod dgos la /
translated: If you accept that it exists, it must exist in a gross manner.

original: de ni gsal bar yin te /
analyzed: de ni gsal bar yin te /
translated: But that is clear.

original: de las skye bar 'gyur bas na khyed rags pa'i tshul du med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: de las skye bar 'gyur bas na khyed rags pa'i tshul du med do zhes zer te /
translated: Since it arises from that, you say that it does not exist in the manner of grossness.

original: gsal bar mi 'dod kyang med cing mi gsal ba las mi skye'i yod pa las skyes pa nyid kyis rags par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal bar mi 'dod kyang med cing mi gsal ba las mi skye'i yod pa las skyes pa nyid kyis rags par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you do not assert that the effect is clearly manifest in the cause, it does not arise from what is not clear and not manifest, but it does arise from what is, and it is just that which is the gross state.

original: gal te 'bras bu gsal bar rgyu la gnas na ni rgyu zas la sogs pa la 'bras bu mi gsal bar gnas pas de za ba ni mi gtsang ba za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu gsal bar rgyu la gnas na ni rgyu zas la sogs pa la 'bras bu mi gsal bar gnas pas de za ba ni mi gtsang ba za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect is clearly manifest in the cause, then the effect would be clearly manifest in the cause, such as food, and by eating it, one would be eating feces.

original: gzhan yang rgyu la 'bras bu gsal bar gnas na ni ras kyi rin gang yin pa des ras bal gyi sa bon nyos la gos su bgo bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu la 'bras bu gsal bar gnas na ni ras kyi rin gang yin pa des ras bal gyi sa bon nyos la gos su bgo bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, if the effect is clearly manifest in the cause, then with the price of the cloth, buy cotton seeds and wear them as clothing.

original: gal te ras bal gyi sa bon las ras yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te ras bal gyi sa bon las ras yod mod kyi /
translated: If the cloth exists in the cotton seeds,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams rmongs pas ma mthong bar zad do zhes zer na ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams rmongs pas ma mthong bar zad do zhes zer na ni /
translated: it is just that the worldly, due to delusion, do not see it.

original: de kho na nyid shes shing ma rmongs pa la yang rmongs pa de gnas shing yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid shes shing ma rmongs pa la yang rmongs pa de gnas shing yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If that delusion exists in those who know reality and are not deluded, it would not exist and would not be tenable.

original: gal te med na ras bal gyi sa bon gos su ci'i phyir mi gyon yang gal te de kho na nyid kyi shes pa gang yin pa de 'jig rten pa la yang yod do //
analyzed: gal te med na ras bal gyi sa bon gos su ci'i phyir mi gyon yang gal te de kho na nyid kyi shes pa gang yin pa de 'jig rten pa la yang yod do //
translated: If it does not exist, why does cotton seed not clothe the body?🔽If it is seen because cause and effect exist, then worldly people would see reality.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pas mthong ba nyid yin na ni 'jig rten pa yang de kho na nyid mthong ba yin na ci'i phyir de ma mthong /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pas mthong ba nyid yin na ni 'jig rten pa yang de kho na nyid mthong ba yin na ci'i phyir de ma mthong /
translated: But why do they not see it?

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bus 'jig rten pa ci'i phyir ma mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bus 'jig rten pa ci'i phyir ma mthong /
translated: In the same way, why do worldly people not see the cause and effect of pleasure, etc.?

original: 'jig rten pa rnams ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pas rgyu la 'bras bu ma mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams ni tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pas rgyu la 'bras bu ma mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: Worldly people are not endowed with valid cognition, so they do not see the effect in the cause.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gsal bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gsal bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Worldly people do not see reality, etc.”

original: de lta na ni sgra la sogs pa yod par don gyi tshad mas gsal bar @85b mthong ba dang / 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras rjes su dpag pa dang / lung la yod pa yang bden pa ma yin zhing med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra la sogs pa yod par don gyi tshad mas gsal bar @85b mthong ba dang / 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras rjes su dpag pa dang / lung la yod pa yang bden pa ma yin zhing med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the clear seeing of sound and so on by the valid knowledge of fact, and also the existence of sound and so on by inference and scripture, would not be true and would become nonexistent.

original: de kho na nyid du sgra la sogs pa brtags pa'i dngos po rnams las stong pa nyid yin na gsal bar mthong ba gang zhig yod /
analyzed: de kho na nyid du sgra la sogs pa brtags pa'i dngos po rnams las stong pa nyid yin na gsal bar mthong ba gang zhig yod /
translated: If things such as sound are empty of inherent nature, what clear seeing of them exists in reality?

original: de med na tshad ma yang tshad ma yin par 'gyur bar de'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de med na tshad ma yang tshad ma yin par 'gyur bar de'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If that does not exist, valid knowledge would not be valid knowledge. Therefore he says, “If valid knowledge and so on are false,” and so on.

original: stong pa nyid ni tshad ma gzhal ba yin gyi gzhan du na ji ltar shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni tshad ma gzhal ba yin gyi gzhan du na ji ltar shes par 'gyur /
translated: Emptiness is measured by valid knowledge, but if it is otherwise, how could it be known?

original: de yang tshad ma dag tshad ma ma yin zhing brdzun na ni des gzhal ba'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad brdzun par 'gyur ba de bas na dngos po rnams kyi stong pa nyid mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma dag tshad ma ma yin zhing brdzun na ni des gzhal ba'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa thams cad brdzun par 'gyur ba de bas na dngos po rnams kyi stong pa nyid mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if valid knowledge is not valid knowledge and is false, then everything measured by it, such as emptiness, would be false. Therefore the emptiness of things would not be tenable.

original: glegs bam la la las ni khyod kyis 'thad pa ma yin no zhes zer te /🔽grangs can khyod kyis stong pa nyid smra bar yang dag par 'thad cing rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni khyod kyis 'thad pa ma yin no zhes zer te / grangs can khyod kyis stong pa nyid smra bar yang dag par 'thad cing rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Some scriptures say, “It is not tenable for you.”

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni kun rdzob tu thams cad yod par 'dod pa rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni kun rdzob tu thams cad yod par 'dod pa rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is not tenable for you Enumerators to propound emptiness, because it is logical for the buddhas to assert that everything exists conventionally.

original: gang gi phyir brtags pa'i dngos po rnams kyis btsal zhing yongs su ma dpyad par de med pa nyid ces brtags pa'i dngos po med pa nyid 'dzin par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtags pa'i dngos po rnams kyis btsal zhing yongs su ma dpyad par de med pa nyid ces brtags pa'i dngos po med pa nyid 'dzin par mi nus kyi /
translated: Because when things that are imputed are not analyzed or investigated, you cannot apprehend their nonexistence, their lack of being.

original: de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du shes shing 'dzin pa de las dngos po rnams brdzun par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid du shes shing 'dzin pa de las dngos po rnams brdzun par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When you know and apprehend their nature, emptiness, you will know that things are false.

original: de bas na brtags pa'i dngos po rnams brdzun pa ma yin pas de'i dngos po med pa nyid ni shin tu gsal bar brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na brtags pa'i dngos po rnams brdzun pa ma yin pas de'i dngos po med pa nyid ni shin tu gsal bar brdzun pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, since things that are imputed are not false, their lack of being is clearly false.

original: med pa ni yod pa la ltos pa yin pas dngos po ma grub pas na de'i med pa yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa la ltos pa yin pas dngos po ma grub pas na de'i med pa yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: Since nonexistence is dependent on existence, since an entity is not established, its nonexistence is not established either.

original: grangs can la dpe bstan pa'i sgo nas nye bar bsdu ba smras pa ni /
analyzed: grangs can la dpe bstan pa'i sgo nas nye bar bsdu ba smras pa ni /
translated: The Enumerators are summarized by way of an example being stated:

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: dper na rmi lam gyi nang na bu skyes pa rmis la rmi lam na de shi ba rmi la de'i med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa tsam yin pa'i rtog pa des bu yod pa'i rtog pa skyes pa gang yin pa de rjes su zlog
analyzed: dper na rmi lam gyi nang na bu skyes pa rmis la rmi lam na de shi ba rmi la de'i med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa tsam yin pa'i rtog pa des bu yod pa'i rtog pa skyes pa gang yin pa de rjes su zlog
translated: For example, in a dream, one dreams that a son is born, and in the dream, one dreams that he dies.  The thought that “he does not exist” is a mere imputation.  That thought that a son exists is what is to be reversed.

original: par byed cing 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: par byed cing 'gog par byed do //
translated: That conception is to be stopped.

original: de bzhin du gal te dngos por brtags pa yod na de med do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te dngos por brtags pa yod na de med do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, if an entity is imputed to exist, the thought that “it does not exist” occurs.

original: de nyid kyang brdzun pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyang brdzun pa yin no //
translated: That is also false.

original: de ltar rgyu med par smra ba dang mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu med par smra ba dang mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: Thus, having refuted the proponents of causelessness and the proponents of causes,

original: gzhung nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la @86a * //
analyzed: gzhung nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la @86a * //
translated: In order to summarize the treatise, it says thus.

original: sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to summarize the treatise, he says, “Thus, etc.”

original: rkyen rnams so so 'am 'dus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rkyen rnams so so 'am 'dus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “conditions, individually or collectively,”

original: dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa rtag pa rnams la'am /
analyzed: dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa rtag pa rnams la'am /
translated: it is not the case that effects arise from permanent entities such as Īśvara or primal matter,🔽or from impermanent entities such as seeds, etc., individually or collectively, that is, from causes that are appropriated, etc.,

original: sa bon la sogs pa rang snang ba mi rtag pa nyid dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams dang / bdag dang sa bon la sogs pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams la'ang /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rang snang ba mi rtag pa nyid dang 'dus pa zhes bya ba nye bar len pa'i rgyu la sogs pa mi rtag pa rnams dang / bdag dang sa bon la sogs pa rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams la'ang /
translated: or from permanent and impermanent entities such as the self, seeds, etc.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la rnam pa bzhi po dag la yang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la rnam pa bzhi po dag la yang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor do they arise from any of the four possibilities with regard to the causes and conditions of what is seen and what is not seen.

original: gzhan nas zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams las gzhan pa las kyang 'ong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nas zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams las gzhan pa las kyang 'ong ba ma yin no //
translated: Nor do they arise from something other than conditions.

original: de ltar ma 'ongs su zin kyang yod par gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs su zin kyang yod par gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if they do not arise in this way, they exist as enduring realities.

original: gnas pa med ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gnas pa med ces bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “They do not endure,”

original: skad cig kyang sdod pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig kyang sdod pa med do //
translated: because they do not endure even for an instant.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba yang med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba yang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no going.

original: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: de bas sgyu ma nyid dang 'di la khyad par du bya ba ci zhig yod na /
analyzed: de bas sgyu ma nyid dang 'di la khyad par du bya ba ci zhig yod na /
translated: What is the difference between that and an illusion?

original: rmongs pa rnams kyis bden pa kho nar brtags shing sgro btags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig yod de med do //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams kyis bden pa kho nar brtags shing sgro btags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig yod de med do //
translated: What form, etc. is imagined and fabricated by the ignorant as real?

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Form, etc. is generated by causes.

original: sgyu ma'i sgyu mas byas pa khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i sgyu mas byas pa khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between that and what is created by an illusory woman?

original: de'i phyir sgyu ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgyu ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “An illusion, etc.”

original: de dag ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pas gnyi ga yang log par yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pas gnyi ga yang log par yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they do not go and come, both are false.

original: de ltar yin yang rkyen las byung ba ni bden pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin yang rkyen las byung ba ni bden pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though that is so, what arises from conditions is real.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “What, etc.”

original: dngos po gang gzhan gang zhig dang nye ba na nges par mthong zhing snang la /
analyzed: dngos po gang gzhan gang zhig dang nye ba na nges par mthong zhing snang la /
translated: What thing is definitely seen and appears when it is near another thing?

original: de med na ni mi mthong bas de ni yod pa ma yin te gzugs brnyan dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de med na ni mi mthong bas de ni yod pa ma yin te gzugs brnyan dang 'dra'o //
translated: If it does not exist, it is not seen, like a reflection.

original: de yang gzugs brnyan ni me long la sogs pa bzhin dang nye ba na snang gi / de med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzugs brnyan ni me long la sogs pa bzhin dang nye ba na snang gi / de med par ni ma yin no //
translated: And that reflection appears in a mirror, etc., in dependence on the proximity of a cause, but not without it.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: gzhan dag la yang rang gi rgyu dang nye ba las yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rang gi rgyu dang nye ba las yin gyi /
translated: it is in dependence on the proximity of its own cause that the reflection of a face, etc., appears in a mirror, etc.,

original: de med par ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med par ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: but not without it.

original: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, “A reflection, etc.”

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen la ltos shing rag las pas bskyed pa ni bcos ma dang 'dra ba yin na /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen la ltos shing rag las pas bskyed pa ni bcos ma dang 'dra ba yin na /
translated: If something is produced in dependence on causes and conditions, it is like a fabrication.

original: de bden zhing yang dag pa nyid du ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: de bden zhing yang dag pa nyid du ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: How could it be real and true?

original: de ltar na rgyu ni yod do zhe na de'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu ni yod do zhe na de'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the cause exists, the root text states, “A thing, etc.”

original: gser la sogs pa'i dngos po rna cha la sogs pa byas par gyur pa'i @86b rgyu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i dngos po rna cha la sogs pa byas par gyur pa'i @86b rgyu yod do zhe na /
translated: You may say that a cause exists for the creation of a thing, such as gold, into something else, such as an earring.

original: bye ba brgya phrag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bye ba brgya phrag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, “A hundred times, etc.”

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir cha shas med par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir cha shas med par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Because it is a nonthing, it is partless.

original: de ltar dngos po med cing bsgyur du med pa'i gnas skabs de'i dngos po ci zhig tu gyur nas dngos po zhes smra ste /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med cing bsgyur du med pa'i gnas skabs de'i dngos po ci zhig tu gyur nas dngos po zhes smra ste /
translated: So, when it is a nonthing and cannot be transformed, what thing is there that could be called a thing?

original: de lta bu'i gnas skabs de dngos po med pa las gzhan pa'i dngos po ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas skabs de dngos po med pa las gzhan pa'i dngos po ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur ba yin /
translated: How could such a state be a thing that is other than a nonthing?

original: yang dag par ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir de las 'dir skad cig mar yod par smra ba dag 'di skad ces dngos po med pa'i dus su 'ga' yang dngos por mi 'gyur ba ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: yang dag par ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir de las 'dir skad cig mar yod par smra ba dag 'di skad ces dngos po med pa'i dus su 'ga' yang dngos por mi 'gyur ba ni bden mod kyi /
translated: In reality, because there are no causes and effects, those who say that things exist as momentary entities say the following: “It is true that when a thing is a nonthing, it does not become a thing.

original: skad cig mar yod do zhes rtog pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig mar yod do zhes rtog pa de'i phyir /
translated: However, because we think that it exists as a momentary entity,

original: med pa'i tshe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: med pa'i tshe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: we say that when it is a nonthing, it is not a thing.”

original: dngos po med pa'i tshe na ni dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshe na ni dngos po med pa nyid yin la /
translated: When it is a nonthing, it is a nonthing.

original: dngos po de dus nam zhig na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po de dus nam zhig na 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When will that thing arise?

original: nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It will never arise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, “Things, etc.”

original: dngos po rnams la skye ba med pa nyid kyi dngos po med cing ma skyes pa dang ni bral zhing tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams la skye ba med pa nyid kyi dngos po med cing ma skyes pa dang ni bral zhing tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Things that are non-arisen, i.e., devoid of intrinsic reality, are not separated from non-arisen, i.e., devoid of intrinsic reality, and do not become different.

original: de dngos po rnams med pa dang ma bral ba nyid kyis dngos po rnams yod cing 'byung ba'i skabs yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dngos po rnams med pa dang ma bral ba nyid kyis dngos po rnams yod cing 'byung ba'i skabs yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not separated from non-existence, there is no opportunity for the existence and origination of things.

original: de ltar re zhig 'ga' yang dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'ga' yang dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Thus, indeed, nothing whatsoever becomes a thing.

original: de ltar na khas len par byed pa dag gi phyir rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar na khas len par byed pa dag gi phyir rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In this way, in order to refute the assertion of the opponent, he says, “Intrinsic reality, etc.”

original: dngos po gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is a thing does not become non-existent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rdzas gcig la dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba der thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzas gcig la dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba der thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: It follows that a single substance would have the nature of both a thing and non-thing.

original: dngos po gcig la dngos po med pa mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis su 'gyur ba na 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la dngos po med pa mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis su 'gyur ba na 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In one thing, the non-thing and the thing are two mutually exclusive properties.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar sdud pa yin no //
translated: Thus, etc. is the summary.

original: de skyed par ma grub na 'gag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de skyed par ma grub na 'gag pa yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the arising is not established, the cessation also does not exist.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du rtag par gyur pa'i dngos po yang mi dmigs shing yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du rtag par gyur pa'i dngos po yang mi dmigs shing yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, in every way, a permanent thing is not perceived and does not exist.

original: rgyu de bas na 'gro ba'i skye bo de dag thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: rgyu de bas na 'gro ba'i skye bo de dag thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: For that reason, all those beings of the world are of the nature of non-arising and non-cessation.

original: 'gro ba rnams zhes bya ba dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / mi dang / lha ste 'gro ba lnga 'am drug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams zhes bya ba dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags dang / mi dang / lha ste 'gro ba lnga 'am drug go //
translated: The worlds are the five or six destinies: hell beings, animals, ghosts, humans, gods, and, as a sixth, the demigods.

original: chu shing bzhin du snying po med ces @87a * //
analyzed: chu shing bzhin du snying po med ces @87a * //
translated: Like a plantain tree, they are without an inner core.

original: bya ba ni chu shing la ral gri la sogs pas gshegs shing rnam par phye nas bltas na sra ba'i snying po ci yang mi rnyed pa dang 'dra bar chos nyid 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni chu shing la ral gri la sogs pas gshegs shing rnam par phye nas bltas na sra ba'i snying po ci yang mi rnyed pa dang 'dra bar chos nyid 'di dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Action is like the plantain tree, for when it is cut down with a sword and the like and examined, no solid core is found at all. These dharmatās are like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: mya ngan 'das dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says “nirvāṇa” and so on.

original: de bas na rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad dang / sred pa la sogs pa thams cad brdzun yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na rnyed pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad dang / sred pa la sogs pa thams cad brdzun yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that all the worldly dharmas of the eight worldly concerns such as gain and so on and craving and so on are false,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “Thus” and so on.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin rnyed par bya ba yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin rnyed par bya ba yang ci zhig yod /
translated: What is there to gain that has such a nature?

original: de bzhin du bstod pa la sogs pas rim gro bya ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du bstod pa la sogs pas rim gro bya ba 'am /
translated: Similarly, what is there to honor with praise and so on?

original: smad pa la sogs pas brnyas par gyur pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa la sogs pas mi dga' ba dang / grags pa la sogs pas dga' ba yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: smad pa la sogs pas brnyas par gyur pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa la sogs pas mi dga' ba dang / grags pa la sogs pas dga' ba yang ci zhig yod /
translated: What is there to despise with blame and so on? What is there to dislike with infamy and so on? What is there to like with fame and so on?

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po 'di ni sred pa las byung bas de'i phyir sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po 'di ni sred pa las byung bas de'i phyir sred pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Since these eight worldly concerns arise from craving, therefore craving is mentioned, etc.

original: sred pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Craving is desire.

original: 'o na mi 'chi ba la sogs pa la sred pa dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi 'chi ba la sogs pa la sred pa dgos so zhe na /
translated: But it is necessary to crave not dying, etc.

original: gson gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gson gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “If you live, etc.”

original: yang 'di na byung bar 'gyur ba'i lus rnams la sred do zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di na byung bar 'gyur ba'i lus rnams la sred do zhe na /
translated: But you crave the bodies that will arise here.

original: de'i phyir su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, “Who, etc.”

original: de ltar na yang gnyen 'dun dang mdza' bshes la sogs pa dang phrad par mngon par 'dod pa la sred do zhe na gnyen gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gnyen 'dun dang mdza' bshes la sogs pa dang phrad par mngon par 'dod pa la sred do zhe na gnyen gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: But you still crave meeting with relatives, friends, etc. He says, “What relatives, etc.”

original: gnyen ni nye du rnams so //
analyzed: gnyen ni nye du rnams so //
translated: Relatives are kinsmen.

original: bshes ni mdza' bo rnams so //
analyzed: bshes ni mdza' bo rnams so //
translated: Friends are acquaintances.

original: de dag thams cad ni yang dag par na ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dngos po med pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni yang dag par na ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra bar dngos po med pa yin pas /
translated: Since all of them are ultimately unborn, they are like space, and are unreal.

original: bdag dang 'dra ba yis zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'di bdag dang skal pa mnyam pa'i don du byas pas des 'di ltar sgyu ma lta bur brtags pas yongs su shes par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra ba yis zhes bya ba ni gzhung 'di bdag dang skal pa mnyam pa'i don du byas pas des 'di ltar sgyu ma lta bur brtags pas yongs su shes par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase by one who is like me means that this treatise is composed for one who is equal to me in fortune. Therefore, one should understand this by examining it as an illusion.

original: de ltar yin na yang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sems ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na yang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi sems ni yod do zhe na /
translated: Even though it is so, there is a mind of pleasure and pain.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says one's own and so on.

original: 'thab pa dang rtsod pa la sogs pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: 'thab pa dang rtsod pa la sogs pa'i rgyus so //
translated: By the cause of fighting, quarreling, and so on.

original: spro ba ni dga' ston la sogs pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: spro ba ni dga' ston la sogs pa'i rgyus so //
translated: By the cause of a festival, and so on.

original: shin tu mi bder 'tsho bar byed //
analyzed: shin tu mi bder 'tsho bar byed //
translated: One lives in great misery.

original: ces bya ba ni mya ngan la sogs pas shin tu nyam thag pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mya ngan la sogs pas shin tu nyam thag pa yin no //
translated: By grief, and so on, one is greatly distressed.

original: rdeg pa ni gzhan la 'khu zhing gnod pa byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa ni gzhan la 'khu zhing gnod pa byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By beating, and so on, one is injured.🔽 By the cause of a festival, and so on, one is happy.

original: ngan 'gro ni dmyal ba la sogs @87b par yang nas yang du ltung nas slar bde 'gror lha'i 'jig rten du skye zhing 'byung ba'i tshul gyis srid pa na 'khor ba dang / g-yang sa mang po ste /
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni dmyal ba la sogs @87b par yang nas yang du ltung nas slar bde 'gror lha'i 'jig rten du skye zhing 'byung ba'i tshul gyis srid pa na 'khor ba dang / g-yang sa mang po ste /
translated: And in the lower realms, such as the hells, again and again, one falls and is reborn in the higher realms, in the world of the gods. In this way, one cycles in existence.🔽And in the many abysses,

original: grang ba dang tsha ba'i dmyal ba bcu drug dang / de'i nye 'khor ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyang dbye bas shin tu mang bar skye ba nas srid pa der de kho na ma yin pa 'di ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba'i dmyal ba bcu drug dang / de'i nye 'khor ba rnams dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags kyang dbye bas shin tu mang bar skye ba nas srid pa der de kho na ma yin pa 'di ni sgyu ma dang 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: one is born in the sixteen cold and hot hells, their neighboring regions, and among animals and hungry ghosts, which are divided into many types. In this existence, this nonreality is like an illusion.

original: der yang phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur pa dag ste /
analyzed: der yang phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur pa dag ste /
translated: And there, there are mutually contradictory things.

original: tsha ba dang / grang ba la sogs pa dang / sems can gzhan dag kyang phan tshun gyi mi mthun par gyur pas gnas pa dang / sred min zhes pa sred pa med par 'gyur ba de srid kyi bar du de kho na nyid ma yin pa 'di med par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tsha ba dang / grang ba la sogs pa dang / sems can gzhan dag kyang phan tshun gyi mi mthun par gyur pas gnas pa dang / sred min zhes pa sred pa med par 'gyur ba de srid kyi bar du de kho na nyid ma yin pa 'di med par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Hot and cold, etc., and other sentient beings are mutually incompatible. As long as one remains in this nonreality, which is without craving, it will not cease to be.

original: sred pa med na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa med na 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no craving, there is no becoming.🔽In that way, in existence, which is full of many abysses, one is weak and feeble, and there, life is short and full of disease.

original: de ltar g-yang sa mang po yod pa'i srid pa der yang nyam chung zhing stobs zhan par gyur pa dang / der yang tshe thung zhing nad mang ba dang / yang der yang gson zhing 'tsho ba dang / nad med pa'i don dang bya ba rnams kyis byis pa 'dres pa'i rgyus 'bras bu med pa kho nar myur du dus 'da' bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar g-yang sa mang po yod pa'i srid pa der yang nyam chung zhing stobs zhan par gyur pa dang / der yang tshe thung zhing nad mang ba dang / yang der yang gson zhing 'tsho ba dang / nad med pa'i don dang bya ba rnams kyis byis pa 'dres pa'i rgyus 'bras bu med pa kho nar myur du dus 'da' bar byed pa yin la /
translated: There, too, one quickly passes away, with no result at all, due to the cause of being mixed up with childish people, in terms of the aims and activities of living, staying alive, and being healthy.

original: der yang sngon nas goms pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bzlog cing dben par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i dus ga la yod de /
analyzed: der yang sngon nas goms pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba bzlog cing dben par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i dus ga la yod de /
translated: And there, too, when is there ever a time for stopping the distractions of former habits and for being in solitude, and for settling the mind in evenness?

original: shin tu rnyed par dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed par dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is extremely difficult to find, is what is meant.

original: der yang bya ba de rnams la brtson par zhugs par gyur kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gi bdud dam /
analyzed: der yang bya ba de rnams la brtson par zhugs par gyur kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gi bdud dam /
translated: And there, too, when one has set out to strive for those aims, the demon of desire-realm sovereignty

original: thams cad du song ba'i bdud kyis lam log par 'jug par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba'i bdud kyis lam log par 'jug par byed pa 'am /
translated: or the demon of omnipresence causes one to enter a false path.

original: the tshom skyed par byed pas rnam pa 'di 'dra bas de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bas 'tsho bas /
analyzed: the tshom skyed par byed pas rnam pa 'di 'dra bas de kho na nyid rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal bas 'tsho bas /
translated: Since it generates doubt, one does not realize thatness through such a form and one lives with suffering.

original: thub par dka' bas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thub par dka' bas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is difficult to overcome, it is said to be difficult to obtain.

original: de ltar bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pas sdig pa chen po la 'jug pas yang nas yang du ngan 'gro rnams su skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir des slar dal 'byor thob pa ni shin tu rnyed par dka' zhing 'khor ba las 'byung ba yang rnyed par dka'
analyzed: de ltar bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pas sdig pa chen po la 'jug pas yang nas yang du ngan 'gro rnams su skye bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir des slar dal 'byor thob pa ni shin tu rnyed par dka' zhing 'khor ba las 'byung ba yang rnyed par dka'
