translated: Thus, since one is empowered by Mara and enters into great evil, one is born again and again in the lower realms. Therefore, it is very difficult to obtain leisure and opportunity again. It is also difficult to escape cyclic existence.

original: ba yin pa dang / der yang sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos sems shing sems mnyam par 'jog pa shin tu yang rnyed par dka' bas 'dod chags pa'i tshogs kyi chu bo rnams ni sdug bsngal bas kyang shin tu bzlog par dka' ba yin no //🔽ae ma'o zhes pa ni @88a * //
analyzed: ba yin pa dang / der yang sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos sems shing sems mnyam par 'jog pa shin tu yang rnyed par dka' bas 'dod chags pa'i tshogs kyi chu bo rnams ni sdug bsngal bas kyang shin tu bzlog par dka' ba yin no // ae ma'o zhes pa ni @88a * //
translated: Moreover, it is very difficult to obtain the appearance of a Buddha and to contemplate and to rest the mind in the true Dharma. Therefore, it is very difficult to overcome the flood of desire and so on, even with suffering.

original: ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: Emaho is a term of amazement.

original: sdug bsngal rgyud ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa las las /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyud ces bya ba ni gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa las las /
translated: The phrase “the continuum of suffering” means that, due to the mental afflictions,🔽there is karma.

original: de las sdug bsngal /
analyzed: de las sdug bsngal /
translated: And due to that, there is suffering.

original: de las kyang nyon mongs pa'i chu ba bzlog dka' ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las kyang nyon mongs pa'i chu ba bzlog dka' ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And due to that, the continuum of mental afflictions arises, which is difficult to reverse.🔽And it is said:

original: de yang 'gro ba thog mtha' dbus med par //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba thog mtha' dbus med par //
translated: Beings, without beginning or end,

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor los 'khor gyur pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor los 'khor gyur pa //
translated: are turned by the wheel of cyclic existence.

original: mgal me bskor ba lta bur ni //
analyzed: mgal me bskor ba lta bur ni //
translated: Like the whirling of a firebrand,

original: phan tshun rgyu can 'khor bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu can 'khor bar 'gyur // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: they revolve in mutual dependence.

original: 'di zhes bya ba la de su zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la de su zhig ce na /
translated: What is this?

original: gang 'di ltar shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas kyang rang sdug bsngal bar gnas par mi mthong gi / gzhan du na rang shin tu bde bar gnas pa yin snyam du sems so //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas kyang rang sdug bsngal bar gnas par mi mthong gi / gzhan du na rang shin tu bde bar gnas pa yin snyam du sems so //
translated: It is the one who, even though abiding in such great suffering, does not see that he or she is abiding in suffering. Instead, he or she thinks that he or she is abiding in great happiness.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal bar gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what way does he or she abide in suffering?

original: dper na rnga mo tsher ma za zhing 'tsho yang bde bar gnas snyam du sems pa de bzhin du thams cad kyang bde bar rlom pa tsam yin pa'i phyir de la gzhan ci yang med do //
analyzed: dper na rnga mo tsher ma za zhing 'tsho yang bde bar gnas snyam du sems pa de bzhin du thams cad kyang bde bar rlom pa tsam yin pa'i phyir de la gzhan ci yang med do //
translated: For example, just as a camel lives by eating thorns and thinks that it is living happily, so also all [beings] merely imagine happiness. Therefore, there is nothing else [but that].

original: bsod nams sprin ni bsod nams kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: bsod nams sprin ni bsod nams kyi phung po'o //
translated: The cloud of merit is a mass of merit.

original: dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa la gnas pas dmigs pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa la gnas pas dmigs pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: Dwelling in the attachment to the object, one engages in the object.

original: sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa ni nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The etc. includes the summary.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste le'u dgu pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i legs par sbyar ba las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ste le'u dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the teaching on the perfection of wisdom in the composition of the Bodhisattva-caryavatara, the ninth chapter.

original: // / bsngo ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ;🔽bdag gis byang chub spyad pa la //
analyzed: // / bsngo ba'i dbang du mdzad nas ; bdag gis byang chub spyad pa la //
translated: With regard to the dedication,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: [The text] states I, having practiced the conduct of enlightenment... and so forth.

original: byang chub ni yon tan dang skyon thams cad 'phel ba dang sgrib pa'i mthar thug pa la gnas pa'i de kho na nyid kyi blo ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni yon tan dang skyon thams cad 'phel ba dang sgrib pa'i mthar thug pa la gnas pa'i de kho na nyid kyi blo ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the mind of suchness that abides in the culmination of the increase of all good qualities and the decrease of faults.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: It is omniscience.

original: de'i spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa byang chub sems kyi phan yon la sogs pa don rnam pa bcu po gang yin pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dag la 'jug pa ni ji skad du bshad pa de bsngo ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de'i spyod pa ni byang chub kyi spyod pa byang chub sems kyi phan yon la sogs pa don rnam pa bcu po gang yin pas sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dag la 'jug pa ni ji skad du bshad pa de bsngo ba dang bcas pa /
translated: The conduct is the conduct of enlightenment, which is the engagement in the levels and the perfections by means of the ten topics, such as the benefits of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: rnam par bsams pa'i zhes bya ba brtsams nas yongs su ma rdzogs pa de ltar gyis yongs su bsngo ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par bsams pa'i zhes bya ba brtsams nas yongs su ma rdzogs pa de ltar gyis yongs su bsngo ba'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of dedication is as follows: Having thought thus, may I not fail to complete that which I have begun.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba'o //
translated: The joy is the mental satisfaction.

original: nyams pa ni 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ni 'jig pa'o //
translated: The failure is the destruction.

original: rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba ni rtag tu'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba ni rtag tu'o //
translated: The unceasing is the constant.🔽Thus, having taught the dedication of the virtue in general for the sake of the world in three verses, he teaches it in terms of the divisions of the world.🔽The worlds are the three worlds of desire, form, and formlessness.🔽 The hells are the eight cold and eight hot hells.🔽 The animals are the animals of the three abodes.

original: de ltar spyir 'gro ba'i don du tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis dge ba yongs su bsngo ba bstan nas 'gro ba dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar spyir 'gro ba'i don du tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis dge ba yongs su bsngo ba bstan nas 'gro ba dbye ba'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The demons are the demons of the three abodes.🔽 The humans are the humans of the four continents.🔽 The gods are the gods of the six classes of gods.🔽 The beings are the beings of the three abodes.🔽 The beings of the three abodes are the beings of the hells, animals, and demons.🔽 The beings of the four continents are the beings of the four continents.🔽 The six classes of gods are the gods of the desire realm.🔽 The three worlds are the three worlds of desire, form, and formlessness.🔽 The three abodes are the abodes of the hells, animals, and demons.🔽 The four continents are the four continents of Jambudvipa, etc.🔽 The six classes of gods are the gods of the desire realm.🔽 The three worlds are the three worlds of desire, form, and formlessness.🔽 The three abodes are the abodes of the hells, animals, and demons.

original: 'jig rten khams na @88b dmyal ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten khams na @88b dmyal ba dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The four continents are the four continents of Jambudvipa, etc.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i stobs kyis lha yi lus thob nas //
analyzed: bdag gi dge ba'i stobs kyis lha yi lus thob nas //
translated: The six classes of gods are the gods of the desire realm.🔽 The three worlds are the three worlds of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: lha mo rnams dang lhan cig dal gyis 'bab gnas shog / ces bya ba de yan chad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo rnams dang lhan cig dal gyis 'bab gnas shog / ces bya ba de yan chad dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Together with the goddesses, may they go to the Land of Bliss.

original: dmyal ba ni yang sos la sogs pa tsha ba dang / chu bur can la sogs pa grang ba dag go //
analyzed: dmyal ba ni yang sos la sogs pa tsha ba dang / chu bur can la sogs pa grang ba dag go //
translated: The hells are the hot ones, such as the Reviving Hell, and the cold ones, such as the Hell of Blisters.

original: 'phags pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas kyi skye ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ston pa'i sa rtag tu bde ba nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bde ba can zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phags pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das snang ba mtha' yas kyi skye ba la sogs pa yang dag pa ston pa'i sa rtag tu bde ba nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bde ba can zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Land of Bliss is so called because it is always endowed with happiness, as is shown by the noble Buddha Amitabha's name.🔽May I delight in that Land of Bliss with its bliss and joy,

original: bde ba can de la bde dags dga' bar shog / byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen las te /
analyzed: bde ba can de la bde dags dga' bar shog / byang chub sems dpa'i sprin chen las te /
translated: from the great clouds of the Bodhisattvas,

original: gang la de las byung ba'i chu bo mtsho mtha' yas kyi chu bo'i tshogs kyis so //
analyzed: gang la de las byung ba'i chu bo mtsho mtha' yas kyi chu bo'i tshogs kyis so //
translated: from which the water of the river Ganga flows.

original: ral gri lo ma'i nags tshal yang //
analyzed: ral gri lo ma'i nags tshal yang //
translated: The forest of sword leaves

original: zhes bya ba spu gri'i so 'phel ba'i dmyal ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba spu gri'i so 'phel ba'i dmyal ba'i lam mo //
translated: is the road to the Reviving Hell, where the leaves are razors.

original: de nyid la shal ma li'i sdong po dag //
analyzed: de nyid la shal ma li'i sdong po dag //
translated: There are also the trees of Shalmali

original: ces bya ba las kyi sgyu mas rdo rje'i tsher ma kha thur du bltas shing rno ba can gyi ri'i shing ni shal ma li'i sdong po'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba las kyi sgyu mas rdo rje'i tsher ma kha thur du bltas shing rno ba can gyi ri'i shing ni shal ma li'i sdong po'o //
translated: The tree of the Śālmali, the tree of the vajra thorns, is the mountain of the thorns of the vajra, with their sharp points turned downward.

original: brgya byin gyi skyed mos tshal dga' ba'i tshal der /
analyzed: brgya byin gyi skyed mos tshal dga' ba'i tshal der /
translated: In the garden of Indra, the garden of pleasure,🔽may there be the tree of paradise.

original: dpag bsam shing du 'khrungs par shog / mthong ril la sogs pa'i bya de dag ni skad snyan 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam shing du 'khrungs par shog / mthong ril la sogs pa'i bya de dag ni skad snyan 'byin pa ste /
translated: The birds, the peacocks, etc., are the sweet-sounding voices;🔽may they be beautiful with their sweet songs.

original: skad snyan sgrogs pas mdzes 'gyur shog / shin tu ring du song ba nyid kyi phyir padma ste /
analyzed: skad snyan sgrogs pas mdzes 'gyur shog / shin tu ring du song ba nyid kyi phyir padma ste /
translated: The lotus is the one who has gone very far;

original: chu skyes dri bsung che ldan gang la yod pa'i mtsho de dag gis /
analyzed: chu skyes dri bsung che ldan gang la yod pa'i mtsho de dag gis /
translated: the lakes which have the great fragrance of the water-born🔽may they be delightful in the regions of the hells.

original: dmyal ba'i sa phyogs dag ni nyams dgar shog / sol phung ni me ma mur gyi dmyal ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i sa phyogs dag ni nyams dgar shog / sol phung ni me ma mur gyi dmyal ba'i lam mo //
translated: The heap of coals is the path of the Saṃjīva hell.

original: sa bsregs ni tsha ba la sogs pa'i dmyal ba'i'o //🔽bsdus 'joms ri bo rnams kyang ni //
analyzed: sa bsregs ni tsha ba la sogs pa'i dmyal ba'i'o //🔽bsdus 'joms ri bo rnams kyang ni //
translated: The burnt earth is the path of the Tapana hell, etc.🔽The mountains of the Saṃghāta hell

original: zhes bya ba la bsdus 'joms zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba chen po na lug lta bu'i ri chen po rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bsdus 'joms zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba chen po na lug lta bu'i ri chen po rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The crusher is a great mountain in the great hell that is like a sheep.

original: mdag me la sogs pa'i char ni gshin rje'i skyes bu la sogs pas phab pa'o //
analyzed: mdag me la sogs pa'i char ni gshin rje'i skyes bu la sogs pas phab pa'o //
translated: The rain of burning coals and so on is dropped by the messengers of Yama.

original: bskal pa zad pa'i da ltar yang mtshon gyis 'thab pa dmyal ba rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir bstan to //
analyzed: bskal pa zad pa'i da ltar yang mtshon gyis 'thab pa dmyal ba rjes su byed pa nyid kyi phyir bstan to //
translated: Even at the end of the eon, the present war of weapons is taught because it imitates hell.

original: chu bo rab med ni dmyal ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: chu bo rab med ni dmyal ba'i lam mo //
translated: The unfordable river is the path of hell.

original: lha mo rnams ni lha'i bud med dag go //
analyzed: lha mo rnams ni lha'i bud med dag go //
translated: The goddesses are the celestial women.

original: dal gyis 'bab pa ni mtho ris kyi chu bo gangg'a ste /
analyzed: dal gyis 'bab pa ni mtho ris kyi chu bo gangg'a ste /
translated: The Ganga is the heavenly river.

original: de la gnas par shog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dmyal ba rnams la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas par shog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dmyal ba rnams la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The thought May they be there and so on is the imagination of the hell beings.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //🔽kun nas mun pa ni kun nas @89a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la // kun nas mun pa ni kun nas @89a * //
translated: Why? and so on.

original: smag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: smag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The all-encompassing darkness is the all-encompassing gloom.

original: de ko su'i mthu snyam ste //
analyzed: de ko su'i mthu snyam ste //
translated: Who is the power of that?

original: gyen du bltas na nam mkha'i dkyil na phyag na rdo rje 'bar ba bzhugs mthong nas /
analyzed: gyen du bltas na nam mkha'i dkyil na phyag na rdo rje 'bar ba bzhugs mthong nas /
translated: Looking up, he sees Vajrapani blazing in the middle of the sky.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i shugs kyis sdig dang bral nas te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i shugs kyis sdig dang bral nas te /
translated: Having been freed from sin by the force of great joy,

original: sdig pa spangs par gyur nas /
analyzed: sdig pa spangs par gyur nas /
translated: having abandoned sin,

original: bdag ni dge ba'i stobs kyis phyag na rdo rje de dang lhan cig 'gro bar shog / ces bshad zin pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag ni dge ba'i stobs kyis phyag na rdo rje de dang lhan cig 'gro bar shog / ces bshad zin pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: may I go together with Vajrapani by the power of virtue.

original: me tog char pa spos chu dang 'dres 'bab pa yis //
analyzed: me tog char pa spos chu dang 'dres 'bab pa yis //
translated: Seeing the rain of flowers falling mixed with perfumed water,

original: dmyal ba'i me mdag chil chil gsod pa mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i me mdag chil chil gsod pa mthong gyur nas //
translated: extinguishing the burning coals of the hells,

original: zhes rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: zhes rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba na /
translated: when one has such thoughts,

original: glo bur bde bas tshim pa 'di ci snyam na /🔽sems can dmyal ba rnams kyis lag na padma ste /
analyzed: glo bur bde bas tshim pa 'di ci snyam na / sems can dmyal ba rnams kyis lag na padma ste /
translated: what is this sudden satisfaction of bliss?🔽May the hell beings see Avalokitesvara with lotuses in their hands.

original: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong bar shog / de ltar rdo rje dang padma'i rigs bstan nas /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug mthong bar shog / de ltar rdo rje dang padma'i rigs bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the Vajra and Lotus families in this way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the Tathagata family,

original: grogs po dag 'jigs pa bor la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grogs po dag 'jigs pa bor la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “Friends, cast away fear” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal ni phongs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni phongs pa'o //
translated: Suffering is misfortune.

original: brtse ba yang bdag la skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: brtse ba yang bdag la skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: Compassion is also born in me.

original: gang la dbu'i zur phud mnga' ba de ni gzhon nu zur phud can no //
analyzed: gang la dbu'i zur phud mnga' ba de ni gzhon nu zur phud can no //
translated: He who has a lock of hair on his forehead is the Youth with the Forelock.

original: zhabs kyi padma ni zhabs so //
analyzed: zhabs kyi padma ni zhabs so //
translated: The lotus of his feet is his feet.

original: thugs rjes brlan pa'i spyan gang la mnga' ba de ni thugs rjes brlan spyan no //
analyzed: thugs rjes brlan pa'i spyan gang la mnga' ba de ni thugs rjes brlan spyan no //
translated: He who has eyes moistened with compassion has eyes moistened with compassion.

original: dbu la me tog du ma'i tshogs kyis char phab pa gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbu la me tog du ma'i tshogs kyis char phab pa gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: He who has a rain of many flowers falling on his head is so called.

original: khang brtsegs yid 'ong lha mo stong phrag bstod dbyangs sgrogs ldan te /
analyzed: khang brtsegs yid 'ong lha mo stong phrag bstod dbyangs sgrogs ldan te /
translated: The delightful palace resounds with the praises of thousands of goddesses.

original: de lta bur ni mtshan nyid rnam par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis 'jam pa'i dbyangs de 'dra mthong nas /
analyzed: de lta bur ni mtshan nyid rnam par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyis 'jam pa'i dbyangs de 'dra mthong nas /
translated: Having seen Manjusri in this way, with such characteristics and with such a nature,

original: grogs dag 'jigs pa bor la tshur sheg  ces bya ba la sogs pa smra ba la /
analyzed: grogs dag 'jigs pa bor la tshur sheg  ces bya ba la sogs pa smra ba la /
translated: he says to his friends, Throw off your fear and come here!🔽Now let the hells resound with cries of joy!

original: da ni sems dmyal ku co 'don par shog / dmyal ba'i 'gro ba'i mjug bsdu ba ni //
analyzed: da ni sems dmyal ku co 'don par shog / dmyal ba'i 'gro ba'i mjug bsdu ba ni //
translated: The conclusion of the section on the hell realms

original: de ltar bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus I have seen the Bodhisattva Manjusri, who is the essence of all Buddhas, and who is the essence of all the Dharmas of the Sutras, Tantras, and so forth.

original: dud 'gro'i 'gro ba ni dud 'gro rnams ni gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: dud 'gro'i 'gro ba ni dud 'gro rnams ni gcig la gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: The animal realm is stated with “may animals have no mutual fear” and so on.

original: 'di man chad bdag gi bsod nams 'di yis ni zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyor ro //🔽yi dvags kyi 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: 'di man chad bdag gi bsod nams 'di yis ni zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba dang sbyor ro // yi dvags kyi 'gro ba ni /
translated: From here on, “by this merit of mine” is connected with what follows.

original: sgra mi snyan pa'i mi bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa'i mi bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ghost realm is stated with “like the humans of Kuru in the north” and so on.

analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang gi / zhes bya ba ni khong du chud par sla'o // @89b mi'i 'gro ba ni /
translated: “Noble Avalokiteśvara” is easy to understand.

original: long ba rnams kyis mig mthong shog / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: long ba rnams kyis mig mthong shog / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The human realm is stated with “may the blind see this form” and so on.

original: phan pa dang / bcas pas kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang / bcas pas kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: It is faultless because it is beneficial.

original: skrag pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga ni rtogs sla'o //
analyzed: skrag pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lnga ni rtogs sla'o //
translated: The five verses beginning with “may those who are frightened” are easy to understand.

original: lha'i 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: lha'i 'gro ba ni //
translated: The god realm is stated with “may those in the lower god realms” and so on.

original: mi dal kun las thar pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mi dal kun las thar pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: ji srid du thams cad nam mkha'i mdzod bzhin du 'am /
analyzed: ji srid du thams cad nam mkha'i mdzod bzhin du 'am /
translated: As long as all beings are like the sky treasury,

original: 'phags pa nor bzangs bzhin du longs spyod chad pa med par shog / nam mkha' ma lus pa'i mdzod gang la mnga' ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i mdzod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa nor bzangs bzhin du longs spyod chad pa med par shog / nam mkha' ma lus pa'i mdzod gang la mnga' ba de ni byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i mdzod do //
translated: The bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha is the one who possesses the treasury of the entire sky.

original: des gang dang gang don du gnyer ba de dang de nam mkha' las blangs nas sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: des gang dang gang don du gnyer ba de dang de nam mkha' las blangs nas sbyin par mdzad do //
translated: Whatever anyone needs, he takes from the sky and gives it to them.

original: rtsod pa med cing ca co med pa ni rtsod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa med cing ca co med pa ni rtsod pa med pa'o //
translated: Free from strife and clamor, he is the one who is free from strife.🔽May they be the ones who have mastery over their own conduct and activities.

original: rang dbang du spyod cing 'jug pa gang la yod pa de dag ni rang dbang du spyod par shog / gzi brjid chung ba ni gzi mdangs chung ba'o //
analyzed: rang dbang du spyod cing 'jug pa gang la yod pa de dag ni rang dbang du spyod par shog / gzi brjid chung ba ni gzi mdangs chung ba'o //
translated: Those who are weak in splendor are those who have little radiance.🔽May they be free from pride.

original: nga rgyal dag kyang bcom par shog / ces bya ba ni nga rgyal byed par ma gyur cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal dag kyang bcom par shog / ces bya ba ni nga rgyal byed par ma gyur cig ces pa'o //
translated: This means that they should not be proud.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

analyzed: bdag gi bsod nams kyis sems can rnams 'di lta bu'i rnam par gyur te /

analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu nyid ni 'di nyid yod na yang /

analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bdag po dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyud gzhan la yod ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The environmental effect and the effect of conscious creation are in other continuums.

original: bdag gi bsod nams 'di yis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi bsod nams 'di yis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning, “By this merit of mine, may all beings.

analyzed: bdag gi bsod nams kyis bdag gi gtso bo'i stobs kyis sdig pa thams cad de ma lus par spangs nas ni'o //
translated: By the power of my merit, may all beings, without exception, abandon all evil.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa ni khong du chud par sla'o //

analyzed: de ltar dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'i dbye bas gzhan dag gi mngon par mthong ba'i don du yongs su bsngos nas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par dgongs pa'i don dang / chos yang dag par longs spyod pa'i don du /
translated: for the sake of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas’ correct intention and for the sake of the Dharma’s correct enjoyment,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa dag gis de ltar sngo bar byed do //
translated: he dedicates in this way with the worship of the Buddhas.

analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing ji lta bur gyur pa zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?🔽It is filled with the Buddhas and

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ni sangs rgyas sras //

analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i chos snyan @90a * // sgrogs pas gang ba yis so //

analyzed: gseg ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni tsher ma la sogs pa gzung ngo //

analyzed: bee d'urya'i rang bzhin ni rin po che bee d'urya'i khang pa'o //
translated: The line with lapis lazuli refers to the lapis lazuli mansions.

original: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste /
analyzed: 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste /

analyzed: ka tsa lin da'i gos ltar reg na 'jam pa'o //

translated: with many bodhisattvas.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khong du chud par sla'o ;

analyzed: / yang mi rnams ni gtso bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir mthong ba'i chos kyi bde ba'i don du /
translated: Since humans are the most important, the bodhisattva

analyzed: lha yang dus su char 'bebs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis sngo bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The three verses beginning with “The gods will rain down at the right time” are the dedication.

analyzed: khong du chud par sla'o // klog pa dang kha ton gyis rgyas shing /

analyzed: dar ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: sems can kun gyis lan mang du zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas sngo bar byed pa yin te /
